bio: Viktoria Ivanová studied management and finance but found her way into IT by chance through her love of data. She began as a data analyst, progressed to leading the entire Business Intelligence department. She then took the opportunity to shift her career trajectory and applied for the role of VP of Consumer & IoT, a position she now holds. She is a strong advocate for inclusion and is helping others to overcome their fears and barriers, empowering them to grow with confidence. She does this through a women's employee resource group that she has founded and mentoring young women aspiring to enter the IT field or take on leadership roles. She also writes a newsletter and hosts a video podcast, where she openly discusses topics related to soft skills, well-being, and mental health.

bio: Randy Rose has 22+ years of experience across local, state, and federal government. He leads Security Operations & Intelligence at the Center for Internet Security. He oversees the execution of CIS' Security Operations Center, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Cyber Incident Response, and Cyber Red Team missions. Previously, he led the largest Joint DoD Security Operations Center in Europe and headed the Intelligence Department for the Navy's Defensive Cyber Operations Task Force. After serving as an active duty airman in the US Air Force, he became New York State’s first local government-focused penetration tester. With an academic foundation in anthropology, political science, and cybersecurity, Randy focuses on the human side of security, strategic partnerships, and leadership that empowers.

bio: Assaf Morag is a Cybersecurity Researcher and Threat Intelligence Consultant, working with Flare on research focused on underground ecosystems, attacker infrastructure, and the evolving cyberthreat landscape. His work translates adversary activity from open, deep, and dark-web sources into actionable intelligence for security teams and the software development life cycle. Previously, Assaf served as Director of Threat Intelligence at Aqua Security and held senior intelligence roles at BlueVoyant and IBM Security. His research has been featured in leading cybersecurity publications and presented at major industry conferences. He contributed to the MITRE ATT&CK® Container Framework and authored an O’Reilly course on cloud-native cyber threat intelligence.

bio: Eyal Paz is the VP of Research at OX Security, a software supply chain security leader. His work includes hands-on security research toward a holistic DevSecOps solution. Before joining OX Security, Eyal spent 11 years at Check Point working on security research for product innovation in application security, malware analysis, and phishing prevention. Eyal is also a sought-after University Lecturer on various cybersecurity topics. He has a Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering and a Master's degree in Computer Science. Currently, he is a PhD candidate, researching the problem of encrypted traffic classification.

bio: Tim Brown joined SolarWinds in 2017 as Vice President of Security and is now the CISO for SolarWinds. After the SUNBURST attack in December 2020, Tim led the response and remediation efforts. Tim has spoken to thousands of customers and has been instrumental in all customer remediation support and services. He has worked closely with the SolarWinds® CEO in designing the future state of security and their “Secure by Design” philosophy. This new philosophy on software design will not only benefit SolarWinds but the industry as a whole, and it sets a precedent for responses to future cyberattacks. He’s also an avid inventor and holds 18 issued patents.

bio: James Trainor is Senior Vice President at LevelBlue, where he helps clients manage complex cyber and technology risks. He joined the private sector after a distinguished career at the Federal Bureau of Investigation, culminating as the Assistant Director of the Cyber Division at FBI Headquarters. In this senior executive role, James was responsible for all cyber investigations and played a critical part in devising the FBI’s national strategy to combat cybercrime. He led FBI agents and analysts through every major high-profile cyber investigation during his tenure. For his service, he is a recipient of the prestigious Presidential Rank Award from the Office of the President of the United States.

bio: Arushi Singh is a second-year Electrical and Computer Engineering student at the University of Texas at Austin with a focus on AI, machine learning, and cybersecurity. She has gained hands-on experience through roles at Tenet Healthcare, WhitegloveAI, Reliable Technology Solutions, Geoforce, and Frisco ISD, spanning detection engineering, network security, AI content strategy, and threat hunting. An award-winning communicator, Arushi is a national DECA champion, published Author of "Dev the Cyberhero," and an advocate for making technology accessible to younger students. Her research includes securing RAG-based LLM pipelines, and she actively volunteers to inspire the next generation in STEM and cybersecurity. LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/arushixsingh

bio: Renato Malvezzi holds a degree in Computer Science, is certified by IBSEC, and completed an academic exchange program in Canada. With over 15 years of experience in cybersecurity, IT governance, and risk management, he currently leads security initiatives at Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre, one of Brazil’s largest public teaching hospitals. His work focuses on incident response, resilience, and aligning technology with healthcare needs, ensuring both patient safety and operational continuity. Renato actively participates in projects that integrate best practices with real-world challenges, bridging the gap between technical solutions and strategic goals.
companyName: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre

bio: Premkumar Thomas Augustine (Prem) is a Seasoned IT leader with extensive experience in software development and testing, Information Security, compliance, cloud engineering and operations, and IT management. Proven track record in establishing and maintaining security strategies, policies, and programs to protect information assets. Strong background in healthcare industry regulations, including HIPAA compliance and cybersecurity threats. Adept at leading cross-functional teams and collaborating with executive leadership to safeguard sensitive information and mitigate risks. Currently working as VP, Engineering Services and CISO, with prior work engagements with Wolters Kluwer, UST Global, ADP, Entertainment Partners, Intuit, Anthem. Prem is based out of Los Angeles.

bio: Chris Hickman is the Chief Security Officer at Keyfactor. As a member of the senior management team, Chris is responsible for establishing and maintaining Keyfactor’s leadership position as a world-class, technical organization with deep security industry expertise. Chris has worked on PKI projects for organizations and firms including NATO, both the US and Canadian Departments of Defense, Fortune 100 banks and financial institutions, manufacturers, insurance companies, telecommunication providers, and retailers. He continues to be a trusted resource for enterprises looking to leverage digital certificates within existing portfolios and new product development.

bio: Sasi Levi has spent over ten years as a software engineer and 14 years in the security industry and bug bounty community. Along the way, Sasi hacked and reported vulnerabilities in companies like Google, Facebook, Twitter, and PayPal. Sasi has been recognized in the Top 10 of Google’s Bug Rewards Program and PayPal’s leaderboard. Sasi's passion is combining hands-on hacking with deep technical expertise to help make the internet safer for everyone.

bio: Diana Kelley is Chief Information Security Officer at Noma Security and serves on boards including WiCyS, Executive Women's Forum (EWF), InfoSec World, and CyberFuture Foundation. Previously, she was CISO at Protect AI, Cybersecurity CTO for Microsoft, Global Executive Security Advisor at IBM Security, GM at Symantec, and VP at Burton Group (now Gartner). Diana is a 2023 Global Cyber Security Hall of Fame Inductee, one of AuditBoard's Top 25 Resilient CISOs in 2024, EWF 2020 Executive of the Year and Conference Chair (2021-Present), and one of Cybersecurity Ventures 100 Fascinating Females Fighting Cybercrime. She is a sought-after Keynote speaker, co-author of "Practical Cybersecurity Architecture", and a LinkedIn Learning instructor.

bio: SuryaPrakash Nalluri is a globally recognized cybersecurity leader and independent researcher with 20+ years of experience advancing secure digital ecosystems. With a foundation in Computer Science and a Masters in Information Security, he began his career as a Java developer and ethical hacker before progressing into enterprise security leadership. He has led DevSecOps and Secure SDLC initiatives delivering measurable improvements to organizational security posture. His expertise spans security governance, architecture, and software lifecycle integration. His research focuses on AI-driven security, Zero Trust architectures, and quantum-resilient cybersecurity. He is an active open source contributor, conference and journal judge, and frequent international speaker.
globalBio: SuryaPrakash Nalluri is a globally recognized cybersecurity leader and independent researcher with 20+ years of experience advancing secure digital ecosystems. He is an active open source contributor, conference and journal judge, and frequent international speaker.

bio: Shaun serves as SVP, Chief Information Security Officer at PayPal, leading global cybersecurity, product security, technology and cyber risk, and resilience strategy. He partners with product and engineering teams to enable secure, high-velocity innovation to advance PayPal's mission to be the most trusted partner for digital payments and commerce worldwide. Prior to joining PayPal, Shaun served as the CISO for Discover Financial Services. He has experience at world-leading financial services institutions and top US government agencies. Shaun is a graduate of the University of Maryland and has an MBA from the George Washington University School of Business. He serves on the board of the Kohl Children’s Museum and is an adjunct professor at Carnegie Mellon University.

He partners with product and engineering teams to enable secure, high-velocity innovation to advance PayPal's mission to be the most trusted partner for digital payments and commerce worldwide. Prior to joining PayPal, Shaun served as the CISO for Discover Financial Services. He has experience at world-leading financial services institutions and top US government agencies. Shaun is a graduate of the University of Maryland and has an MBA from the George Washington University School of Business. He serves on the board of the Kohl Children’s Museum and is an adjunct professor at Carnegie Mellon University.

bio: Saurabh Chaudhary is a GCFA-certified Senior Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst at a Fortune 500 company, with over eight years of experience protecting global banks and large enterprises from advanced cyberthreats. He specializes in malware analysis, dark web investigations, adversary tracking, and Purple Team threat hunting. Saurabh holds a Master’s in Cybersecurity and a Bachelor’s in Computer Science Engineering. He has published research on ransomware, malware, and cyber espionage, and has delivered trainings and talks at top international conferences, including DEFCON Blue Team Village, BSides SATX, Texas Cybersecurity Summit, BSides Budapest, and OWASP AppSec Indonesia.

bio: Dr. Pablo Breuer is an OASIS Board Member and an executive at a publicly traded Fortune 50 company. A veteran of the Navy, Pablo’s tours included top-level positions at US Special Operations Command Donovan Group, SOFWERX, the NSA, US Cyber Command, and US Naval Forces Central Command. He is a DoD Cyber Cup and Defcon Black Badge winner and has taught at the Naval Postgraduate School, National University, California State University Monterey Bay, and Carnegie Mellon CERT/SEI. Pablo is the co-founder of the Cognitive Security Collaborative and coauthor of the "Disinformation Analysis and Response Measures" framework, the methodology used by the US, EU governments, and NATO. He is a sought-after speaker in the fields of cybersecurity, mis- and disinformation, and protecting critical assets.
globalBio: Dr. Pablo Breuer is an OASIS Board Member and an executive at a publicly traded Fortune 50 company. A veteran of the Navy, Pablo’s tours included top-level positions at US Special Operations Command Donovan Group, SOFWERX, the NSA, US Cyber Command, and US Naval Forces Central Command. He is a DoD Cyber Cup and Defcon Black Badge winner and has taught at the Naval Postgraduate School, National University, California State University Monterey Bay, and Carnegie Mellon CERT/SEI. Pablo is the co-founder of the Cognitive Security Collaborative and coauthor of the "Disinformation Analysis and Response Measures" framework, the methodology used by the US, EU governments, and NATO. He is a sought-after speaker in the fields of cybersecurity, mis- and disinformation, and protecting critical assets.

bio: Jonathan Davis (JD) has over 25 years of experience in technology. Early career exposure to Love Bug, Sandmind, SQL Slammer, and Blaster reinforced the importance of security when engineering new solutions. Today he spends the majority of his time consulting and teaching on topics surrounding Wi-Fi and other wireless protocols from system architecture, RF design, and various security topics including WPA3. JD loves digging into the details: RF Physics, RFCs and standards, or packet captures, and then finding ways to make that information approachable, digestible, and most importantly applicable to other practitioners. Whether engineering new solutions, leading teams, or teaching, JD brings energy and vision to every project.

bio: Author, speaker, and 20-year tech veteran, Jennifer (JJ) Minella has been helping security-conscious organizations solve network security challenges in meaningful ways. Combining master level network architecture skills with CISO and compliance experience, she continues this mission as Founder and Principal Advisor of Viszen Security. JJ has led strategic research and consulting for government, education, and mid-market up to Fortune-rated organizations. She's a published author, internationally recognized speaker, Analyst with IANS, and former Board Member and Chairperson of ISC2. JJ is also known for introducing mindfulness-based leadership to individuals and organizations in infosec. Look for her latest top selling book "Wireless Security Architecture."
globalBio: Jennifer Jabbusch, now Jennifer Minella, is VP of Engineering and Consulting Engineer with Carolina Advanced Digital, Inc. With more than 15 years’ experience working in various areas of the technology industry, Minella’s most recent focus is in specialized areas of infrastructure security, including network access control (NAC), 802.1X, wireless security technologies and SCADA/ICS and DCS. She consults for a variety of government agencies, educational institutions and Fortune 100 and 500 corporations. In addition to being an author of the (ISC)2 Official CISSP she is also a cover co-author of “Low Tech Hacking".

bio: Vyas Sekar is the Tan Family Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering in the ECE Department at CMU. He is a member of CMU Cylab, where he co directs The Future of Enterprise Security Initiative. He is also co-founder and Chief Technologist at Rockfish Data, and the Chief Scientist at Conviva. His research is at the intersection of networks, systems, and security. His work has been recognized with the SIGCOMM Rising Star Award, NSA Science of Security prize, the Intel Outstanding Researcher Award, the SIGCOMM Test of Time Award, and multiple best paper awards.

bio: Dino Boukouris is the Founder & Managing Partner at Altitude Cyber, a strategic advisory firm to cybersecurity founders, start-ups, investors, and their boards. Previously, Dino was Managing Director and Co-Founder at Momentum Cyber. Dino has spent over two decades in the technology industry advising CEOs and boards of companies at all stages of their lifecycle. He has expertise in M&A, cybersecurity, finance, strategy, operations, entrepreneurship, and venture capital and private equity. Dino has advised dozens of companies through successful exits, capital raises, recapitalizations, and more. Dino has taught and mentored at UC Berkeley Haas School of Business' MBA program for Venture Capital & Private Equity, Business Model Innovation, Entrepreneurial Strategy, and Managerial Economics.

bio:
As the lead investigator Jethro is heading up Cybercrime Atlas Investigations for this World Economic Forum powered initiative.
Outside this voluntary job he is an active member of several communities in relation to fighting cybercrime and fraud and is working at ING Bank where he is responsible for Anti-fraud.
He has an extensive experience in Cyber Crime, Fraud, Cyber Security, (counter) Intelligence, Red Teaming, Incident Response and Risk Management.

bio: Paul Vann is a seasoned cybersecurity and AI professional, with experience across numerous emerging markets in the field. He is currently the Co-Founder of Validia, a company specializing in preventing generative AI misuse. He has worked at a wide array of cybersecurity and software development startups, with a specific focus on innovative technologies and automating previously manual processes. Paul is passionate about emerging technologies in the space and has spoken at over 15 conferences, leading to him being recognized as a Top-rated Speaker at the RSAC Conference in 2023.

bio: Ram Shankar Siva Kumar is Data Cowboy and founder of Microsoft's AI Red Team to help the company develop and deploy ML systems securely. His work has appeared in industry venues like RSAC, BlackHat, Defcon, BSidesLV, and academic venues like NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, IEEE S&P, and Harvard Business Review. His work has been featured in Bloomberg, Wired, VentureBeat, Business Insider, and GeekWire. He graduated with two Master’s degrees from CMU and is currently an Affiliate at the Berkman Klein Center at Harvard University and Technical Advisory Board Member at University of Washington. He is currently working on his book "Not With A Bang But With A Sticker" with Hyrum Anderson on why securing AI systems from adversaries is the next important infosec imperative of our times.

bio: Neal Jetton leads the INTERPOL Global Cybercrime Programme which aims to reduce the global impact of cybercrime through the enhancement of cyberthreat response, the coordination of cybercrime operations, and the development of cyber strategies and capabilities. Prior to joining INTERPOL, he served in leadership positions prioritizing the coordination of cybercrime investigations with a global network of law enforcement partners, as well as the advancing of cyber policies and strategies. These efforts have allowed for more robust capabilities to impose costs to cybercriminals and bring justice to their victims.

These efforts have allowed for more robust capabilities to impose costs to cybercriminals and bring justice to their victims.

bio: Paolo De Rosa is a digital transformation expert passionate about using technology and economics to drive social and political progress. Former Chief Technology Officer for the Italian Government (2018–2022), he focused on digital identity, cybersecurity, and cloud innovation. He now leads technical development at the European Commission on trust services and the European Digital Identity Wallet, advancing both technological and societal innovation.

bio: Michael Daniel is President & CEO of the Cyber Threat Alliance (CTA), a not-for-profit membership association that enables cyberthreat information sharing among cybersecurity organizations. Prior to CTA, Michael served as US Cybersecurity Coordinator, leading US cybersecurity policy development both domestically and internationally, facilitating US government partnerships with the private sector, and coordinating significant incident response activities. Michael also worked for the Office of Management and Budget, overseeing funding for the US Intelligence Community. He works with the Aspen Cybersecurity Group, the World Economic Forum’s Global Future Council on Cybersecurity, the Partnership Against Cybercrime, and other organizations improving cybersecurity in the digital ecosystem.
globalBio: Michael Daniel is President & CEO of the Cyber Threat Alliance (CTA), a not-for-profit membership association that enables cyberthreat information sharing among cybersecurity organizations. Prior to CTA, Michael served as US Cybersecurity Coordinator, leading US cybersecurity policy development both domestically and internationally, facilitating US government partnerships with the private sector, and coordinating significant incident response activities. Michael also worked for the Office of Management and Budget, overseeing funding for the US Intelligence Community. He works with the Aspen Cybersecurity Group, the World Economic Forum’s Global Future Council on Cybersecurity, the Partnership Against Cybercrime, and other organizations improving cybersecurity in the digital ecosystem.

bio: Paula Januszkiewicz is a cybersecurity expert, Founder & CEO of CQURE & CQURE Academy (she solely established in 2008), a cybersecurity consulting company that conducts advanced penetration testing and global cybersecurity consulting. She is the Enterprise Security Microsoft MVP, Microsoft Regional Director. Paula is also rated a top speaker at global conferences like  RSAC (her 2025 speech was voted as a top-rated session, in 2019 she keynoted, and in 2017 her two sessions were amongst the five hottest presentations), and Black Hat (in 2019 her presentation was voted best of Black Hat Asia 2019 Briefing), Microsoft Ignite (No 1 Speaker), keynotes and sessions at AISA, GITEC, GISEC, LEAP, and SecTor. She is Harvard Business School Alumni and has access to Windows source code.

bio: Caroline Wong is the Chief Strategy Officer at Axari, “The AI Staff That Gets the Work Done,” with over two decades of experience in GRC, product security, and cybersecurity leadership. A recognized expert, she is the author of "The AI Cybersecurity Handbook" and "Security Metrics: A Beginner’s Guide." She has held leadership roles at eBay, Zynga, Symantec, Cobalt, and Teradata, driving security innovation and risk management strategies. Caroline is also a LinkedIn Learning instructor, educating professionals on cybersecurity best practices and resilience in an evolving threat landscape.

bio: Ashwin Rajendra is a cybersecurity leader specializing in agentic AI, detection engineering, and large scale security automation. As Manager of Detection & Automation Engineering at Kimberly Clark, he builds autonomous defense systems that blend AI driven reasoning with scalable SOC workflows. With 14+ years across incident response, threat intelligence, forensics, and SOC engineering, he has designed enterprise detection pipelines and automated playbooks for phishing, malware, and remediation. His recent work focuses on using agentic AI to coordinate cross platform signals, enrich alerts, and trigger context driven actions that accelerate end to end security operations.

bio: Mr. David Dalling is a subject matter expert with over 20 years of IT operations and Security experience. He is an accomplished versatile IT professional in a variety of IT fields ranging from hands-on systems development and management to enterprise-level strategic planning. David helped get the DHS Enterprise SOC program its first ever ATO, wrote the first ever common control package for DHS, received a security engineering award for developing a SOC metrics program that contributed to DHS first ever perfect score card. David led the development of the first ever Managed XDR service to receive its FedRAMP Authorization. David joined Splunk after being the Cyber CTO for AFS and now is the GVP of Global Cyber Strategy where he helps drive the strategy and go to market efforts for Splunk.

bio: John Kindervag is considered one of the world’s foremost cybersecurity experts. He is best known for creating the revolutionary Zero Trust Model of Cybersecurity. As Chief Evangelist at Illumio, John is responsible for accelerating awareness and adoption of Zero Trust Segmentation. Previously, John was an SVP at On2IT, the Field CTO at Palo Alto Networks, and a VP & Principal Analyst at Forrester Research. In 2021, John was named to the President’s National Security Telecommunications Advisory Committee Zero Trust Sub-Committee and was a primary Author of the "NSATC Zero Trust" report. He was also named CISO Magazine’s Cybersecurity Person of the Year that same year. John is an Advisor to several organizations, including the Cloud Security Alliance.

bio: Ofir Arkin is a renowned authority in the field of Information Security with a career that has bridged academia, consulting, and executive management positions. He is deeply passionate about building great products that solve real customer problems. Ofir has a strong reputation for bringing cutting edge technology to market, in which several of these had been industry firsts. Ofir is dedicated to mentoring and growing people. He is the author of numerous research papers, advisories and influential articles, and a recognized voice on the Information Security lecture circuit.

bio: David Molnar is an Engineering Manager at Meta, focused on building AI and automation that prevents security problems at scale so everyone can safely move faster. David has worked in cryptography, security, and privacy for over 25 years and been fortunate to work with great people during that time. In addition to the Test of Time awarded work, he's built a privacy preserving augmented reality browser (SurroundWeb), created cloud intelligent security testing products (SAGE and Microsoft Security Risk Detection), and designed novel algorithms for private authentication of radio frequency identification devices. David graduated with a PhD from the University of California, Berkeley in 2009.
globalBio: David Molnar is an Engineering Manager at Meta, focused on building AI and automation that prevents security problems at scale so everyone can safely move faster. David has worked in cryptography, security, and privacy for over 25 years and been fortunate to work with great people during that time. In addition to the Test of Time awarded work, he's built a privacy preserving augmented reality browser (SurroundWeb), created cloud intelligent security testing products (SAGE and Microsoft Security Risk Detection), and designed novel algorithms for private authentication of radio frequency identification devices. David graduated with a PhD from the University of California, Berkeley in 2009.

bio: Jon DiMaggio is the Co-Founder of Arkem Cyber and a cybercrime hunter who infiltrates ransomware gangs from the inside. A former US intelligence analyst and cyberthreat researcher, he has gone undercover inside some of the world's most dangerous cybercrime syndicates. In 2024, he embedded within LockBit, gathering intelligence that helped law enforcement dismantle the group. His series, "The Ransomware Diaries" earned wide recognition. Jon wrote "The Art of Cyberwarfare," is a two-time SANS Difference Makers Award winner, has appeared on 60 Minutes, and is featured in major outlets like The New York Times, Wired, and Bloomberg.

bio: Earned a Grammy for his performance in Les Miserables.  And that film is not the only musical Hugh can be seen in. He also played the lead role in The Greatest Showman alongside Zendaya and Zac Efron. Other credits for Jackman include the X-Men series, Logan, Prisoners and The Son. Recently, he can be seen reprising his role in Marvel’s Deadpool  & Wolverine alongside Ryan Reynolds. The film has grossed well over 1 billion US dollars to date. Hugh has since enjoyed critical success with his theatrical company, TOGETHER Productions.  He can be seen in Song Sung Blue co-starring Kate Hudson, written and directed by Craig Brewer and released in late 2025. In 2026, Jackman will star in The Sheep Detectives and The Death of Robinhood.

bio: Jenai Marinkovic is CEO/Cofounder of GRCIE, a nonprofit providing tuition-free cybersecurity education through its award-winning NextCISO Academy. She serves as vCISO/CTO for Tiro Security and on ISACA's AI Governance Working Group. A 25-year cybersecurity leader, Jenai architected ISACA's AI Audit Toolkit, a 1500+ control framework for AI governance. She specializes in AI security, IoT and edge systems, training students in cross-domain thinking where physical sciences, cyber-physical systems, and critical infrastructure converge. Her research "Governing Cognition" redefines AI incident response, revealing the breach is in what systems believe, detecting drift and steering systems to alignment. Speaking at RSAC, ISACA, ISSA, and Cloud Security Alliance, she shapes AI security discourse.

bio: For over a decade, Brandon Barry has lived on the front lines of automotive security. As Founder and CEO of Block Harbor, a firm spun out from Fiat-Chrysler, he has guided the world’s top automakers and suppliers through the expensive and painful process of securing connected cars. A DEF CON Car Hacking Village champion with a Computer Engineering degree from Brown University, he now applies this battle-tested playbook to prevent the same catastrophic security failures from being repeated in the coming wave of AI-powered robotics.

bio: Joseph Blankenship supports security and risk (S&R) professionals, helping clients develop security strategies and make informed decisions to protect against cyberattacks. As a Research Director for S&R, he leads the analyst team researching security leadership, the role of the CISO, infrastructure and operations, detection and response, and Forrester’s Zero Trust model of Information Security. His research focuses on insider risk management, security operations, and security management.

bio: David is currently the Chief Information Security Officer after six and a half years as the CISO for the Oracle SaaS Cloud Security organization.  Previously, David was a Director and built the Google Cloud Security Engineering organization for 3 years with his preceding 18 years spent with Microsoft in numerous security platform, cloud, product and engineering leadership roles.  David first started his work in security with his five years’ active-duty service with the aviation electronic warfare community of the United States Navy and is also a Venture Partner with Rain Capital VC. David holds a B.S. in CIS as well as an MBA with a MIS concentration along with 30+ issued patents with all in security technology related areas.

bio: John Morgan has been creating high performing teams, businesses, and innovative customer solutions in cybersecurity for over 25 years. Throughout his career he has secured customer networks, endpoints, data, identities, and applications. John’s prior roles include SVP and GM at Trellix, CEO of Confluera, GM of Security at F5, and VP of Product at MobileIron. John’s success stems from delivering market differentiating customer outcomes with a solid long-term strategy while hitting short-term business targets. He has extensive experience starting companies, managing through IPO and acquisition, and scaling complex businesses in large multinational public companies. John holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the University of California, Davis.

bio: Kelly White is a SVP of Cybersecurity and Risk Products for Mastercard where he builds products that help ensure global-scale safety and soundness in the areas of cybersecurity and agentic commerce. Kelly remains CEO of RiskRecon, a provider of cybersecurity ratings and assessment that he sold to Mastercard in 2020. Prior to founding RiskRecon Kelly held numerous roles in cybersecurity.

bio: Martin Palermo is a Staff Security Researcher at Intuit, where he focuses on Adversary Management and securing AI-driven financial platforms. With a career spanning nearly two decades at industry giants like IBM, Experian, and MercadoLibre, Martin has deep expertise in offensive security, cloud architecture, and risk mitigation. Prior to his current role, he served as the Lead DevSecOps Engineer at an AI startup, architecting security protocols for data-centric AI development. Now back at Intuit, he applies this specialized knowledge to emulate sophisticated adversaries and fortify enterprise defenses. Martin is a dedicated researcher and speaker holding CISSP, CCSP credentials

With a career spanning nearly two decades at industry giants like IBM, Experian, and MercadoLibre, Martin has deep expertise in offensive security, cloud architecture, and risk mitigation. Prior to his current role, he served as the Lead DevSecOps Engineer at an AI startup, architecting security protocols for data-centric AI development. Now back at Intuit, he applies this specialized knowledge to emulate sophisticated adversaries and fortify enterprise defenses. Martin is a dedicated researcher and speaker holding CISSP, CCSP credentials

bio: Ali Golshan is a seasoned entrepreneur and technologist at the forefront of AI and cybersecurity innovation. He heads up AI software and data at NVIDIA, following its acquisition of Gretel, the synthetic data platform, which he co-founded and led as CEO. Previously, he Co-Founded StackRox, pioneering Kubernetes-native security (acquired by Red Hat), and Cyphort, a security analytics platform (acquired by Juniper). Ali began his career in the US intelligence community, designing secure, resilient infrastructure and data systems. With deep expertise in AI, data privacy, and large-scale cloud systems, he bridges the gap between high-level strategy and technical execution.

bio: Dustin Lehr is a cybersecurity strategist, IANS Faculty member, and Application Security Advocate at Security Journey. He is the Co-Founder of Katilyst, a Co-Creator of the global “League of Cyber Defense Champions” community, and serves as a fractional security executive. With a career spanning software engineering, application architecture, and security leadership, he brings a unique blend of technical depth and behavioral science expertise to modern cyber challenges. Dustin is the Author of "The Security Champion Program Success Guide," a frequent speaker, and is known for applying psychology, motivational design, and practical people-centric methods to help organizations strengthen security culture and positively influence secure behavior at scale.

bio: Hazim Almuhimedi is the Vice Governor for Risk and Compliance at the National Cybersecurity Authority in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, a role he has held since January 2022. He leads national cybersecurity risk and compliance programs and oversees cybersecurity readiness across public and private sector entities. Previously, he served as General Manager for Cybersecurity and Data Governance at the Communications, Space, and Technology Commission, where he led sector-wide initiatives to strengthen cybersecurity and data governance. Hazim holds a PhD in Societal Computing from the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University. His research focuses on usable privacy and security, with peer-reviewed publications in USENIX Security, SOUPS, CHI, and other leading conferences.

bio: Krista Case leads product marketing for the OpenText™ Data Security portfolio, driving global go-to-market strategy across solutions that help enterprises discover, protect, and manage sensitive data everywhere it lives. With a focus on unified data security, AI-driven visibility, and compliance at scale, Krista translates complex security challenges into business outcomes - empowering CISOs and data leaders to reduce risk and unlock the value of trusted data. Having spent more than 15 years as a cybersecurity industry analyst prior to joining OpenText, Krista is grounded in deep market insight and strategic perspective.

bio: Ryan Anschutz is a cybersecurity leader with 18+ years of experience spanning cybersecurity, law enforcement, and intelligence. As North America Leader for IBM X-Force Incident Response, he leads collaborative teams that respond to high-stakes cyber incidents for Fortune 500 companies and strengthen resilience through proactive and threat intelligence driven strategies. A Former Detective who served with local and federal law enforcement agencies like the Mansfield Police Department, FBI, and United States Secret Service criminal and cyber task forces, he is internationally recognized for his investigative work. Ryan holds a Master’s in Cybersecurity and mentors the next generation of security professionals.

bio: Akila Srinivasan leads a few security engineering teams at Anthropic, building defenses for frontier AI systems. Her work focuses on infrastructure and developer security through automation and paved roads. She drives Anthropic's model protection and customer data security requirements, protecting advanced AI capabilities from sophisticated adversaries. Before Anthropic, Akila built security programs at Notion, Lyft, Apple, and Microsoft. Her team now tackles automated risk remediation, infrastructure hardening, and AI model protection. She shapes security standards for the emerging field of AI safety while developing practical methods at the intersection of machine learning and security.

bio: Sarah Novotny has long been an open source champion leading in projects such as Kubernetes, OpenTelemetry, NGINX, and MySQL. She has previously led an Open Source Ecosystem team from the Microsoft Azure Office of the CTO, an Open Source Strategy group at Google, and represented both Microsoft and Google on the Linux Foundation Board of Directors. In the distant past, she ran large scale technology infrastructures before web-scale had a name. Sarah’s 20+ years of expertise extends beyond technical realms to encompass developer relations, marketing, sales engineering, and more. She has a proven track record of leading technical operations and development teams while effectively bridging the gap between customer requirements and technical vision.

bio: Anastasiia Ostrovska is the Co-Founder & CEO of the Women’s Leadership & Strategic Initiatives Foundation and Founder of Ostrovska Consulting. She previously led strategic communications at Ukraine’s National Cybersecurity Coordination Center and advised the Vice Prime Minister — Minister of Digital Transformation of Ukraine. She co-organized the Kyiv International Cyber Resilience Forum (2024–2025) and launched SheCyber Hub and Women in Cyber UA. Recognized among the Most Inspiring Women in Cyber 2025 (UK) and a moderator of the NATO Youth Summit, she advances international partnerships, contributes to strategic initiatives, and develops programs in cybersecurity, gender equality, and digital resilience. She also lectures at CDTO Campus, shaping Ukraine’s future digital leaders.

bio: Alexander Leslie is a Senior Threat Intelligence Analyst with the Advanced Cybercrime & Engagements (ACE) Team at Recorded Future. He has a Bachelor's degree in International Studies from American University and a Master's degree in Eurasian, Russian, and East European studies from Georgetown University. His research is primarily focused on the intersection of cybercrime, geopolitics, and US national security. He is an active and influential member of the global cybersecurity community and frequently shares insights on developments related to the dark web, cyberattacks, cybersecurity policy, and artificial intelligence on social media as @aejleslie.

bio: Amanda Sanchez is the Administrative Services Manager at East Rio Hondo Water Supply Corporation (ERHWSC) in southern Texas. In this role, she led the utility's participation in the Cyber Readiness Institute's Water Utility Pilot Project, serving as the appointed Cyber Leader. Under her leadership, ERHWSC enhanced its cybersecurity posture by implementing structured practices and fostering a proactive cyber-aware culture among staff. Her efforts have been instrumental in strengthening the utility's resilience against cyberthreats, ensuring continued safe and reliable water service to the community.

bio: Or Eshed is Co-Founder and CEO of LayerX Security. Or has over 15 years of cybersecurity experience as an ML developer, security and intelligence researcher, and cybersecurity analyst. Prior to founding LayerX, Or worked as a cyberthreat intelligence analyst at Check Point, Otorio, and ABN AMRO Bank. His work has led to the arrest of at least 15 threat actors and the exposure of the largest browser hijacking operation in history, with over 50 million browsers compromised. He has also written and spoken on topics of cybersecurity extensively, including at key conferences such as DEF CON, BSides Las Vegas, the Rochester Security Summit, and more. In addition, Or holds an MSc in Applied Economics.

bio: Paul Simmonds is the CISO and CEO of the Global Identity Foundation and a Director of the Cloud Security Alliance (Europe). He was formerly the global CISO of AstraZeneca, and prior to that he has held posts as the global CISO of ICI, Head of Information Security with a high security European web hosting company and as Global Information Security Manager with Motorola. He was awarded the first “Chief Security Officer of the Year” as well as "Best Security Implementation" at the SC Magazine Awards and is twice listed as one of (US publication) Network World’s “most powerful people in networking.” He is a noted speaker presenting the opening keynote for both Blackhat US and Blackhat Europe and has presented on the RSAC (London) Keynote stage, as well as many other conferences.

bio: Steve Povolny has spent nearly 20 years at the forefront of cybersecurity, leading global research, AI, and threat intelligence teams. At Exabeam, he drives the advancement of AI in security, helping organizations detect and respond to threats faster. A hands-on researcher and frequent speaker, Steve excels at translating complex security challenges into practical insights for both technical and executive audiences. As Co-Founder of TEN18, he is passionate about mentoring emerging security professionals and building teams that make a meaningful impact against modern cyberthreats.

bio: Cliff Steinhauer is passionate about helping people stay safe online. At the National Cybersecurity Alliance, he translates complex technology into plain, easy-to-follow terms for non-technical audiences. Known for his friendly and empathetic style, Cliff focuses on building confidence and reducing fear around cybersecurity, empowering seniors and other community members to better protect themselves from scams and fraud.
globalBio: Cliff Steinhauer is a passionate Information Security and privacy professional. Currently based in Seattle, he has over a decade of experience in sales, marketing, and project management. With the National Cybersecurity Alliance, Steinhauer works to direct community engagement through live events, educates through thought leadership, and runs the Cybersecurity program for NCA. Steinhauer enjoys sharing the message of securing your digital life, protecting information systems and the people that run them, and mentoring young folks to promote interest in the field.

bio: David McLeod is a VP Program Director at Gartner serving members of the CISO Research Board. He is a seasoned strategist and operational leader who develops insights for complex ecosystems, shares a pragmatic view of cyber risk, and offers creative approaches for translating strategy intent into effective cybersecurity and information risk management programs. Earlier in his career, he led technology, compliance, audit, and advisory teams at Walmart, Equifax, and KPMG. David has helped launch industry-shaping organizations like the RH-ISAC. Prior to joining Gartner, David was CISO for The Walt Disney Studios, Cox Enterprises, and VF Corporation. A boardroom-certified Qualified Technology Executive, David holds a degree in Computer Engineering from Clemson and is a US Army veteran.

bio: Abhraneel Dutta is a Visiting Assistant Professor at Florida International University (FIU). Originally from India, he earned his BSc in Mathematics and Computing from the Institute of Mathematics and Applications and an MSc in Mathematics from IISER Kolkata. He later moved to the US, where his PhD research focused on side-channel resistant ECC algorithms and the efficiency of post-quantum cryptographic algorithms. Currently, he teaches Calculus 1 and 2, Mathematical Thinking, and Applied Calculus at FIU. His ongoing research involves zero-knowledge and code-based systems, interactive protocols, and fully homomorphic encryption. He is eager to collaborate with researchers worldwide and broaden his experience by exploring and contributing to diverse areas of cryptography.

bio: J. Carlos Vega is a retired US Army Colonel and cybersecurity executive with over three decades of experience at the intersection of technology, risk, and leadership. As the Army’s first Cyber Operations Colonel, he helped establish the Army’s cyber branch and shape how large institutions organize and govern cyber operations. He is a Co-founder of the Army Cyber Institute and served as a cyber instructor at the United States Military Academy at West Point. JC has held CISO, CIO, and strategic advisory roles across government, startups, and global enterprises. Known for translating cyber risk into board-level decisions and Founder of Executive Security Advisors, he works with boards and executive teams navigating growth, disruption, and moments when cyber risk becomes business risk.

As the Army’s first Cyber Operations Colonel, he helped establish the Army’s cyber branch and shape how large institutions organize and govern cyber operations. He is a Co-founder of the Army Cyber Institute and served as a cyber instructor at the United States Military Academy at West Point. JC has held CISO, CIO, and strategic advisory roles across government, startups, and global enterprises. Known for translating cyber risk into board-level decisions and Founder of Executive Security Advisors, he works with boards and executive teams navigating growth, disruption, and moments when cyber risk becomes business risk.

bio: Kevin Reifsteck is a Director for Cybersecurity Policy at Microsoft, where he focuses on quantum safety and critical infrastructure protection issues. Prior to joining Microsoft, he served in roles as a Director for Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity for the National Security Council (NSC) and as an analyst for the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). On the NSC staff, he provided policy and strategic guidance on critical infrastructure cybersecurity issues and contributed to the National Cyber Strategy. At the CIA, he produced analytic assessments to inform US policymakers about evolving cyberthreats to US critical infrastructure. Kevin graduated from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign with a BS in Electrical Engineering.
globalBio: Kevin Reifsteck is a Director for Cybersecurity Policy at Microsoft, where he focuses on quantum safety and critical infrastructure protection issues. Prior to joining Microsoft, he served in roles as a Director for Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity for the National Security Council (NSC) and as an analyst for the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). On the NSC staff, he provided policy and strategic guidance on critical infrastructure cybersecurity issues and contributed to the National Cyber Strategy. At the CIA, he produced analytic assessments to inform US policymakers about evolving cyberthreats to US critical infrastructure. Kevin graduated from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign with a BS in Electrical Engineering.

bio: Luke Goetting is a globally recognized Future of Work keynote speaker and Author of "Unlocking NextGen Talent: How to Connect, Engage, and Future-Proof Your Workforce in the Age of Digital Natives & AI." He has captivated audiences at TEDx and events across four continents—including the Business Change & Transformation Conference in London, the Global Project Management Forum in Riyadh, and the Nexus Workforce of the Future Conference in San Antonio. As Principal of LTG Strategy and host of the Gen Z @ Work podcast, Luke's talks, workshops, and resources help organizations maximize their multigenerational workforce and develop high-impact leaders in the AI era. Named 2024 Speaker of the Year by MPI Greater New York, his expertise has benefited industry giants like Dell, IBM, and AMD.

bio:
Lauren Zabierek is Senior Vice President for the Future of Digital Security at the Institute for Security and Technology (IST) and a national leader in cybersecurity and technology policy. She previously served as Senior Advisor at CISA, where she launched the Secure by Design movement to reduce systemic cyber risk.
Her career spans the US Air Force, Intelligence Community, private sector, academia, and senior federal service, giving her rare insight into the decisions that shape digital security and resilience. She Co-Founded #ShareTheMicInCyber, served as Executive Director of the Cyber Project at Harvard’s Belfer Center, and has advised leaders across government and industry on strategic, technical, and policy challenges.

bio: Heidi Shey is a Principal Analyst at Forrester where she leads Forrester's research on data security. Heidi guides security leaders and tech executives at enterprise and government organizations in applying a Zero Trust, data-centric approach to securing data, advising in areas like sensitive data discovery and classification, data loss prevention, secure communications, privacy preserving technologies, post-quantum security, and more. Her research coverage also includes cyber insurance. She has been with Forrester since 2006 where her prior roles focused on tech sector economics and tech vendor strategy. Heidi holds a BA in economics and studio art with honors from Wellesley College and an MS in cybersecurity policy from the University of Maryland.

bio: Devon Bryan is SVP and Global Chief Security Officer for Booking Holdings where he’s responsible for leading the comprehensive security strategy, encompassing cybersecurity, physical security, and fraud prevention across BHI’s global portfolio of brands, including Booking.com/Rentalcars.com, Priceline, Agoda, Kayak, and OpenTable. He joined Booking Holdings in January 2025 having previously held CISO roles at: Carnival Corporation, MUFG Union Bank (Americas), KPMG (Americas), US Federal Reserve System, and ADP LLC. His Information Security career began in the United States Air Force, where he served as a Captain and Lead Network Security Engineer working on systems and programs to protect the critical network and communications networks of the Air Force’s Air Combat Command.
globalBio: Devon Bryan is SVP and Global Chief Security Officer for Booking Holdings where he’s responsible for leading the comprehensive security strategy, encompassing cybersecurity, physical security, and fraud prevention across BHI’s global portfolio of brands, including Booking.com/Rentalcars.com, Priceline, Agoda, Kayak, and OpenTable. He joined Booking Holdings in January 2025 having previously held CISO roles at: Carnival Corporation, MUFG Union Bank (Americas), KPMG (Americas), US Federal Reserve System, and ADP LLC. His Information Security career began in the United States Air Force, where he served as a Captain and Lead Network Security Engineer working on systems and programs to protect the critical network and communications networks of the Air Force’s Air Combat Command.

bio: Jaye Tillson is a senior technology leader with 25+ years of experience pioneering solutions like Zero Trust, SASE, and SSE. Jaye’s leadership emphasizes high-performing teams, transformative technology adoption, and bridging business and IT priorities. Recognized for delivering programs exceeding $1B in value and enhancing security while optimizing budgets, he combines strategic vision with practical execution to drive secure, agile IT transformations. A skilled communicator and engaging speaker, Jaye regularly presents at Gartner, BlackHat, InfoSec, and SECtember, making complex security concepts accessible to executives and technical teams alike. He co-founded the SSE Forum and co-hosts "The Edge podcast," sharing insights on securing distributed applications and mobile workforces.

bio: Steve Shelton is the Founder and Chief Resilience Officer of Green Shoe Consulting, where he leads the first empirical research on stress and burnout in cybersecurity leadership. With nearly 20 years in software sales at companies including CDW, Symantec, RSA, and Proofpoint, Steve brings a rare mix of boardroom credibility and performance psychology expertise. He works with CISOs, cybersecurity teams, and organizations to build resilience and prevent burnout. Known for weaving humor, research, and pop culture into serious topics, Steve has become a sought-after speaker at cybersecurity conferences from Bsides to CloudCon. His mission: to redefine success in cybersecurity leadership by making resilience as vital as technology.

bio: Hema Mohan is a Senior Director of Product Management at Rubrik, where she leads the vision, strategy, and execution for two key product lines - Identity Security and Enterprise Data Protection product lines. She is a seasoned product leader with over 20 years of experience in enterprise software, specializing in data resilience, identity management, and cloud-native technologies. Hema's career spans leadership roles at Hyperscience, Splunk, and Sumo Logic, where she has driven category-defining products, spearheaded ML-led initiatives, and shaped GTM strategies that accelerated revenue growth. With a background in enterprise sales and a passion for building high-performing product teams, she excels bringing innovative products to market.

bio: Rolanda Small brings 20+ years of combined experience in Business Ops., Leadership Consulting, and HR Culture/Belonging Strategy. As the Executive Director of Cyversity, she collaborates across the organization to fortify the mission nationally and deeply through active regional chapters. She's corporate tech background with tech giants Cisco, Proofpoint, Palo Alto Networks, heavy focus on cybersecurity, combined with her dedication to non-profit brings about unique programs and successful outcomes. She holds a MA Organizational Management and a BS Business Administration. She has been a founding leader of Cyversity’s Bay Area chapter and worked diligently with the organization over the past seven years. Outside of work, she is a foodie who enjoys music festivals, camping, and traveling.

bio: Andrew Carney is Program Manager for DARPA's AI Cyber Challenge and CASTLE programs. He is also a Program Manager at ARPA-H where he leads programs and projects to improve health cybersecurity. Andrew was previously a Principal Researcher in HSBC’s Cybersecurity Science and Analytics group. Before that, he was a Technical Advisor and Contractor at DARPA, supporting research efforts focused on reverse engineering, program analysis, human-machine teaming, and automated program repair. Throughout his career, he has been involved in CTF as both a player and a competition organizer. Andrew has over 15 years of experience in software and hardware vulnerability research, technical education and training, and management of research and development teams.

bio: Akshay Joshi is the Head of the World Economic Forum’s Centre for Cybersecurity. He leads a team that seeks to provide an independent and impartial platform to reinforce the importance of cybersecurity as a strategic priority and drive global public-private action to address systemic cybersecurity challenges. Akshay is regularly featured in print and broadcast media across the world.

bio: Joshua Copeland is Director of Cybersecurity at Crescendo AI, Deputy Commander of the Louisiana State Guard Cyber Reserve, and a graduate-level professor at Tulane University. Known as the “Unpopular Opinion Guy,” he challenges conventional security thinking by focusing on the human, cultural, and leadership failures that undermine even the best technical controls. His bestselling book "Unpopular Opinion: Burning Down the Bullsht to Rebuild Cybersecurity" has topped multiple Amazon categories, and he is the creator of the forthcoming "The Empathic Hacker." Joshua blends enterprise risk, state-level cyber defense, and emotional intelligence frameworks to help leaders move from checkbox compliance to resilient, people-centered security

bio: Eric Chien leads a team of engineers and threat hunters that investigates and reverse-engineers the latest high-impact Internet security attacks. Via these attack techniques and trends, he develops and drives threat intelligence and novel security solutions to prevent and mitigate against the next big attack.

bio: Mark Hatfield is a Founder and General Partner of Ten Eleven Ventures, the industry’s original venture capital fund focused solely on investing in cybersecurity. The firm invests globally and is stage agnostic and partners with KKR for growth stage and later investments. Since its founding in 2015, Ten Eleven has invested in 64 companies and raised three funds. Prior to founding Ten Eleven, Mark was a Partner at Fairhaven Capital and Managing Director for Motorola Ventures. Mark also previously headed up Strategy and Business Development for Motorola’s CIO and IT organization. Previously, Mark held various Corporate Business Development and IT roles at Bell Canada Enterprises and the Bank of Montreal in Toronto, Canada.

bio: Dr. Anton Chuvakin works for the Office of the CISO of Google Cloud, where he arrived via Chronicle Security (an Alphabet company) acquisition in July 2019. Before that, Anton was a Research Vice President and Distinguished Analyst at Gartner for Technical Professionals (GTP) Security and Risk Management Strategies team. Anton is a recognized security expert in the field of log management, SIEM, and PCI DSS compliance. He is an author of books "Security Warrior", "Logging and Log Management: The Authoritative Guide to Understanding the Concepts Surrounding Logging and Log Management," and ""PCI Compliance, Third Edition: Understand and Implement Effective PCI Data Security Standard Compliance" (book website) and a contributor to other books and articles.

bio: Bradley Schaufenbuel is currently Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer at Paychex. Prior to his current role, he held security leadership positions at Paylocity, Midland States Bank, Midwest Bank, Zurich Financial Services, Experian, and Arthur Andersen LLP. He holds an MBA from DePaul University's Kellstadt Graduate School of Business and a JD and an LLM in Information Technology and Privacy Law from the University of Illinois at Chicago's John Marshall Law School. Bradley is the author of multiple books (including two "For Dummies" titles) and has had numerous articles published in professional journals on a wide variety of topics related to Information Security and governance.

bio: Rehan Jalil is Founder and CEO of Securiti.ai, the pioneer of the Data Command Center, recently acquired by Veeam for $1.7B to accelerate enterprise AI at scale. Previously, Rehan was CEO of Elastica, which merged with Blue Coat and was acquired by Symantec for $4.7B, becoming its fastest-growing division. His first company, WiChorus, was acquired by Tellabs. Rehan is known for leveraging cutting-edge technology to secure large-scale systems. He founded Securiti on the belief that data is the lifeblood of business and must be intelligently governed amid rapid AI adoption, emerging threats, and evolving regulations. Now part of Veeam, the leader in Data Resilience, Rehan continues his mission to place data intelligence and control at the center of modern security.

bio: Steve Vintz is an accomplished executive with more than 25 years of financial, operational and strategic planning experience working with growth companies in the technology industry. As Tenable’s co-chief executive officer he oversees product, cybersecurity, corporate development and all general and administrative functions. In 2015, serving in his former role as chief financial officer (CFO), Steve led Tenable through its Series B funding round which was, at the time, the largest capital raise for a private cybersecurity company. He then led the company’s initial public offering in 2018, which was one of the largest raises for a U.S.-listed security company. Steve formerly served as EVP and CFO of Vocus, where he took the company through its successful IPO.

bio: Erlend W. Oftedal brings application security and software delivery expertise as a developer, penetration tester, and security architect. He has trained teams in secure development and created open source security tools across multiple platforms and languages. At Crosspoint Labs, Erland contributed to all value creation phases, focusing on due diligence and security testing for portfolio companies while implementing AI support systems. His career includes roles at Bekk Consulting, nSense, F-Secure, Blank, and Autodesk. Passionate about helping developers write secure code, he's led OWASP Oslo for 15+ years and speaks at conferences like JavaZone and NDC. He's a former 2x Bugcrowd MVP and holds an MS in Computer Science from NTNU. He enjoys football, running, and golf.

bio: Brad Brooker is a Partner at Holland & Knight's Washington, DC, office, where he is a member of the firm's Public Policy & Regulation Group and National Security & Defense Industry Group. Brad focuses his practice on matters related to data privacy, technology, and national security. Prior to joining Holland & Knight, Brad served as General Counsel for the FBI and as Deputy General Counsel, led the National Security and Cyber Law Branch. Previously, he worked in the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI), where he served as the Principal Deputy General Counsel and for three years acting General Counsel.

bio: Tony Anscombe is the Chief Security Evangelist for ESET. With 30+ years of security industry experience, Tony started his career as a programmer in the financial sector. Today he is an established author, blogger, and speaker on the current threat landscape, security technologies and products, data protection, privacy and trust, and internet safety. His speaking portfolio includes industry conferences RSAC, Black Hat, Sector, VB, CTIA, Gartner Risk and Security Summit, and the Child Internet Safety Summit (CIS). He is regularly quoted in cybersecurity, technology and business media, including BBC, Dark Reading, the Guardian, New York Times, and USA Today, with broadcast appearances on Bloomberg, BBC, CTV, KRON, and CBS. Tony has previously served on the board of the NCA, FOSI, and MEF.

bio: Deral Heiland CISSP, serves as a Principal Security Researcher (IoT) for Rapid7. Deral has over 25 years of experience in the Information Technology field, and over the last 15+ years Deral’s career has focused on security research, security assessments, penetration testing, and consulting for corporations and government agencies. Deral also has conducted security research on numerous technical subjects, releasing white papers, security advisories, and has presented the information at numerous national and international security conferences including Blackhat, Defcon, Shmoocon, DerbyCon, RSAC, and Hack in Paris. Deral has been interviewed and quoted by several media outlets and publications including ABC World News Tonight, BBC, Consumer Reports, SC Magazine, and The Register.

bio: Timothy Torres is Chief Security Officer at TriNet and serves as a dual-role technology executive, leading product, engineering, and go-to-market solutions that directly enable business growth. As Chief Security Officer, Timothy is responsible for enabling business transformation and protecting customer trust with enterprise accountability for cybersecurity, product security, fraud, business resilience, crisis management, and physical security and safety. Timothy has 25+ years of experience building and scaling security programs for Fortune 100 companies. Timothy serves on multiple boards, including HealthRIGHT 360, and advises emerging technology and security startups.

She enjoys public speaking and has spoken at various conferences, including re:Inforce, re:Invent, and AWS Summits.

bio: Aihong Yu is the Deputy GD, Chief Privacy Officer of CDK Global (a spin-off company from ADP), the largest SaaS provider of automotive retail technologies and systems in North America. She leads the company’s privacy, AI, and data governance and is deeply involved in the incident response operations. Prior to her privacy and cybersecurity career for the past 10 years, Aihong was a corporate lawyer for nearly two decades specializing in M&A, PE, and VC investments, international and corporate governance. She has been a frequent speaker on topics relating to privacy, cybersecurity, and AI governance. Aihong is a law graduate of the University of Chicago Law School and Peking University and has practiced law in both the US and China.
globalBio: Aihong Yu is the Deputy GD, Chief Privacy Officer of CDK Global (a spin-off company from ADP), the largest SaaS provider of automotive retail technologies and systems in North America. She leads the company’s privacy, AI, and data governance and is deeply involved in the incident response operations. Prior to her privacy and cybersecurity career for the past 10 years, Aihong was a corporate lawyer for nearly two decades specializing in M&A, PE, and VC investments, international and corporate governance. She has been a frequent speaker on topics relating to privacy, cybersecurity, and AI governance. Aihong is a law graduate of the University of Chicago Law School and Peking University and has practiced law in both the US and China.

bio: Dr. Ilia Shumailov is a researcher and entrepreneur dedicated to securing the future of Artificial Intelligence. As a former Senior Research Scientist at Google DeepMind, Ilia defined some of the most critical vulnerabilities in modern AI, including Model Collapse  and energy-latency attacks known as "Sponge Examples." Recognizing that current defenses cannot scale to autonomous agents, Ilia recently left Big Tech to launch a company focused on architectural AI security. His latest work introduces systems like CaMeL, which replace heuristic defenses with structural guarantees, preventing prompt injection by strictly isolating agent control flow. He holds a PhD from the University of Cambridge.
globalBio: Dr. Ilia Shumailov is a researcher and entrepreneur dedicated to securing the future of Artificial Intelligence. Recognizing that current defenses cannot scale to autonomous agents, Ilia recently left Big Tech to launch a company focused on architectural AI security. His latest work introduces systems like CaMeL, which replace heuristic defenses with structural guarantees, preventing prompt injection by strictly isolating agent control flow. He holds a PhD from the University of Cambridge.

bio: As Chief Security Officer Marnie Wilking leads Booking.com's Global Security, Safety and Fraud programs. Previously, as CISO, she shaped the company’s cybersecurity strategy to build trust for travelers worldwide. Marnie has built Cybersecurity and Enterprise Risk Management programs for financial services, healthcare technology, and E-Commerce sectors globally. Her previous leadership roles include Global Head of Cybersecurity, Privacy and IT Risk for Wayfair, and Global CISO for Orion Health. She currently serves on the Board of Directors for Robert Half Inc., and non-profits RH-ISAC and CyberCrime Support Network.

bio: Jake Moore, Crime Enthusiast and Global Cybersecurity Advisor for ESET, brings a unique edge to the digital security realm. He conducts in-depth research and analysis into the most pressing cybersecurity and AI threats facing organizations today. He is also a trusted media commentator regularly appearing in the press to discuss emerging issues for outlets including BBC, Sky News, and CNN. Prior to ESET, he spent 14 years as a UK police force working in the Digital Forensics and Cyber Crime Unit. He investigated hundreds of cases and frequently appeared in Crown Court, providing digital evidence for offences ranging from financial fraud to murder. He now helps businesses strengthen their cyber resilience using a blend of real-world insights, AI innovation, and social engineering awareness.

bio: Fang-I, Hsu is the CISO / Vice President of AI and Cybersecurity at APMIC, leading secure AI adoption and enterprise security strategy. With 15+ years of experience across banking, fintech, and digital assets, he specializes in integrating LLMs into critical systems while ensuring compliance with ISO 27001/27701, SOC 2, and global privacy standards. His expertise spans AI governance, adversarial defense, and model risk management. An active community mentor and speaker, Fang-I empowers organizations to bridge AI innovation with cybersecurity resilience, protecting data, models, and trust in the era of intelligent systems. He is also a recognized speaker, mentor, and active contributor to the Google Developer community in Taiwan (Google Developer Group Taipei).

bio: Dr. David Maimon serves as the Head of Fraud Insights at SentiLink, where he plays a pivotal rolein bridging the gap between upstream fraud signals found in the online fraud ecosystem and downstream fraud signals received by SentiLink partners. Before joining SentiLink, he held theposition of Principal Product Manager and Special Advisor at GeoComply, as well as the role ofChief Science Officer at Vidocq Group. Currently, he is also a Professor in the Department ofCriminal Justice and Criminology at Georgia State University (GSU) and serves as the director of the Evidence-Based Cybersecurity Research Group.

bio: Sven Giesecke is currently Director Portfolio at CodeWrights and responsible for the company's strategic orientation and global service offering. His focus is on advanced software and firmware development as well as security consultancy services for industrial automation. Previously, Sven served in various marketing-, business development and sales roles in commercial automation companies such as Honeywell, Siemens, Sican Microelectronics, and Dallmeier electronics. He was Co-Gounder of Accellence Technologies, a software start-up. Sven owns a Diploma in Electrical Engineering from Hannover University and is often speaking at international conferences.

bio: Shahid Mohammed is a technology executive with 24+ years securing healthcare platforms serving 200M+ members. Former Division VP at Performant Corp (federal healthcare programs) and CTO at Ralytics (Medicare Advantage). Led multiple HITRUST/SOC2 certifications and built multi-agent AI security platforms that reduced compliance preparation from months to weeks. Expert in NIST AI RMF implementation, healthcare data governance, and DevSecOps for HIPAA environments. Currently leads fractional CTO practice for healthcare AI startups.

bio: Kamel Ghali is the Lead Ambassador for the Car Hacking Village in Asia and the Founder of the Japanese branch of the Automotive Security Research Group. He is also an organizer for the Tokyo chapter of the BSides conference series and a member of many other communities promoting Information Security. He regularly presents at conferences such as DEFCON, Black Hat, Hack in The Box, and more, using his trilingual background to reach audiences all around the world.

bio: Shilpi Mittal is a cybersecurity leader who blends sharp technical expertise with a storyteller’s instinct. With 12+ years securing complex cloud environments and driving enterprise DevSecOps, she translates threats into strategy and compliance into action. Known for making security relatable (and occasionally fun), Shilpi speaks on AI, quantum, and the future of identity, always with clarity, candor, and just enough edge to keep people thinking.

With 12+ years securing complex cloud environments and driving enterprise DevSecOps, she translates threats into strategy and compliance into action. Known for making security relatable (and occasionally fun), Shilpi speaks on AI, quantum, and the future of identity, always with clarity, candor, and just enough edge to keep people thinking.

bio: Rahul Binjve (c0dist) currently leads a Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) Engineering team. With over a decade of experience in aggregating and contextualizing various threats, he's a seasoned threat intelligence practitioner. Rahul has presented and trained at several international conferences, including Black Hat, Nullcon, PHDays, c0c0n, Seasides, and BSides. He's also contributed to multiple open source security projects, such as the SHIVA spampot and Detux Linux sandbox. Rahul's passions lie in Information Security, automation, human behavior, and, of course, breaking things.

bio: Adam Cohen is Assistant VP and Associate General Counsel for cybersecurity at AT&T, having joined the company in January 2025 after leading the cyber legal team at Capital One. In these roles, he advises the CISO on cyber operations and intelligence, incident response, and insider threat programs, as well as risk management and governance. Prior to Capital One, Adam spent ten years in the FBI and spearheaded strategic planning efforts to create the Department of Defense’s Civil Liberties Office. While with the FBI, he served as legal counsel for a number of complex cybercriminal and national security investigations, chaired a legal working group on computer network operations, and regularly advised senior executives at the FBI and White House on efforts to counter violent extremism.

bio: Bruce Schneier is an internationally renowned security technologist, called a “security guru” by the Economist. He is the New York Times best-selling author of 14 books -- including A Hacker’s Mind -- as well as hundreds of articles, essays, and academic papers. His influential newsletter Crypto-Gram and blog Schneier on Security are read by over 250,000 people. Bruce is a fellow at the Berkman-Klein Center for Internet and Society at Harvard University, a Lecturer in Public Policy at the Harvard Kennedy School, a board member of the Electronic Frontier Foundation and AccessNow, and an advisory board member of EPIC and VerifiedVoting.org. He is the Chief of Security Architecture at Inrupt, Inc.

He is the Chief of Security Architecture at Inrupt, Inc.

bio: Lucy L. Thomson, JD, CISSP, CIPP/US, focuses on cybersecurity, AI, global data privacy, compliance, and risk management. A career white collar crime prosecutor at the US Justice Department, she subsequently worked as a Senior Engineer at CSC, a global technology company. Appointed Consumer Privacy Ombudsman (CPO) in 38 federal bankruptcy cases, she was the CPO in the Celsius Network cryptocurrency case. She is past co-chair of the ABA AI Task Force, past chair of the ABA Science & Technology Law Section, member of the Cybersecurity Legal Task Force, co-editor of "Artificial Intelligence: Legal Issues and Policy," and contributing author to the ABA Cybersecurity Handbook and books/chapters on emerging technologies. She received a Master’s degree from RPI and a JD degree from Georgetown.

bio: Viswanath S Chirravuri (Vis) is a cybersecurity and product security leader with 20+ years of experience driving security strategy and innovation across banking, tech, telecom, and government sectors. As Product Security Director at ThalesGroup, he leads global teams focused on secure software development, cloud security, AI/ML protection, and software supply chain security. Vis holds an MS in InfoSec and is pursuing a Doctor of Engineering in Cybersecurity Analytics at George Washington University. With 35+ industry certifications such as CISSP, PMP, and GIAC Security Expert (GSE). Passionate about mentoring, AI security governance, and advancing security through education and collaboration. A frequent speaker at RSAC and OWASP, Vis also teaches at SANS and supports CompTIA as a SME.

bio: Stan Duijf joined the Netherlands Police in 2005 and gained experience in various police leadership roles. As Police Chief in the city of ‘s-Hertogenbosch, he oversaw public order policing, criminal investigations, and community policing. Next, Stan led one of the Regional Intelligence Divisions for five years, while also holding national intelligence responsibilities. In 2024, Stan transitioned to a strategic position. As Deputy Chief Constable of the National Investigations and Special Operations, he is responsible for High Tech Crime and Cybercrime within the Netherlands Police and for all operations, policy, and strategy in this domain.

bio: Charlene Cooper is a National Board-Certified Teacher with 20+ years of experience bringing expertise, leadership, and a deep commitment to education. Since joining CYBER.ORG as a Curriculum Development Specialist and later serving as Director of Curriculum she has played a pivotal role in developing engaging, standards-aligned resources in cybersecurity and STEM for educators nationwide. Charlene's relationship with the organization began as an educator when she attended the first CYBER.ORG Education Discovery Forum and was selected as a teacher to pilot the organization’s STEM curriculum. As Director, Charlene leads strategic planning, oversees program execution, manages internal teams, and engages with key partners across education, industry, and government to expand CYBER.ORG’s reach.

bio: Roland Cloutier is one of the world’s most respected voices in cybersecurity, enterprise risk, and global protection strategy. A seasoned operator and public thought-leader, he brings more than 25 years of experience leading large-scale cyber defense, trust, and business protection functions across multinational technology, financial services, media, and critical infrastructure sectors. Today, he serves as the Co-Founder and Partner of The Business Protection Group (TBPG), a global retained advisory firm specializing in operational security, enterprise risk, and privacy leadership. Under his guidance, TBPG supports Fortune 500 companies, regulated industries, and high-growth multinationals in building, maturing, and modernizing their cyber defense and operational resilience capabilities.

bio: Joseph Carson is a cybersecurity professional with 30+ years’ experience in enterprise security, an InfoSec Award winner, author of "Privileged Access Management for Dummies" and "Cybersecurity for Dummies." He is a CISSP and OSCP as well as an active member of the cyber-community, speaking at conferences globally. He’s an advisor to several governments, as well as critical infrastructure, financial, and maritime industries. Joseph is a host of the award-winning podcast "Security by Default," where he interviews cybersecurity thought leaders on educational topics.

He’s an advisor to several governments, as well as critical infrastructure, financial, and maritime industries. Joseph is a host of the award-winning podcast "Security by Default," where he interviews cybersecurity thought leaders on educational topics.
