bio: Michael Klein is Senior Director for Preparedness and Response at the Institute for Security and Technology (IST), where he focuses on improving the resilience of “target rich, cyber poor” critical infrastructure sectors. He comes to the role with 20 years of experience across K-12 education as a teacher, coach, consultant, district leader, and federal cyber policymaker. Most recently, Michael led the US Department of Education’s K-12 cybersecurity work with the White House, CISA, FBI, State and Local partners, and the private sector. Prior to his federal service, Michael was a school district IT Director during the COVID-19 pandemic, led a team of educational consultants, helped grow two startups, and taught third to seventh grades in Brooklyn, Harlem, and on the US-Mexico border.

bio: John Duffy is responsible for the security strategy and execution for CBN ID and Payment Systems, protecting platforms that process more than 200 million citizen identities across 80 countries in high-security, regulated environments. Ever used a passport to cross a border, made an Interac payment, visited a hospital, or bought a lottery ticket? Then it was most likely relied on systems he delivered securely. He has led teams behind multiple industry firsts:  the first high-security ePassport, the first Driver's License with a printed digital signature, and the first general-public Mobile Driver's License. His work in secure identity and critical infrastructure has been recognized internationally, and he speaks regularly at industry events including SecTor, OWASP, ATLSecCon and BSides.

bio: Technologist and architect with 20+ years designing secure, privacy-centric platforms. He leads development of next-gen identity that fuses cryptography, decentralized architectures, and privacy-by-design to deliver trust without compromise. Johan has built systems across healthcare, finance, and national scale identity, including initiatives aligned with the EU Digital Identity Wallet. He goes beyond compliance—designing for unlikability, network privacy, post-quantum readiness, provable consent. Known for pairing deep technical insight with strategic clarity, he has advised governments, enterprises, and startups on embedding verifiable privacy across the stack. His talks blend practical patterns with forward-looking guidance so teams can adopt innovations today and be ready for tomorrow.

bio: Grant Bourzikas joined Cloudflare as the Chief Security Officer in 2023, where he is a driving force in helping the company achieve its mission to build a better internet. As a critical component within Cloudflare's ecosystem, Grant's primary role is to protect the company from sophisticated adversaries to stay ahead in today’s cybersecurity landscape. He oversees Cloudflare’s threat intelligence services, which successfully mitigate 170+ billion attacks daily, in addition to acting as “Customer Zero” to help foster innovation across all Cloudflare products and services. Grant is a seven-time CSO with over 20 years experience leading global security programs.

bio: Matt Berry is the Global Director of Evangelism and Technical Marketing for SentinelOne, where he brings together deep technical experience and a commitment to clarity in cybersecurity. He's built advanced labs, led global initiatives, and turned complex ideas like Zero Trust and AI into stories that operators can use and leaders can trust. Matt challenges assumptions, asks better questions, and isn't afraid to show what works—and what doesn't—so others can make sharper strategic decisions. His focus is on bridging the gap between the trenches and the boardroom, using storytelling to spark action, shift thinking, and drive real change in how organizations see and practice security.

bio: Erik Van Buggenhout is a Co-Founder of NVISO, a European cybersecurity firm, as well as a SANS Senior Instructor, and Lead Author of "SEC599: Defeating Advanced Adversaries" and "SEC699: Purple Team Tactics - Adversary Emulation for Breach Prevention & Detection." In addition, Erik teaches SEC560, Network Penetration Testing & Ethical Hacking, and SEC542, Web Application Penetration Testing & Ethical Hacking. Prior to NVISO, Erik spent five years at a Big 4 firm, where he evolved into a subject matter expert for the EMEA region. He has been involved with SANS since 2009: first as a Mentor, then working his way to Community Instructor in 2012, and finally becoming a Certified Instructor in 2016.

bio: United States Magistrate Judge Laurel Beeler was appointed in 2010. She has presided as a Trial and Settlement Judge over hundreds of civil cases, including intellectual property, employment, civil rights, and commercial disputes. She is a Member of several education and practice committees of the Ninth Circuit and the Northern District of California, teaches at local law schools, participates regularly in rule-of-law projects, implemented the court’s reentry and diversion courts, and is one of four national judicial liaisons to the US Department of Justice/Office of Defender Services Joint Electronic Technology Working Group. Her full bio is at https://www.cand.uscourts.gov/lb.

bio: Alexandre (or Alex) Sieira is a successful Information Security entrepreneur in the Information Security field with a global footprint since 2003. He began his security career as a Co-Founder and CTO of CIPHER, an international security consulting and MSSP headquartered in Brazil which was later acquired by Prosegur. In 2015, he became Co-Founder and CTO of Niddel, a bootstrapped security analytics SaaS startup running entirely on the cloud. After the acquisition of Niddel by Verizon in January 2018, he became the Senior Manager and Global Leader of Managed Security Services products under the Detect & Respond portfolio tower at Verizon. Currently, he is the CTO and Co-Founder of Tenchi Security, a company disrupting the Third Party Cyber Risk Management market.

bio: Dr. Anand Singh is a seasoned cybersecurity and technology executive with 25+ years of leadership in security, privacy, risk, engineering, and IT across industries including financial services, healthcare, retail, manufacturing, cloud, and SaaS. He is Chief Security and Strategy Officer at Symmetry Systems and a Fellow at the Responsible AI Institute. Formerly Global CISO at Alkami Technology, he led its cybersecurity program through a successful IPO. Anand has held leadership roles at UnitedHealth Group, Target, Caliber Home Loans, and PTC. Recognized as one of the top 50 CISOs in the US, he advises early-stage companies, mentors global technology leaders, and holds a PhD in Computer Science and Management.

bio: Kip Boyle is Founder of Cyber Risk Opportunities, where he serves as fractional CISO for a dozen organizations. He brings the buyer's perspective to security investments, translating technical findings into board-ready decisions. With 30+ years in cybersecurity, Kip has sat in the decision-maker's seat through countless red team engagements, vulnerability assessments, and incident responses. He previously served as CISO at PEMCO Insurance and led Wide Area Network security for the $67 billion F-22 fighter program as a USAF officer. Kip is the author of "Fire Doesn't Innovate: The Executive's Practical Guide to Thriving in the Face of Evolving Cyber Risks" and co-hosts the "Cyber Risk Management" Podcast (200+ episodes).

bio: Rosa Bolger is the Vice President of Cyber Defense and Technology at IBM. As an IBM Distinguished Engineer and technology leader with over 20 years experience, Rosa is accomplished in driving cyber-defense operations and technology platforms across IBM. Currently, Rosa leads the worldwide team of SOC, CSIRT, Vulnerability Management, Pen Testing and Remediation and Technology Platform security professionals responsible for IBM’s threat detection and response strategy, and its security automation through Machine Learning and AI. Prior to this role, Rosa led the development of web solutions and strategies throughout IBM's Infrastructure, with experience in implementing and managing high performance and availability web infrastructures for Olympic Games and major client accounts.

bio: Shawn Kerns is Manager of Information Security Operations at the University of the Pacific, California's oldest chartered university. Shawn has a background in cybersecurity, penetration testing, and leadership. He also has a dual role as both staff and faculty at the university. Leading a small team, he seeks creative ways to empower others to succeed in their security careers through shared experiences and technical knowledge. He has been teaching Computer and Cybersecurity classes each year.

bio: Scott M. Giordano is an Attorney with over 25 years of legal, technology, and risk management consulting experience. An IAPP Fellow of Information Privacy and AI Governance Professional (AIGP), a Certified Information Security Systems Professional (CISSP), and a Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP). Scott is a Partner at The CISO Law Firm, a firm dedicated to representing CISOs and other cybersecurity team leaders. Scott has held senior positions at several legal technology firms and is listed as Co-Inventor on Intelligent Searching of Electronically Stored Information, patent no. 13/842,910. In addition, he taught the first law school course anywhere on electronic evidence and e-discovery. Scott is a Member of the Bar in Washington state, California, and the District of Columbia.
globalBio: Scott M. Giordano serves as Vice President and Senior Counsel, Privacy and Compliance for Spirion with more than 20 years of legal, technology, and risk management consulting experience. An IAPP Fellow of Information Privacy and a Certified Information Security Systems Professional (CISSP), Scott serves as Spirion’s subject matter expert on multinational data protection and its intersection with technology, export compliance, internal investigations, information governance, and risk management.

bio: John Denning is the Chief Information Security Officer at the Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center (FS-ISAC). John owns the internal cybersecurity and risk management functions within FS-ISAC. In addition, he works across the sector to curate and disseminate critical baseline cybersecurity practices, including helping to bring learnings from the most mature cyber defense programs to the entire sector. Prior to FS-ISAC, he worked for Bank of America’s Global Information Security team; holding executive leadership roles in Global Risk Management, Cyber Crimes Advisory Services, Global Access Management Ops, Cyber Readiness and Resiliency Operations, and Cyber Threat Intelligence. He also worked on Capitol Hill and DHS in cybersecurity capacities.

bio: Jan Oupický is a PhD student at the University of Luxembourg's Interdisciplinary Centre for Security, Reliability and Trust (SnT). His research focuses on the migration to post-quantum cryptography (PQC) and the development of quantum-safe standards. His notable works include "A Comprehensive Survey on Post-Quantum TLS" (IACR CiC, ArcticCrypt 2025) and "Post-quantum XML and SAML Single Sign-On" (PETS 2024). These publications examine practical approaches for securing TLS, XML, and SAML protocols against quantum threats.

bio: Michael Brown is a Principal Security Engineer at Trail of Bits where he leads the AI/ML security research team. He leads and works on a variety of research projects focused on applying AI/ML techniques to software security problems and assuring the security and safety of AI/ML systems. He and his team won second place in DARPA and ARPA-H's AI Cyber Challenge (AIxCC). Michael is a former PhD (ABD) student at Georgia Tech where he studied security-oriented software analysis and transformation techniques. Michael earned his MS in Computer Science at Georgia Tech and his BS in Computer Science at the University of Cincinnati. Prior to his work in software security, Michael served in the US Army where he served as a UH-60M pilot and Aviation Mission Survivability Officer.

bio: Dr. Patrick Smyth is a Principal Developer Relations Engineer at Chainguard. In a former life, he ran data science bootcamps for researchers at Columbia University and he's worked on data science and training initiatives with organizations such as James Webb, Sigstore, and Pandas. Patrick has a PhD in the Digital Humanities from the City University of New York. When he's not hanging out with his wife and daughter in Queens, Patrick can be found sitting in a frozen lake or hitting the sauna.

bio: Lyn Brown advises clients on cyber and national security issues, specializing in helping clients prepare for and respond to cyberattacks. She provides advise on federal rulemaking and compliance with compulsory legal process in criminal investigations or national security matters. She retired from the FBI after 26 years where she provided legal advice on complex national security, law enforcement, and terrorist watch listing matters. She was also the General Counsel to the President's Intelligence Advisory Board at The White House. Earlier in her career, she served at the CIA, ODNI, and NCTC focusing on post 9/11 intelligence reform and information sharing. Before entering public service, she was in private practice specializing in international law and aviation mass disaster litigation.

bio: Barmak Meftah is Co-Founder and General Partner of Ballistic Ventures, the VC firm funding and incubating innovations in cybersecurity. Globally recognized as a leader in enterprise software and cybersecurity, Barmak has a distinguished career marked by transformative leadership. Before Ballistic, he was the President of AT&T Cybersecurity, a position he took on following the acquisition of AlienVault, where he was CEO. Barmak also served as VP of the Enterprise Security Products division at HP, following HP’s acquisition of Fortify Software, where he was Chief Product Officer. His career also includes several Senior Management roles at Oracle. As General Partner at Ballistic, he mentors and guides startup CEOs through the complexities and challenges of building great teams and companies.

bio: Kathryn Guarini is a technology leader, board director, and educator with over 25 years of experience spanning research, product development, strategy, operations, and IT. She served as IBM’s global CIO, leading digital transformation with hybrid cloud and AI, and previously as COO of IBM Research. Kathryn serves on the Board of Directors at Regeneron and the Board of Trustees at NYSCI, is a Senior Fellow at Yale Engineering, and teaches at Yale SOM. She holds a Ph.D. from Stanford and a B.S. from Yale, has over 65 patents and 60 publications, and founded Inspiring Innovation LLC to help organizations navigate disruption and lead with purpose.

bio: Dr. Jared DeMott is the Sr. Director of Global Security and Head of Innovation and Research at UKG, where he leads AI-driven security initiatives to make human capital management safer and smarter. With a PhD in Computer Science from Michigan State University and over two decades of experience—including leadership roles at Microsoft, Amazon, and as Founder of VDA Labs—Jared is a recognized expert in vulnerability research, threat mitigation, and security strategy. He’s passionate about transforming cutting-edge research into scalable defenses and has spoken at major conferences like Black Hat and GrrCON. Jared’s work ensures security is not just a necessity, but a competitive advantage.

bio: Bassam Al-Khalidi is the Co-Founder and Chief Innovation Officer at Axiad and a 20+ year veteran of identity and access management. He has led large-scale deployments of phishing-resistant authentication, CAC/PIV smart cards, and PKI across US federal, healthcare, and enterprise environments. His work centers on ICAM modernization—designing FICAM-aligned architectures, credential lifecycle automation, and certificate management that operationalize Zero Trust. A practitioner at heart, Bassam bridges policy and engineering, helping agencies and fortune-class enterprises meet Zero Trust framework while simplifying day-to-day operations. He regularly advises security teams on building resilient trust infrastructures for users, devices, and workloads in hybrid cloud.

bio: As an Automotive Cybersecurity Researcher at VicOne - a subsidiary of Trendmicro, Shin li conducts daily research on security design and vulnerabilities and also represented VicOne as a cybersecurity consultant, assisting customers in establishing security processes from production design to product testing based on Shin's embedded system development and IC design experience. Additionally, Shin has collaborated closely with auditors to help the automotive supply chain achieve compliance with standards such as ISO 21434. Also, Shin was one of the Organizers of Pwn2Own Automotive 2024 and 2025 TOKYO.

bio: Jessica (Bair) Oppenheimer is the Director of the Security Operations in the Threat Detection and Response team, where she and her team focus on building the Cisco XDR open ecosystem. She also leads the Cisco team in the Security Operations Centers for the RSAC Conference and the Network Operations Center for the Black Hat global conferences. Prior to the acquisition by Cisco, Jessica was Senior Director of Business Development at ThreatGRID malware analysis. She also held VP and Director positions at Guidance Software / EnCase computer forensics, in the growth from a start-up to a public corporation. Jessica started her career in cybersecurity as a Special Agent/Computer Forensic Examiner in the US Army Criminal Investigation Command. She earned a MBA from Pepperdine University.

bio:
Kevin Gosschalk founded Arkose Labs in 2016 to make attacks unprofitable rather than impossible. Under his leadership, Arkose Labs protects 90% of global internet traffic, analyzing billions of attack sessions annually across gaming, banking, e-commerce, and social media platforms. 

His deep understanding of threat actor economics has redefined industry approaches to fraud prevention.

A recognized thought leader and sought-after advisor, Kevin regularly speaks at major conferences and contributes to threat intelligence publications. Born and educated in Brisbane, Australia, he holds multiple patents in fraud prevention and bot detection technologies.

bio: Roxey Davis is a cybersecurity leader known for turning threat intelligence into action. With a background spanning SOC operations, incident response, and GRC, she builds programs that scale, communicate clearly, and actually work in real-world environments. She currently serves as a GRC Technical Security Analyst and national leader within Cyberjutsu, driving workforce development and community growth. Roxey has spoken at multiple cybersecurity conferences, where she’s known for engaging, practical talks that blend threat research, storytelling, and operational clarity.

bio: Amit Lubovsky is an Investment Director at SoftBank Vision Fund, focusing on cybersecurity and enterprise infrastructure. He has led investments in companies such as Wiz, Cato Networks, Claroty, and Tines. An entrepreneur at heart, Amit co-founded two startups, including Crowdx (acquired by Cellwize) and Tawkon, gaining hands-on experience in building and scaling technology ventures. His career also spans product leadership at Salesforce, Infineon, and Texas Instruments, blending technical depth with strategic investment insight. Amit holds a BSc in Mechanical Engineering and a BA in Computer Science from Tel Aviv University, and an MBA from the Technion – Israel Institute of Technology.

bio: Nate Kharrl, CEO and Co-Founder at Spec, has built leading solutions for application security and fraud challenges since the early days of the cloud era. Drawing from his cyber experience at Akamai, ThreatMetrix, and eBay, Nate helped found Spec to focus on the needs of businesses operating in a landscape of increasing AI risks. Under Nate’s leadership, Spec grew from its mid-pandemic founding to raise $30M in venture-backed funding to build solutions used by Fortune 500 companies transacting billions in online commerce. Spec’s service offerings today include protective measures for websites and APIs that specialize in defending against attacks designed to bypass bot defenses and risk assessment platforms.

Spec’s service offerings today include protective measures for websites and APIs that specialize in defending against attacks designed to bypass bot defenses and risk assessment platforms.

bio: Teju Shyamsundar is an engineer turned product marketer. Currently at Axonius she is focused on driving customer success and value through Axonius’s platform. Prior to Axonius, Teju held roles in field engineering, product marketing, and demand generation at various companies focused on cybersecurity and identity, including Okta, Veza, and Microsoft. Outside of Axonius, Teju enjoys the great outdoors of the Pacific Northwest - may even catch her wrestling some grizzly bears.

bio: With over 17 years of experience in IT and Cybersecurity, T.J. Patterson brings deep technical expertise and a strategic, business risk lens to the evolving threat landscape. His background spans core disciplines, including network and systems engineering, culminating in a focus on business-aligned, risk-centric leadership roles. T.J. currently serves as the Information Security Officer for a community bank in Indiana, where he is critical in bridging technical operations with executive decision-making. A passionate advocate for industry growth, he focuses on building cybersecurity relationships and developing the skills of future leaders. He is an active contributor to the local community, participating in BSides, ISSA, and other regional groups.

bio: Daniel “Dazza” Greenwood is Founder of CIVICS.com, a boutique consultancy for legal technologies, automated transactions, and technology strategy. Dazza is also a Researcher at MIT Media Lab, where he is advancing the field of computational law and generative AI for law as Executive Director of law.MIT.edu. His current focus is use of generative AI for law and legal processes. Dazza consults to Fortune 100 companies, building integrated business, legal, and technology cross-boundary networks at industry scale. As an attorney, Dazza served as both in-house and special counsel for technology law, representing corporations and governments. Dazza has testified before the US House, US Senate, and other legislatures on electronic transactions law and consults extensively to the public sector.

bio: Sean Metcalf  (@PyroTek3) is an Identity Security Architect with TrustedSec. He is one of about 100 people in the world who holds the Microsoft Certified Master Directory Services (MCM) Active Directory certification, is a former Microsoft MVP, and has presented on Active Directory, Azure AD/Entra ID, and Microsoft Cloud attack and defense at security conferences such as Black Hat, Blue Team Con, BSides, DEF CON, DerbyCon, RSAC Conference, Troopers, and the internal Microsoft BlueHat security conference. Sean is also a Co-Host on the popular podcast "Enterprise Security Weekly" with recordings available on YouTube. People may have read some of his Active Directory and Entra ID security articles on his site, ADSecurity.org.

bio: Sounil Yu is a Christian, husband, and father with 30+ years of security experience. He's the Creator of the Cyber Defense Matrix and the DIE Triad, member of the IANS Faculty, Sr Fellow at GMU Scalia Law School's National Security Institute, Guest Lecturer at Carnegie Mellon, and Advisor to many startups. Sounil is the Co-Founder and Chief AI Officer at Knostic and previously served as JupiterOne's CISO, YL Ventures' CISO-in-Residence, and Bank of America's Chief Security Scientist. He has 20+ granted patents, is a recipient of the SANS Lifetime Achievement Award, and was inducted into the Cybersecurity Hall of Fame. Although on occasion he is forced to write about himself in the third person, he would rather meet people in first person to share experiences and new ideas.

bio: As Global Managing Partner of Cybersecurity Services at IBM, Mark Hughes is accountable for IBM's security business globally, helping organizations to stay one step ahead of cyberthreats and reduce the risks. Prior to IBM, Mark was president of Security for DXC Technology where he was responsible for DXC’s Security business including cyber defense, digital identity, secured infrastructure, and security risk management. Mark joined DXC from BT where he most recently served as chief executive of BT Security. In 2013 Mark led the formation of BT Security, which has become a global leader with 3,000 cybersecurity experts across 15 security operation centers globally and double-digit annual revenue growth. He began his career in the British Army. He is a member of the WEF's Global Cyber Board.

bio: Dean Sysman is a world-renowned entrepreneur and expert in cybersecurity. He's been honored with a place on the Forbes Under 30 Israel list, and was a winner of the EY Entrepreneur of the Year Award in New York. Dean is the CEO and co-founder of Axonius, a world leader in enabling organizations to see and secure their infrastructure. Before Axonius, Dean was CTO and co-founder of Cymmetria, a YC-backed cyber deception company with Fortune 500 customers that was acquired by private equity. He is an alumnus of the rank of Captain of an elite unit in the Israeli Intelligence Corps, during which he received the highest commendation for non-combat activity. Dean is an early-stage investor in over 15 companies that together are valued at over $25B.

bio: Kat Traxler is the Principal Security Researcher at Vectra AI, focusing on abuse techniques and vulnerabilities in the public cloud. Before her current role, she worked at various stages in the SDLC, performing web application penetration testing and security architecture. Kat’s research philosophy directs her work to where design flaws and misconfigurations are most probable. This guiding principle leads her research to the intersection of technologies, particularly the convergence of cloud security and application security, and where the OS layer interfaces with higher-level abstractions. Kat has presented at conferences worldwide on topics such as privilege escalation in GCP and bug-hunting in the cloud. She can be found on the internet as @nightmareJS.

bio: Craig Lisher is Senior Legal Counsel for Cybersecurity at Salesforce, where he advises on AI risk, cybersecurity strategy, and legal issues impacting the company’s Government Cloud. A 21-year FBI veteran, he served as Special Counsel to the National Security Branch and Deputy Chief of Staff to the Acting Director. He served on the FBI Director’s Committee on AI, shaping national security policy on emerging tech. Craig teaches Intelligence and Counterterrorism Law at Antonin Scalia Law School. He brings decades of experience at the intersection of law, technology, and national security, bridging AI policy, legal risk, and public-private threat response.
globalBio: Craig Lisher is Senior Legal Counsel for Cybersecurity at Salesforce, where he advises on AI risk, cybersecurity strategy, and legal issues impacting the company’s Government Cloud. A 21-year FBI veteran, he served as Special Counsel to the National Security Branch and Deputy Chief of Staff to the Acting Director. He served on the FBI Director’s Committee on AI, shaping national security policy on emerging tech. Craig teaches Intelligence and Counterterrorism Law at Antonin Scalia Law School. He brings decades of experience at the intersection of law, technology, and national security, bridging AI policy, legal risk, and public-private threat response.

bio: Douglas J. Landoll, CISSP, MBA, ISSA Distinguished Fellow, is a recognized leader in cybersecurity governance, risk, and compliance with over 35 years of experience advising corporations, government agencies, and critical infrastructure providers. As the author of foundational texts including, "The Security Risk Assessment Handbook" and "The CMMC Assessment Handbook," his work has shaped academic programs and professional practices alike. Through his consultancy, Lantego, he delivers expert training, policy development, and compliance services. A frequent speaker at leading security conferences, Douglas is known for translating complex security challenges into clear, actionable strategies that influence both policy and practice.

bio:
From CIA spy to CISO, Ross Young has spent two decades pushing the boundaries of cybersecurity
Ross is the Co-Host of "CISO Tradecraft," creator of the OWASP Threat and Safeguard Matrix (TaSM), and a seasoned cybersecurity leader. He has served as CISO in Residence at Team8, CISO of Caterpillar Financial, and an instructor at Johns Hopkins University. Previously, Ross was a divisional CISO at Capital One and has over a decade worth of cybersecurity experience across CIA, NSA, and the Federal Reserve Board. Ross holds Master's and Bachelor's degrees from Johns Hopkins University, Idaho State University, and Utah State University. Ross is also designated as a Boardroom Certified Qualified Technology Expert (QTE) and a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP).

bio: Richard Seewald is the Founder and Managing Partner at Evolution Equity Partners, bringing over three decades of investment, operational, and entrepreneurial experience to his role. Under his leadership, Evolution has become a premier VC firm with multi-billion dollar assets under management investing in category-defining cybersecurity companies including Halcyon, Torq, ProtectAI, SecurityScorecard, Quantexa, Pentera, Snyk, Carbon Black, Talon Cyber, Arctic Wolf, amongst others. Richard holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a Juris Doctor from the New York Law School. He sits on the global advisory board of the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.

bio: Dave Aitel is a veteran offensive security researcher and engineer. A former NSA Computer Scientist, he founded and led Immunity, Inc. before joining OpenAI in 2024. Dave has authored influential infosec tools and papers, advises governments and Fortune 500s, and speaks worldwide on AI and cyber risk. He has recently authored the paper, "AI and Secure Code Generation" with Dan Geer for Lawfare.

bio: Julio Poveda is a PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Maryland. He does cybersecurity and privacy research, and he is a volunteer at Cornell University's Clinic to End Technology Abuse (CETA), where he helps survivors of intimate partner violence tackle technology-facilitated abuse. His work has been featured by the Washington Post, New Scientist magazine, Krebs on Security, WUSA9, and he has co-led digital safety trainings for organizations like the US National Network to End Domestic Violence and Rights and Security International.

bio: Laurens Sion is a Research Expert on Privacy Engineering at the DistriNet research group at the Department of Computer Science at KU Leuven. His research focuses security and privacy threat modeling and automating several facets of threat modeling (creating models, elicitation, risk analysis, etc.). Two key projects in this area are the SPARTA Threat Modeling Tool and the LINDDUN Privacy Threat Modeling Framework. His research interests are in how these design-level analysis activities for security and privacy activities integrate in other development activities (DevOps). For example, automated reconstruction of design models (or verifying their correspondence with code) to enable a tighter integration as part of continuous integration pipelines.

bio: Jake Williams (aka MalwareJake) is a seasoned security researcher with decades of experience in the technology and security industries. Jake is a former Startup Founder, former Senior SANS Instructor and Course Author, and an Intelligence Community and Military Veteran. Today, Jake is the VP of R&D at Hunter Strategy, an IANS Faculty Member, and an independent security consultant. Jake’s current research and consulting focus on the intersection of AI and machine learning with cybersecurity. He has twice won the DoD Cyber Crime Center (DC3) annual digital forensics challenge and is the recipient of the NSA Exceptional Civilian Service Award.

bio: Dr. Kaouther Ouenniche is a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Dashlane, a leading cybersecurity company specializing in credential management. With a PhD in Artificial Intelligence and a record of published research, she combines academic rigor with hands-on industry expertise to build proactive, data-driven defenses for threat detection and mitigation. Kaouther focuses particularly on privacy-preserving machine learning systems that anticipate and neutralize cybersecurity threats.

bio: Joe Slowik has spent over 15 years in Information Security, split between US Government service and the commercial sector. Throughout this time, Joe focused extensively on threat actor tradecraft and behaviors and is passionate about concerning the role adversary understanding and intelligence has to play in enabling focused, realistic network defense operations. Currently leading cybersecurity alerting strategy for Dataminr, Joe has previously led various operations at organizations including the MITRE Corporation, Los Alamos National Laboratory, Dragos, and DomainTools.

bio: Joshua Saxe leads foundational work at Meta focused on building secure AI systems and applying AI to improve Meta's security. Before joining Meta, he served as Chief Scientist at Sophos, Principal Investigator on multiple DARPA programs at Two Six Labs, and led machine learning security research at Applied Minds. Joshua co-authored the book "Malware Data Science" with Hillary Sanders, published by No Starch Press. He has published numerous papers and patents on security AI, and has presented at conferences including Defcon, Blackhat, and RSAC Conference.

bio: Dr. Dustin Sachs is a cybersecurity behavioral scientist and Founder of PsyberCog Labs. He specializes in translating human behavior into measurable cyber risk reduction. With deep experience across multiple industry verticals, he helps leaders move from checkbox compliance to operationalized security culture. His work integrates behavioral and decision sciences, and enterprise cybersecurity to improve decision quality, execution velocity, and resilience at scale. A best-selling author and frequent speaker, Dustin is known for turning complex frameworks like NIST and ISO into workflows people actually use. His focus is simple: validate decisions, harden execution, and make secure behavior the default, not the exception.

bio: Candy Alexander is an internationally recognized cybersecurity leader and executive advisor helping organizations align security, cyber risk, and AI initiatives with business goals while building stakeholder confidence. A past two-term President of ISSA International and founding President of the ISSA Education Foundation, she spearheaded the Cyber Security Career Lifecycle and annual ISSA/ESG “State of the Cybersecurity Profession” research. She has contributed to Cloud Security Alliance AI research and has been recognized as the #1 Security Executive by IFSEC, a Top Woman in IT Security — Cyber Veteran by SC Media and inducted into the ISSA International Hall of Fame.

bio: Corey Hlavacek is a cybersecurity leader who champions security as a business enabler. With two decades of experience across Fortune 500 companies in transportation, logistics, manufacturing, and high-tech, Corey builds resilient, risk-optimized security programs aligned with regulatory and industry best practices. Corey holds a Master of Science in Information Systems Security and certifications including CISSP, CISM, C|CISO, CIPP, CIA, CISA, and CEH. Recent speaking engagements include BSides Fort Wayne 2025 (“Breaking Up Safely: Cybersecurity Essentials for Divestitures”), AI Agent & Copilot Summit North America 2025 (“Navigating the Copilot and AI Landscape”), and Hacker Halted 2025 (session on advanced threat defense).

bio: Blake Darché leads Cloudforce One, the threat operations and research arm of Cloudflare. With over 20 years of experience in Information Security, Blake spearheads a global team dedicated to monitoring, analyzing, and disrupting emerging cyberthreats by leveraging Cloudflare’s unparalleled network visibility. His expertise spans the spectrum of threat intelligence, detection engineering, and response operations. Beyond operational leadership, Blake is a prominent cybersecurity investor and advisor, backing high-growth startups. He has an MS in Security Informatics from Johns Hopkins University and a BS in IT from the RIT. A recognized thought leader, he holds multiple patents, has authored numerous industry publications, and remains a vocal advocate for innovation in enterprise security.

bio: Oliver Friedrichs is General Manager, AI Detection and Response at CrowdStrike. He was Founder & CEO of Pangea, an AI security pioneer acquired by CrowdStrike. He founded Phantom, creators of the SOAR market (acquired by Splunk), Immunet, an early Endpoint Detection and Response provider (acquired by Sourcefire/Cisco), SecurityFocus, an early Threat Intel provider (acquired by Symantec), and Secure Networks, an early Exposure Management provider (acquired by McAfee). With 33 patents and three security books, Oliver has spent over three decades shaping the cybersecurity landscape.

bio: Glauco Sampaio is a cybersecurity professional since 1999 working for big companies in Brazil with the last 15 years as CISO. Glauco is the Founder & CEO at Beephish. Glauco is an investor, advisor, and board member for startups since 2020. Glauco is also a teacher for cybersecurity and open finance in post-graduation.

bio: Dale Bowie is a Senior Software Engineer and Master Inventor at IBM. Since graduating over a decade ago with a degree in software engineering and artificial intelligence, Dale has developed vendor products in a variety of security domains. This began with some early multi-factor authentication access management software, before moving into network security spaces such as intrusion detection/prevention (IDS/IPS), Secure Access Service Edge (SASE), Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), and Network Detection and Response (NDR). He is currently applying his experience to the domain of digitally verifiable credentials. Throughout that time, he has held various engineering, architecture, and product ownership leadership positions.

bio: Mason Posilkin leads Capital One's Cyber Fraud Intelligence function focused on consumer security, providing tactical and strategic intelligence to mitigate large-scale cyber fraud attacks. Before Capital One, he was a Senior Manager for Financial Crimes and Identity at Chime Financial, joining when the company was 200 employees. He previously worked as a federal special agent investigating financial and cyber crimes. Mason lives in the Chicago area with his wife and two children.

He previously worked as a federal special agent investigating financial and cyber crimes. Mason lives in the Chicago area with his wife and two children.

bio: Meghan Jacquot is a Cybersecurity Engineer at Carnegie Mellon University’s Software Engineering Institute in the CERT division. She is also an adjunct professor of cybersecurity at CMU. Within her work at CERT, Meghan has led a team to develop generative AI bots for offensive security for CISA, analyzed international cybersecurity frameworks, and worked on the enhancement of resiliency for cybersecurity maturity models and training. She enjoys working on emerging technology and cyber resiliency. Throughout the year, she helps a variety of organizations including DEF CON as a SOC GOON, CyberCanon, The Diana Initiative, and OWASP.  She often reviews CFPs and mentors new speakers. To relax she also spends time visiting national parks with her partner and hanging with her chinchilla.

bio: Karen Ng is a Risk Analyst at GGR Security and is one of GGR's entry team for physical penetration tests. She has a strong interest in physical security, delivering trainings on physical security vulnerabilities to a wide range of audiences. Karen comes from a background in engineering and has extensive experience in major event logistics. She is one of the Village Leads at the Physical Security Village and works with the rest of the PSV team to teach how to recognize and fix security exploits to the community. Graphic design is her passion.

bio: Raffael Schneider is a Platform Engineer at Helvetia Insurance, where he helps design and operate a high-traffic web ingress platform securing over 100 business-critical web applications. With a background in DevSecOps, reverse proxy architecture, and SRE practices, he focuses on building systems that are secure by default yet flexible enough to support developers, QA teams, and operations. Passionate about developer experience, automation, and scalable platform design, Raffael works at the intersection of infrastructure and security to streamline integrations and ensure that even complex components like ModSecurity fit cleanly into the development lifecycle.

Passionate about developer experience, automation, and scalable platform design, Raffael works at the intersection of infrastructure and security to streamline integrations and ensure that even complex components like ModSecurity fit cleanly into the development lifecycle.

bio: Akhila Chitiprolu leads Security Governance, Risk and Compliance at Sierra, enabling responsible AI adoption across regulated industries including financial services, healthcare, and insurance. She previously managed Technology GRC at Stripe and served on the PCI Security Standards Council Board of Advisors. Akhila has also held security and compliance leadership roles at Deloitte, Expedia, and T-Mobile, bringing deep experience in scaling trust programs in transformative, high-scale enterprise environments.

bio: Feng-Hao Liu is an Associate Professor at the EECS department of WSU. He received a PhD degree in Computer Science from Brown University in 2013 and then joined the Maryland Cybersecurity Center at University of Maryland as a postdoctoral researcher from 2013–2015. In 2015, he joined FAU as an Assistant Professor and then became an Associate Professor in 2021. In 2013, he joined WSU as an Associate Professor. His research interests span the realms of post-quantum and lattice-based cryptography, fully homomorphic encryption, multiparty computation, tamper/leakage-resilient designs, and the foundational aspects of cryptography.

bio: Austin Anderson is the Cloud Security Lead at Rivian Automotive. He is responsible for leading the strategic direction of software security, cloud security, and penetration testing across the enterprise. Austin's expertise lies in driving security as an enabler, building scalable automation and custom internal tools that directly match the organization's speed and deployment volume. Prior to Rivian, Austin was a Cloud Security Leader at the Ernst & Young consulting practice.

bio: A. Ali Mohammed is a Senior OT Cyber Security Engineer and Head of the OT R&D Lab at Resilience, leading security solutions for critical infrastructure in Saudi Arabia. He architected Resilience's OT SOC and secure remote access platforms for water utilities, defense manufacturing, and petrochemical facilities. His expertise spans OT/ICS governance, security engineering, and NCA compliance. Ali's research focuses on AI integration in industrial environments, emphasizing AI-assisted SOC investigations respecting operational safety constraints. He delivers advanced OT/ICS and offensive security training across energy and manufacturing sectors. Ali holds an MSc in Cybersecurity from KFUPM and has published in ACM conferences.

bio: A long time ago, Craig Chamberlain volunteered to create detection features for a security software product startup, and he has been working on threat hunting and detection ever since. His 25-year experience ranges from serving as a principal at three successful security product startups to acting as a special consultant for security at apex level finance and defense sector firms. As a principal researcher and area lead at Elastic, he developed the first ML jobs for cloudtrail threat hunting and detection among other features. He is a Member of the review board at CAMLIS and a Policy Attaché at DEFCON. He has presented at numerous conferences.

bio: Dan Gunter is the Founder and CEO of Insane Cyber, advancing cybersecurity for industrial and critical infrastructure defenders. With over a decade in OT security, incident response, and threat intelligence, he has led teams through some of the world’s toughest cyber challenges. A former US Air Force Cyber Warfare Officer, Dan served at AFCERT and US Cyber Command and was selected for DoD’s elite Computer Network Operations Development Program. He holds advanced degrees in computer science, a SANS Graduate Certificate in Incident Response, and multiple top industry certifications. At Insane Cyber, he and his team deliver rapid, analyst-friendly workflows that help operators detect, hunt, and respond with unmatched speed and confidence.

bio: Elliott Franklin is Senior Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer at Fortitude Re, where he leads the company’s global cybersecurity strategy. With more than 20 years of experience, he has built and matured security programs that align with business goals, regulatory expectations, and board-level priorities. Elliott is recognized for transforming security into a business enabler by integrating frameworks such as NIST, developing actionable metrics, and fostering trust across executive teams. His leadership style focuses on empowering people, balancing innovation with strong cyber hygiene, and ensuring security enhances rather than hinders daily operations.

bio: Dirce E. Hernandez is a cybersecurity, risk, and governance leader with 19 years of experience across healthcare, financial services, and other highly regulated industries. He currently works in the healthcare sector, leading enterprise cybersecurity governance, compliance, and risk management initiatives. He previously spent a significant portion of his career in financial services, supporting banking and insurance organizations and serving in leadership and working group chair roles within FS-ISAC. Dirce is an active Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) contributor and reviewer and is also a leader of the cybersecurity non-profit, Raices Cyber. His current focus includes AI security, risk, and governance, helping organizations adopt AI responsibly while maintaining regulatory readiness.

bio: Christiaan Brand Co-Founded financial services security firm, Entersekt in 2009. He has since moved to Google where he's part of their Security and Identity teams. Christiaan is a frequent industry commentator on all areas involving cybercrime and cybersecurity and Co-chair of the FIDO2 technical working group at the FIDO Alliance looking to standardize strong online security protocols and passkeys.

bio: Dr. Chris Pierson is the Founder & CEO of BlackCloak, the pioneer of digital executive protection for corporate executives and high-profile persons in their personal lives. A prior CISO, Chris has been on the front lines of cybersecurity for over 25 years. His experience includes fighting fraud and hackers at the world’s third largest bank, working with the DHS on its Cybersecurity Subcommittee and Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee, as the President of the Arizona Infragard, and in various other roles as a CISO and GC for companies supporting top banks. He and his teams have received numerous industry awards. Chris is a globally recognized Keynote Speaker, Board Advisor for startups, a Distinguished Fellow of the Ponemon Institute, and is frequently quoted by the media.

bio: George "Trey" Bilbrey is the Lead of SCYTHE Labs, specializing in purple team exercises, threat emulation, critical infrastructure, and holistic cyber operations. Trey's 17+ years of industry experience have allowed him to become an excellent educator, defender of networks, and cultivator of cybersecurity professionals. Prior to joining SCYTHE, Trey held positions at notable organizations such as Hack The Box (HTB Academy content Developer), The Army Corps of Engineers (ICS/SCADA Penetration Testing), and a veteran of the United States Marine Corps (Defensive and Offensive Cyber Operations). Current certifications include the CISSP, GICSP, GCIP, and K>FiveFour RTAC.

bio: Dom Perri is a Partner and Co-Founder at Altitude Cyber, a strategic advisory firm for cybersecurity founders, startups, investors, and boards. With 20+ years in cybersecurity, M&A, and venture capital, he helps founders navigate challenges and achieve successful outcomes. Previously, Dom was a Partner at Vertex Ventures, investing in early-stage cybersecurity, AI, and infrastructure software. Before venture, he held business and corporate development leadership roles at Juniper Networks, Dropbox, Tesla, and Internet Security Systems. He has advised high-growth startups, contributing to exits to Cisco, Barracuda, and Workday. Dom is a frequent speaker on cybersecurity M&A and market trends.

bio: Marc Davidson is a Cybersecurity Technologist at Check Point Software, helping organizations build resiliency through advanced threat prevention and hybrid mesh security. With 25+ years in cybersecurity, networking, and competitive intelligence—including 24 years at Cisco—he has trained thousands of professionals and authored strategies that shaped market outcomes. At Check Point, Marc publishes blogs on ransomware disruption, IoT/IoMT security, and exposure risk management, and produces technical YouTube analyses of independent security assessments. He combines deep expertise with clear communication to equip CISOs and practitioners with practical, research-backed defenses.

bio: Pav Athwal is General Counsel and Head of Compliance at LILT, an AI startup, where he leads legal, compliance, privacy, and risk strategy across the business. He has 25 years of experience advising organizations from large enterprises to high-growth startups, including Raytheon, DocuSign, Juniper Networks, and Nexthink, and previously ran his own technology law practice. He focuses on artificial intelligence, data governance, and complex technology transactions, and regularly advises executives and boards on various issues. Pav teaches Technology Licensing at Santa Clara University School of Law (alum), is a UC Davis graduate, and serves on the boards of several nonprofit and commercial organizations.

bio: Alexander Lee is a Senior Professional Staff at the Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Lab. His research interests include developing test, evaluation, and assurance capabilities to secure supply chains for artificial intelligence (AI) models. He is a co-principal Investigator for developing a security-centric AI bill of materials (AIBOM) construct and AI Risk Scanning (AIRS) Framework. He has served as a security assessor for cloud service providers in support of the FedRAMP program, a system architect with security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR) tools, and project lead for development of cybersecurity research roadmaps. He holds a Master and Bachelor of Science in Systems and Information Engineering from the University of Virginia, as well as a CISSP certifications.

bio: Steve Martano is a Member of IANS Faculty and a Partner in Artico Search’s cybersecurity practice. He is an expert in security executive recruiting and compensation focused on recruiting CISOs and their teams across various industries. He leads strategic partnerships and initiatives including Artico’s annual CISO Compensation & Budget survey conducted in collaboration with IANS. Prior to Artico, Steve served in Caldwell Partner's cybersecurity practice and at Russell Reynolds Associates. Steve holds a Master’s degree in Finance & Economics from Trinity College and a Bachelor’s degree from The Catholic University of America. Steve serves on the board of Vermont Adaptive Sports, a non-profit organization committed to empowering people of all abilities through inclusive sports programming.

bio: Emma Smith is responsible for Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, IT Architecture and Technology Strategy at Vodafone. She is also responsible for executive ownership for the Board-level Vodafone Technology Committee. Emma has been Global Chief Information Security Officer at Vodafone since 2015, leading an internal security team of over 900 people globally. She has previously held a CSO role in banking. Emma is passionate about security, and active in her pursuit for inclusion for all. Emma is also a Member of the UK Cabinet Office National Cyber Advisory Board, an Independent Advisor for a UK retail company, a Member of the Dell Security Advisory Board and chairs the European Round Table for Industry CISO forum.

bio: Ric is a Principal Security Researcher at Orange Cyberdefense and an Honorary Researcher at Imperial College London. He holds a PhD in Computer Science from Lancaster University, where his research focused on adversary-centric quantitative risk assessment. His work centers on the cybersecurity of operational technology and critical infrastructure, particularly where traditional approaches fall short against the reality of adversary behavior. He focuses on cyberthreats to physical processes, challenging how security is commonly understood in operational technology environments.

bio: Tyler Nighswander (tylerni7) is a computer security expert who loves competitions. With his team he has won the prestigious Defcon CTF nine times--more than any other team in history. In 2016 he was on the team to win DARPA's Cyber Grand Challenge to build a fully autonomous system to find and patch software, and in 2025 he led team Theori to third place at the DARPA AI Cyber Challenge. Tyler holds degrees in Computer Science and Physics from Carnegie Mellon University. His research interests include reverse engineering, fuzzing, exploit development, cryptography, and AI. He works on Theori's Xint team doing research and development of all things computer security related.

He works on Theori's Xint team doing research and development of all things computer security related.

bio: Jason Rolleston is the General Manager of the Enterprise Security Group at Broadcom (ESG). He is responsible for Broadcom’s combined portfolio of Symantec and Carbon Black solutions for Information, Network, Endpoint, and Application Security. The Enterprise Security Group delivers legendary enterprise security solutions to protect any business. Previously, Jason led the Carbon Black business through acquisition by Broadcom. Prior to this role he was the CPO at Kenna Security where he led the company through acquisition by Cisco Systems. He has held executive leadership positions at Symantec, McAfee, Intel, and Cisco. Jason holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, along with a Master's and BS in Engineering from Cornell University.

bio: Richard William Bird is the Chief Security Officer for Singulr, an AI security and governance solution, and a six-time C-level executive in the corporate and startup world. Internationally recognized for his expertise in AI security, data privacy, digital consumer rights, API, and identity security, he is a sought-after speaker who addresses modern challenges with humor and clarity. His debut book, "Famous With 12 People: A Career Guide on Becoming an Internationally Recognized Expert in Something Nobody Cares About," offers practical advice on personal branding, public speaking, and networking. Richard is frequently quoted in the media and has been featured by ISMG, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Bloomberg, Financial Times, Business Insider, CNN, Dark Reading, and TechRepublic.

bio: Xavier Bird is a practicing psychologist and holder of a Psychology Doctorate (PsyD). Xavier's professional interest is counseling and therapy for adolescents, particularly those on the autistic spectrum. It is a personal calling as he was diagnosed with Autistic Spectrum Disorder (ASD) at nine years old. Xavier's dissertation focuses on how social media personalities and the digital world impact the self-image of young people. His research isn't limited to academia, as he is an avid gamer and Twitch streamer, and has experienced firsthand how negative behaviors cause actual and tangible harm to kids during their formative years.

bio: Ted Schlein is a leading investor in cybersecurity. His career in venture capital spans 30 years, including at Kleiner Perkins, where he’s led many successful investments (AlienVault, ArcSight, CarbonBlack, Chegg, LifeLock, Mandiant, Phantom Security, and Shape Security). Ted is Chairman and General Partner of the cybersecurity VC firm Ballistic Ventures. Previously, he was the founding CEO of Fortify Software and was VP of Enterprise Solutions at Symantec, where he launched its commercial antivirus solution. His work as a Member of the Board of Trustees at the National Security Agency and at InQTel, highlight his strategic vision in both business and policy decisions. He also serves on the Board of Trustees at the University of Pennsylvania, his alma mater.

bio: Ankit Gupta is a cybersecurity expert with over 15 years of experience leading innovative security programs focused on cloud security, identity governance, AI-driven threat detection, and Zero Trust architecture. Ankit specializes in building strategies that protect organizations from evolving digital threats while maintaining regulatory compliance. He frequently speaks at industry events, contributes thought leadership articles, and advises organizations on securely implementing emerging technologies.

bio: Michael J. Rothschild is a seasoned cybersecurity marketing executive serving as Vice President of Product Marketing at Armis. Michael’s dynamic career spans leadership roles at cybersecurity trailblazers where he consistently redefined product marketing strategy, executed global launches, and elevated brand visibility. Beyond his executive roles, Michael is a recognized speaker, trusted advisor, and passionate educator. He serves on advisory boards for cybersecurity programs at Ithaca College and Rutgers University, has taught marketing at Yeshiva University, and holds multiple certifications including Ethical Hacking, CompTIA Security+, and Pragmatic Marketing.

bio: Lisa Lee serves as Global Financial Services Lead in the Office of the CISO at one of the world’s largest tech companies. She advises globally significant institutions on cyber incidents, cloud and identity security architecture, and enterprise resilience. Lisa drives executive engagement on threat intel, AI and identity risk, and regulatory compliance and represents Microsoft as a senior technical authority with CISOs, CIOs, and regulators. She partners with security engineering and research teams to translate emerging threats into actionable controls. Previously, as a Federal IT Bank Examiner, she co‑authored national cybersecurity, cloud, and authentication standards. Lisa is a recognized industry leader in shaping the future security workforce and sits on the EWF Board of Advisors.

bio:
Vandana Verma is a global cybersecurity leader, community builder, and advocate for diversity in tech. With over 19 years of experience across application security, cloud security, DevSecOps, and AI security, she has helped organizations strengthen their security posture while fostering a culture of secure development.
Vandana is also deeply involved in advancing research on software supply chain security, SBOMs, and securing AI/LLM applications, having contributed to global projects like the OWASP GenAI and OWASP DevSecOps initiatives. An international speaker and trainer, Vandana has delivered Keynotes, workshops, and panels at prestigious conferences including Black Hat, AppSec Days, RSAC Conference, and regional security summits.

bio: Aurobindo (Robin) Sundaram is the Head of Information Assurance & Data Protection (CISO) at RELX, a global provider of information-based analytics for professional and business customers, enabling them to make better decisions, get better results, and be more productive. He works closely with the company’s Board of Directors, Group & division CEOs and functional heads, Chief Technology Officers, and Chief Information Security Officers to articulate and implement RELX’s global cybersecurity program. His remit extends across 36,000+ employees, offices in 40+ countries, and customers in 180+ countries. Robin has graduate degrees in computer science and management and is a CISSP.

bio: Steve Wilson, Chief AI and Product Officer at Exabeam, is a pioneer in generative AI and cybersecurity, advancing both AI-powered cyber defense and securing AI systems. As the Founder and Co-Lead of the OWASP Gen AI Security Project, he leads a global community of nearly 20,000 individuals producing leading research into LLM and Agentic security issues. As the Author of O’Reilly Media’s "The Developer’s Playbook for Large Language Model Security," Steve provides a comprehensive framework for secure AI. He holds 11 US and international patents, was named the 2023 Cybersecurity Innovation Leader of the Year by Enterprise Security Tech, and his 2024 RSAC Conference talk was voted a Top-Rated Session.

bio: Phil Venables is a Partner at Ballistic Ventures working on early stage cyber investments and the growth of a leading portfolio of companies. He is also a Senior Advisor at Warburg Pincus. Previously, Phil was the first Chief Information Security Officer of Google Cloud where he led the risk, security, compliance, and privacy teams and drove many AI security initiatives. Before joining Google, he was a Partner at Goldman Sachs where he held multiple roles over a long career, initially as their first Chief Information Security Officer, a role he held for 17 years. In subsequent roles, he was Chief Operational Risk Officer, an operating partner in their private equity business, and a Board Director of Goldman Sachs Bank.

Before joining Google, he was a Partner at Goldman Sachs where he held multiple roles over a long career, initially as their first Chief Information Security Officer, a role he held for 17 years. In subsequent roles, he was Chief Operational Risk Officer, an operating partner in their private equity business, and a Board Director of Goldman Sachs Bank.

bio: Josh Woodruff is the Founder and CEO of MassiveScale.AI, a security-first AI consultancy helping organizations adopt agentic AI and Zero Trust securely. With nearly 30 years of experience leading global security, cloud, and IT transformations at startups and Fortune 500 companies - including eBay, Microsoft, and Zuora - he combines technical depth with executive leadership. A recognized Zero Trust thought leader, Josh co-leads the Cloud Security Alliance Zero Trust Working Group, serves as IANS Faculty, and advises Fortune 100 enterprises across biotech, aerospace, defense, healthcare, and critical infrastructure. He is also the Author of "Agentic AI + Zero Trust," guiding business leaders to securely harness the power of AI while advancing innovation and resilience.
globalBio: Josh Woodruff is the Founder and CEO of MassiveScale.AI, a security-first AI consultancy helping organizations adopt agentic AI and Zero Trust securely. With nearly 30 years of experience leading global security, cloud, and IT transformations at startups and Fortune 500 companies - including eBay, Microsoft, and Zuora - he combines technical depth with executive leadership. A recognized Zero Trust thought leader, Josh co-leads the Cloud Security Alliance Zero Trust Working Group, serves as IANS Faculty, and advises Fortune 100 enterprises across biotech, aerospace, defense, healthcare, and critical infrastructure. He is also the Author of "Agentic AI + Zero Trust," guiding business leaders to securely harness the power of AI while advancing innovation and resilience.

bio: David Kosorok is the Director of Information Security Programs at Toast, where he leads Product Security, Corporate Security, Customer Trust and Safety, and the SOC. With 25+ years in software and over 16 years in security, he has built and scaled security programs at organizations including DocuSign, Hyland, Align, and SAP Concur. David holds multiple security certifications, serves on EC-Council’s Global Advisory Board for CEH, and remains an active contributor to the security community.

bio: Seeyew Mo is the Senior Advisor for Cyber Maryland where he leads the state's cyber workforce development. He also serves as the Director of Training for DEF CON. He previously served as the Assistant National Cyber Director for Cyber Workforce, Training and Education at the Office of National Cyber Director (ONCD). In his role, Seeyew leads and coordinates the implementation the White House’s National Cyber Workforce and Education Strategy. He believes in taking a holistic view – doctrine, people, and technology - to making advancements in cyber workforce and digital safety awareness. Seeyew is an expert in the intersection of cybersecurity, technology, and national security with 18 years of experience spanning tech development, policymaking, and political campaigning.

bio: Alex Pinto is one of the authors and leads the Verizon DBIR team. He joined Verizon in 2018, after it acquired his machine learning-based network detection company, Niddel. Before that, Alex was a Founder of Cipher Security, a worldwide security services provider originated in Brazil and since then acquired by Prosegur. Alex has over 20 years of experience in building security solutions, focused on the application of data science on cybersecurity. He is a frequent speaker in cybersecurity conferences, such as Black Hat and RSAC Conference, and holds multiple industry certifications.

bio: Jason Lam is a SANS Principal Instructor and Author of two courses in cloud and leadership. He also leads one of the security consulting practices at World Wide Technology, advising Global 500 companies on defending against emerging threats. With over 20 years in Information Security, his experience spans from technical threat research to CISO-level leadership. Jason specializes in incident response, penetration testing, cloud security, and enterprise security architecture, sharing practical insights from securing large-scale environments to help professionals navigate the evolving threat landscape.

bio: Chris Wysopal is an entrepreneur, computer security expert, and Co-Founder and Chief Security Evangelist of Veracode, which pioneered the concept of using automated static binary analysis to discover vulnerabilities in software. Prior to Veracode, Chris was Vice President of Research and Development at security consultancy @stake, which was acquired by Symantec. In the 90s, Chris was one of the first vulnerability researchers as a member of the L0pht. Chris was instrumental in developing industry guidelines for responsible disclosure of software vulnerabilities.

bio: George Litvinov is a Security Engineer at Google where he specializes in securing the open source software that power Google's products. His work involves proactively hardening critical frameworks and remediating vulnerabilities at scale. His approach to building proactive defenses is informed by his prior experience as an Incident Response Consultant at Mandiant, where he guided organizations through and the aftermath of major cyberattacks.

bio: Adrian Sanabria is a successful generalist with over two decades of experience hacking, fixing, breaking, building, and teaching in InfoSec. He’s always trying to see the big picture and figure out the best security strategies. Despite all these years in the industry, he is still optimistic about the future.

bio: Rick Howard is the CEO of the Cybersecurity Canon Project (a Rock & Roll Hall of Fame for cybersecurity books). His past Jobs: CSO and podcast Host at The Cyberwire (podcasting network), CSO for Palo Alto Networks (security vendor), CISO for TASC (government contractor), GM for iDefense (cyberthreat intelligence service at Verisign), SOC Director for Counterpane (MSSP), and Commander for the Army’s CERT (CISO). He was one of the Founders of the Cyber Threat Alliance (a security vendor ISAC) and is a Co-Gounder of the Cybersecurity Canon Project. Rick holds a Master of Computer Science degree from the Naval Postgraduate School and an Engineering degree from the Military Academy where he taught computer science for six years. He has published one book and executive edited two others

bio: Swara Gandhi, a Senior Solutions Architect at AWS with over six years of experience in identity, security, and cloud governance. Swara works closely with engineering teams on product design in AWS IAM, Trusted Identity Propagation, AWS Identity Center, automated reasoning, and bridging disparate identity systems across cloud and enterprise environments. Swara authored 10+ technical blogs for AWS, contributed to open source policy repositories, and has had the opportunity to speak multiple times at flagship AWS events like re:Inforce and re:Invent.

bio: Sumon Dantiki is a Partner and Co-Chair of Baker McKenzie's National Security Practice and is widely recognized as a leading professional on issues involving security, technology, and law. A former federal prosecutor, Sumon previously held several senior sensitive positions with the US Department of Justice, including serving as Special Counsel to the Assistant Attorney General for National Security and Senior Counselor to the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. In private practice, Sumon has led a variety of pathbreaking cyber, national security, and investigative matters. He is a trusted strategist for complex investigations, disputes, and transactional counseling, often with cyber, national security, and global aspects.

bio: The Retail & Hospitality ISAC is the cybersecurity sharing and collaboration community for the global consumer-facing business sector. As the RH-ISAC’s vice president of membership, Luke Vander Linden is responsible for member growth and engagement and, as part of the leadership team, overall organizational strategy. The RH-ISAC is a dynamic community with nearly 350 member companies, representing over 4,500 cybersecurity professionals. Prior to joining the RH-ISAC, Luke held similar positions at the Society for Corporate Governance and the Academy of Management. For two decades, he also had a long career in nonprofit fundraising and operations. Luke lives in Connecticut with his wife and two sons. He volunteers with multiple community organizations and serves on several nonprofit boards.

bio: Joey Melo is an AI Red Teamer at Crowdstrike and a contributor to AI Safety programs at OpenAI and Anthropic. His expertise was showcased when he ranked second among 30,000 competitors in the HackAPrompt 2.0 AI hacking competition and took first place in Pangea’s own AI escape room challenge. An OSCP, OSCE3, and BSCP certified penetration tester, Joey specializes in web security, exploit development, and reverse engineering, constantly honing his skills in high-pressure CTF environments.

bio: Erica R. Bomsey is Senior Vice President/Deputy General Counsel, Cybersecurity & Privacy at Leidos. In this role, she leads the cybersecurity, security, technology, and data privacy functions in the Leidos Corporate Law Dept. Erica joined Leidos in September 2023 after serving as Assistant General Counsel/Corporate Director, Information Security at Northrop Grumman from 2020-2023. Before joining Northrop Grumman, she held various roles in the Office of the Director of National Intelligence from 2011-2020, most recently serving as Deputy General Counsel for Counterterrorism & Intelligence. Erica received her Juris Doctor (International Law) and Master’s Degree (International Affairs) from American University. She earned her Bachelor’s Degree from the University of Virginia.

bio: Graham Harwood is a Professional Staff Member on the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform under Ranking Member Robert Garcia, covering national security, foreign policy, cybersecurity, economics, and government operations. Prior to his career in policy, Graham worked as an engineering lead, systems reliability engineer, software engineer, and quantitative analyst for trading firms and banks. His academic research includes cybersecurity, national security, economic, financial, and foreign policy issues. He holds a Bachelors Degree from Cornell University in Information Science, Systems, and Technology from Cornell University and a Masters in Public Policy from the University of Chicago.

bio: Monique Head is a cybersecurity leader with extensive experience driving education and awareness programs at Netflix, Palo Alto Networks, PayPal, HPE, and Visa. Skilled across GRC, training design, and enterprise engagement, she leverages AI to build scalable, effective learning programs that elevate cyber readiness for employees and the public. She founded CyberTorial.org to empower vulnerable digital citizens through edutainment and inspire cybersecurity careers. Monique also serves as the Director of Security Education & Training for Cyversity.

bio: Dr. Sara Rabinovitch, PhD, is a licensed clinical psychologist and workplace wellbeing expert specializing in evidence-based mental health solutions for high-performance professionals. Sara applies a science-backed approach to help individuals and teams thrive in demanding environments. She received her PhD from the University of Oregon and her BA from New York University. Sara completed pre-doctoral training at the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) and postdoctoral training at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center. She is extensively trained in MBSR through UCSD Center for Mindfulness at UCSD School of Medicine.

bio: Ashok Nimmagadda is a Security Engineer at Intuit Inc, where he specializes in Developing secure AI-driven financial and healthcare platforms. With a career defined by technical hands-on at major organizations including Equifax, Stellantis, Pfizer, and IEHP. Ashok possesses deep expertise in offensive application security and cloud security. He leverages this specialized knowledge to emulate sophisticated adversaries, thereby fortifying enterprise defenses against complex threats. Prior to his current role, Ashok served as a Lead Security Engineer, where he architected and implemented enterprise-level security protocols for critical APIs and infrastructure.

bio: Raja Mukerji is the Chief Scientist and Co-Founder at ExtraHop, where he drives innovation in network detection and response. A pioneer in real-time analytics, Raja blends deep technical expertise with a passion for solving complex security challenges at scale. He is a frequent speaker and advisor in the cybersecurity industry. Raja co-founded ExtraHop in 2007 after a seven-year tenure at F5 Networks where he was a Senior Software Architect and Co-Inventor of the TMOS platform. Raja was a lead developer behind the BIG-IP v9 product and the major accounts liaison for critical customer-facing issues within product development. Raja holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Engineering from the Milwaukee School of Engineering.

bio: Aviral Srivastava is a Security Engineer at Amazon focused on AI application security and building enterprise-secure AI systems. His primary research area is offensive security for AI targeting agentic systems and reinforcement learning with red-team methods that surface tool-use abuse and second-prompt risks. His work has appeared in venues such as NeurIPS, ICLR, and ACM. An RSAC Security Scholar, Aviral has spoken at CypherCon, CactusCon, and multiple BSides events, and received “Cybersecurity Innovator of the Year” at BSides Bangalore. He is the Author of "ML for Hackers." Aviral earned an MS in Cybersecurity Analytics and Operations from Penn State University, where he worked on adversarial ML, symbolic execution, and automated exploit generation.

bio: Sezaneh Seymour is VP and Head of Regulatory Risk and Policy at Coalition. For 20 years, she has held policy roles at the nexus of national security, technology, sustainability, and trade. She served as Deputy Assistant US Trade Representative at the Office of the US Trade Representative in the Executive Office of the President where she was responsible for negotiating and enforcing trade agreements. She is the former Senior Advisor to the Deputy Assistant to the President and Deputy National Security Advisor for Cyber and Emerging Technology on the National Security Council. Prior to these roles, she served at the US Department of the Treasury and at the US Department of State. She is a graduate of the National Defense University and earned her PhD from Virginia Tech.

bio: Steve Black is a Professor of Law at Texas Tech University. He has taught at eight law schools, two business schools, and the National University of Singapore. He focuses on cyberlaw, privacy, and financial forensics, and is a popular speaker on topics dealing with the intersection of cybersecurity, technology, privacy, money, and the law. Steve has been cited in Forbes, and his articles have been published in leading national law journals. He has an LLM from the University of Washington, a JD from the J. Reuben Clark Law School, and a BS in Mathematics from Brigham Young University. He began coding at age 12, works with students on entrepreneurship technology, and is teaching himself to play the ukulele.

bio: Harold Byun is Chief Product Officer at BlueRock, an agentic ops observability, and control platform. He has over 25 years of experience in the security industry as both a practitioner and product leader. Prior to joining BlueRock, he held product leadership roles at ServiceNow, Skyhigh Networks, AppOmni, MobileIron, and Symantec. His career includes work in a number of security domains across agentic AI, security orchestration and automated response (SOAR), cloud access security broker (CASB), vuln management, governance risk and compliance (GRC), data loss prevention (DLP), encryption, and data access monitoring. He holds a BA from Tufts University and an MBA from the Haas School of Business at the University of California along with several data security related patents.

bio: Tal Darsan is the Director of MDR services at Cato Networks and member of Cato CTRL. Tal oversees Cato’s threat hunting, security operations, and incident response activities. Prior to joining Cato in 2021, Tal worked at Trusteer (acquired by IBM) and RSA Security in a variety of security research and security operations roles. Tal has more than 15 years of experience analyzing cyberthreats and he's responsible for many in-depth security investigations, including the discovery of new malware strains in the wild. Tal holds a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Computer Science with a specialization in Cybersecurity from The College of Management Academic Studies.

bio: Philip Tsukerman is a Senior Vulnerability Researcher at CyberArk with experience speaking at numerous infosec conferences. He specializes in OS internals, security product design and implementation, and attack mitigations. His latest work focuses on finding novel attack surfaces in agentic AI systems to understand how to design secure, resilient products, and how to protect existing ones against such new threats.
