bio: Gadi Evron is the Founder and CEO of Knostic, an AI security market leader, and chairs the CSides cross-CISO communities conference. Previously, he founded Cymmetria (acquired), was CISO of the Israeli National Digital Authority, founded the Israeli CERT, the ACoD conference, and headed PwC's Cyber Security CoE. He wrote the post-mortem analysis of the "First Internet War" (Estonia 2007), founded some of the first information-sharing groups (TH-Research - 1997, DA/MWP - 2004), wrote APT reports (Rocket Kitten - 2014, Patchwork - 2016, etc.), and the first paper on DNS DDoS Amplification Attacks (2006). Gadi has written two books on cybersecurity, is a contributor to industry publications, and speaker at industry events, from Black Hat (2008, 2015) to Davos (2019), and CISO360 (2022).

bio: A former US Air Force Officer with 30+ years in cybersecurity, Larry Whiteside Jr. is a veteran CISO, CSO, and CTO with leadership roles across DoD, federal, financial services, healthcare, and critical infrastructure. He also serves as a Board Director, guiding organizations in security strategy and risk management. As Co-Founder & President of CONFIDE, a boutique cybersecurity reseller, Larry helps CISOs worldwide navigate evolving challenges with tailored solutions. A trusted advisor to Fortune 2000 security executives, Larry has helped CEOs and boards drive sales, marketing, and retention. A thought leader, he speaks at major conferences like RSAC Conference, Gartner, and ISC2 and Co-Founded Cyversity, a nonprofit increasing minority and women representation in cybersecurity.

bio: Nasrin Rezai is Senior Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer for Verizon. She is responsible for setting information security strategy, policy, standards, architecture and processes. Rezai and her team work with and across Verizon’s business units to protect its customers and its leading networks. Prior to joining Verizon, Nasrin held the position of Global Chief Information and Product Cyber Security Officer at GE. Her previous roles include Global CISO for GE Capital and head of Corporate Governance, Technology Risk and M&A security, for the industrial GE businesses. Throughout her career, Nasrin has promoted engineering and architecture in designing security solutions for large enterprises. She is passionate about helping others develop their potential.

bio: Roi Nisimi has been hacking for a living for the past 12 years. As a Principal Security Researcher at Orca Security, he brings a strong comprehensive understanding of how cyber adversaries operate in the wild. This helps him not only push the business forward with new offerings and features but also contribute to the broader security community via vulnerability research papers. Roi specializes in cloud, Kubernetes, AI, and CI/CD security.

bio: Aditi Shah is a security expert and machine learning practitioner, with a focus on developing artificial intelligence-based solutions to automate security response at Microsoft. She has a decade of experience in cybersecurity, working in various disciplines such as software engineering, product management, and data science, and holds a Masters in Cybersecurity from the Georgia Institute of Technology. Aditi is also passionate about promoting inclusion in STEM and cybersecurity, particularly for women and people with disabilities. She volunteers with various non-profit organizations as a trainer and mentor, helping to empower students from diverse backgrounds. She frequently shares her insights on topics related to security, accessibility, and inclusion through various speaking engagements.

bio: Shaun McCullough spent 20 years at the National Security Agency working in all aspects of cyber operations.  A Software Engineer, Manager, Researcher, Operations Lead, and the Technical Director of the Blue, Red, and Hunt teams. Today, Shaun is a Staff Security Engineer at GitHub running the cloud posture program. Shaun is also the lead Author of "SANS SEC541: Cloud Security Threat Detection," which focuses on how attackers target cloud infrastructure and what security analysts, SOC operators, and detection engineers can do to protect their organizations.

bio: Dr. Joseph Izzo, MD, is a practicing Emergency Physician and Chief Medical Information Officer at a safety-net hospital in California, where he leads digital health and cybersecurity governance initiatives. His dual perspective as both clinician and technology leader provides unique insight into how cybersecurity decisions impact care delivery and patient safety. Joseph regularly presents on digital health, clinical informatics, and cybersecurity in healthcare, with a focus on pragmatic strategies for resource-constrained hospitals and underserved communities.

bio: Jordon Sims is a Founding Partner of Imperium Global Advisors, bringing extensive legislative, political, and advocacy experience at the intersection of government, technology, and national security. He previously served as Chief of Staff to Rep. Kay Granger (R-TX), the former Chairwoman of the House Appropriations Committee, and as a nuclear-trained submarine officer with assignments supporting the CNO, CJCS, SECDEF, Naval Reactors, and DOE/NNSA. Jordon has led global corporate and government relations teams and initiatives across the US, Canada, Europe, Asia, and Latin America, spanning technology, defense, energy, and infrastructure. He also serves as Adjunct Faculty at Columbia University and Brown University, co-leading “The Future of Work.”

bio: Lynn Dohm is the Executive Director of Women in CyberSecurity (WiCyS), where she leads efforts to recruit, retain, and advance women in cybersecurity. With over 20 years of experience as a strategist, Lynn has played a pivotal role in aligning businesses, nonprofits, and grant-funded programs to cybersecurity workforce initiatives and goals. Her accolades include an honorary Doctor of Science & Technology from Champlain College, two SANS Difference Maker Awards, and recognition as one of CS Hub’s Top 25 Cybersecurity Leaders. Lynn serves on the UMGC CIT Advisory Board and the Center for Internet Security's Alan Paller Laureate Program Board.

bio: Emanuel Gawrieh is a Senior Security Engineer at Google, where he specializes in securing workloads in hybrid, distributed architectures - AI/LLM and otherwise - for public sector customers and is part of the Secure AI Framework (SAIF) team advising on hardware and infrastructure security for AI Systems. Emanuel currently serves as the Research and Demonstrations lead for the AI Village.

bio: Mr. Steve Zalewski is a Board advisor to security companies and VC firms, providing guidance on market fit and direction. In addition, his practice provides fractional CISO and security advisory services to clients to address program design, assessment, due-diligence, and board reporting. He is the former CISO at Levi Strauss & Co and has held senior security positions at Pacific Gas & Electric and Kaiser Permanente. His credentials include CISSP, CISM and CRISC security certifications. He was also issued multiple patents in data protection and multi-processor operating system design. Steve also co-hosts the “CISOSeries Defense-in-Depth" podcasts and is a frequent speaker and panel moderator for webinars and industry events.

bio: Daniel Reyhanian is a Senior Cybersecurity Researcher at Varonis, specializing in cloud and network security. His expertise spans offensive penetration testing and web security research across on-premises and cloud environments. Daniel focuses on web security with main focus on AWS, Azure, GCP, and Salesforce. His work includes threat modeling, secure architecture design, and vulnerability research across SaaS platforms and APIs, backed by over six years of experience in these areas.

His work includes threat modeling, secure architecture design, and vulnerability research across SaaS platforms and APIs, backed by over six years of experience in these areas.

bio: Yoav Magid is a Team Lead and AI Researcher at Lumia Security, where his work centers on AI security. Yoav’s other topics of interest are social engineering and embedded operating systems. With a solid foundation in cybersecurity, Yoav holds a BSc in Computer Science and is currently preparing to pursue an MBA. Bringing over seven years of cybersecurity experience, he has honed his skills in embedded research and programming, tackling real-world challenges in high-stakes environments. Yoav also founded a large-scale LGBTQIA+ Employee Resource Group (ERG) that fosters international collaboration and support in his last organization.

bio: Tim Pappa is a Cyber Deception Theorist and Practitioner with Walmart Global Tech’s Cyber Deception Operations team. Tim was previously a Supervisory Special Agent and profiler with the Federal Bureau of Investigation’s (FBI) Behavioral Analysis Unit (BAU). Tim has held various strategy and policy Fellow roles, at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) and the Aspen Institute. Tim published his first book, “Influencing the Influencers: Applying Whaley’s Communication and Deception Frameworks to Terrorism and Insurgent Narratives” (Singapore: World Scientific) in summer 2025. He is currently writing No Starch Press's first book on cyber deception.

bio: Todd Graham is an Managing Partner at M12, where he leads investments in cybersecurity, developer tools, and cloud infrastructure. Prior to joining M12, Todd was Vice President at Venrock, where he focused on early-stage enterprise infrastructure and cybersecurity investments. In his career, Todd has alternated between startups and large infrastructure vendors. Prior to Venrock, he led Corporate Strategy for Cisco’s Security and Collaboration businesses where he developed long-range business strategy while also driving inorganic activities such as the acquisition of Duo Security. Earlier in his career, he led product for IT Business Management at VMware. Using experience gained at VMware, Todd Co-Founded Bluenose Analytics to help customer success leaders better manage their customers.

bio: Kathleen Moriarty, Founder of SecurityBiaS, partnering with SaaS providers to build-in security at scale, redefining the security model for SMBs. She is a technology strategist and board advisor with 30 years of experience, helping companies lead through disruption. She is an Adjunct Professor at Georgetown SCS on Security Architecture & Design and Cyber Threat Intelligence. Formerly as CTO, Center for Internet Security, Kathleen defined and led technology strategy. During her tenure in the Dell EMC Office of the CTO, she was appointed and served 2 terms as IETF Security Area Director & member of the Internet Engineering Steering Group.  She is currently a Board and Program Committee Member for RSAC, Internet Society, SCORED, Sevco, and Mitiga.  Author: "Transforming Information Security."

bio: Zhuang Xu received a PhD degree in Mathematics from the School of Mathematical Sciences, Beihang University, Beijing, China, in 2023. He is currently an Algorithm Engineer with the Beijing Smartchip Microelectronics Technology Co., Ltd., Beijing, China. His research interests include side-channel analysis and corresponding countermeasures, and efficient implementation of cryptographic algorithms.

bio: Jonathan Braley is the Director of the Food and Ag-ISAC. The ISAC provides threat intelligence, analysis, and effective security practices to help food and agriculture companies detect attacks, respond to incidents, and better protect themselves. Jonathan and his team produce curated threat analyses for the sector and represent the organization to policymakers and industry stakeholders. In addition to this, he also serves as the Director of Threat Intelligence for the Information Technology-Information Sharing and Analysis Center (IT-ISAC), where he acts as the technical and analytic lead for a team supporting the world's leading technology companies.

bio: Edward Lee is a Taiwanese-American cybersecurity leader with over 12 years of experience across financial services and technology industry. He currently serves as VP, Lead Cybersecurity Architect at JPMorgan Chase, driving security architecture and tech risk initiatives. Previously, Edward held diverse roles in product management, technical consulting, and systems integration at Zoom, Google, and Akamai Technologies. He has spoken at and served as a panelist for various international conferences. Edward holds a Master’s in IT – Information Security from Carnegie Mellon University and an MBA from the University of Cambridge. He is also pursuing a part-time Master’s in Artificial Intelligence at ETH Zurich, focusing on the intersection of AI, risk management, and secure systems design.

bio: Chris Gruel is an enterprise technology veteran with over 20 years of experience. The majority of his career was as a software engineer for the largest home improvement retailer in the US. During his tenure, he contributed towards their digital transformation and was integral in the company's move towards containerization. Now at Oasis Security, he spends his time helping companies manage the growing non-human identity problem and making it so that doing things the right way is the easy way because when the right way is the easy way, nobody wants to do things the hard way.

bio: Michael brings 25 years of technology and cybersecurity leadership across iconic consumer and transportation brands. He currently serves as VP of Information Security at Ulta Beauty. Previously, he led cybersecurity and technology operations at Dick’s Sporting Goods and spent six years at Southwest Airlines overseeing enterprise-wide security initiatives and aircraft systems protection. He also served as Chairman of the Aviation ISAC Board, advancing resilience across global aviation. Michael began his career at Brinker International, rising from Chili’s team member to senior technology leader. He is a servant leader committed to team development and innovation. He also serves on the Board of Trustees for the Dallas Children’s Advocacy Center. He enjoys golf and travel with his wife Sonia.

bio: Andrew is an independent consultant focusing on digital identity, privacy, cybersecurity, and corporate governance. He is Conference Chair at Authenticate and Identiverse, Co-Gounder of The Identity Salon, Chair of Kantara’s UK Advisory Board, and a Non-Executive Member of the board at Curity. Andrew has over 25 years' experience in the software industry in a range of technical sales, pre-sales, product marketing, business development, and corporate governance roles. He maintains CIPP/E, CIPM, and CIPT privacy certifications with the IAPP, a CIDPRO certification from IDPro; and holds a BA in Oriental Studies (Japanese) from Oxford University, and an advanced professional diploma in corporate governance. Andrew is based in the UK and can also be found on LinkedIn at linkedin.com/in/ahindle.

bio: Sandeep Kumbhat serves as Head of Global Field CTO at Okta. In this leadership role, he serves as a strategic advisor on product strategy, solution design, architecture, and engineering for various internal and external stakeholders, including Okta's top global customers. He works with Industry Analysts, VCs, and other industry peers on the strategic advisory front. Prior to joining Okta, he worked for Oracle/Sun Microsystems, HP, Accenture, and GE leading programs to mitigate the security risks of large-scale integrations of enterprise services. His multifaceted expertise in enterprise solution architecture, identity, and cybersecurity coupled with his business acumen allows him to engage with executives and technical champions to keep security solutions simple, updated, and relevant.

bio: Ganesh Murugan is the VP and Global Head of Security Strategy and Client Advocacy at ADP. He is responsible for driving the overall security strategy with multi-year roadmaps and leads enterprise-wide initiatives that reduce risk and enable faster time-to-market with great client experience to help realize ADP’s business objectives. He also oversees the Security Culture and Client Advocacy functions that seek to establish a security-minded culture through training and awareness while positioning security as a competitive differentiator for ADP. Prior to joining ADP, Ganesh held a number of leadership roles across strategy, product/technology, and engineering for 20+ years at large, global financial services companies.

bio: Matt Caulfield is Vice President of Duo and Identity at Cisco, where he oversees the market-leading Cisco identity products portfolio including Duo Security, Cisco Identity Intelligence, and Identity Services Engine. Matt is responsible for driving Cisco’s identity strategy, bridging the domains of identity, networking, and security to achieve Zero Trust outcomes for Cisco customers. Prior to his current role, Matt was the Founder and CEO of Oort, an identity threat detection and response (ITDR) pioneer acquired by Cisco in 2023. Matt also spent time at Cisco earlier in his career as a Principal Engineer leading the Boston Innovation Team.

bio: Bryson Bort is the Founder of SCYTHE, a start-up building a next-generation threat emulation platform, and GRIMM, a cybersecurity consultancy, and Co-Founder of the ICS Village, a non-profit advancing awareness of industrial control system security. He is a Senior Fellow at the National Security Institute and Adjunct Senior Technical Advisor for the Institute of Security and Technology. As a US Army Officer, he served as a Battle Captain and Brigade Engineering Officer in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom before leaving the Army as a Captain. He is recognized as a 'Top 50 in Cyber' by Business Insider, 'Security Executive Finalist of the Year' by SC Media, was awarded 'Tech Titan' four times, and the 2023 SANS Difference Maker Award Winner for Innovator of the Year.

bio: Jane Yuan is a Security Architect and Distinguished Member of Technical Staff at Dell Technologies. She has over 25+ year in PC product development and extensive experience in leading product security strategy, specializing in SDL, open source security, third party risk management, etc. She is an active Member of CSA,  SAFECode, Women in Cybersecurity (WiCyS), and a CISSP in good standing.

bio: Tanya Janca, aka SheHacksPurple, is the best-selling author of "Alice and Bob Learn Secure Coding" and "Alice and Bob Learn Application Security." She is a secure coding trainer at She Hacks Purple Consulting. Over her 28-year IT career she has won countless awards (including OWASP Lifetime Distinguished Member and Hacker of the Year), spoken all over the planet, and is a prolific blogger. Tanya has trained thousands of software developers and IT security professionals, via her online academies (We Hack Purple and Semgrep Academy), and her live training programs. Having performed counter-terrorism, led security for the 52nd Canadian general election, developed or secured countless applications, Tanya is widely considered an international authority on the security of software.

bio: Nicole Perlroth spent 13 years leading cybersecurity coverage at The New York Times. Her Times bestseller, “This Is How They Tell Me the World Ends,” earned her the FT McKinsey “Best Business Book of the Year Award,” the Arthur J. Ross Award for Foreign Policy, and was inducted into the Cybersecurity Canon Hall of Fame. In 2021, she left journalism to go “inside the tent” to help solve the nation’s cyber challenges. She is a venture partner at Ballistic Ventures, managing director of her own cyber mission fund, Silver Buckshot, and served on the advisory committee of the DHS’ cyber defense agency, CISA, and the Council on Foreign Relations’ Cyber Task Force. She lectures at the Stanford Graduate School of Business. Her podcast, “To Catch a Thief” charts China’s rise to cyber dominance.

bio: GEN (Ret) Keith Alexander is a four-star general with a 40-year military career, culminating in the role of the Director of the National Security Agency and Chief of the Central Security Service from 2005-2014. He holds the distinction of serving in this role longer than any other director. While serving as the NSA Director, he was appointed by the President and confirmed by Congress to be the first Commander to establish and lead the US Cyber Command. He held this role from 2010-2014, establishing and defining how our nation is protected against cyber-attacks. In 2019, he received the 35th Oliver Baker Award from the Intelligence and National Security Affairs organization who recognizes extraordinary contributions to the Intelligence and national security affairs of the United States.

bio: Brett Callow is a Managing Director in the Cybersecurity and Data Privacy Communications. With more than two decades of cybersecurity policy and legislation understanding and extensive cybersecurity communications experience, Brett’s expertise is widely recognized within the industry, by policy makers and the media. He has been involved in some of the most high-profile ransomware incidents and has participated in panels and policy-related discussions, including at the Office of the Director of National Intelligence and the Aspen Institute, and has served on the Advisory Board of the Royal United Services Institute’s Ransomware Harms project. His research has been cited in the US Economic Report of the President and the World Economic Forum, among others.

bio: Dr. Apostol Vassilev is a Research Manager at NIST with 12+ years experience leading cutting-edge AI security initiatives. Currently spearheading NIST's adversarial AI efforts and published the internationally recognized Taxonomy and Terminology of Adversarial Machine Learning. He leads robust AI development for autonomous vehicles and co-authored NIST SP 800-218A on secure software practices for generative AI. Previously managed CMVP modernization, successfully automating cryptographic validation programs and earning a Department of Commerce medal. Pioneered Entropy As A Service (EAAS) technology with successful industry transfer. Collaborates with OWASP on agentic AI security and mentors students across all academic levels. Expertise spans adversarial ML, cryptography, and AI robustness.

bio: Sean Leach is a Managing Vice President at Capital One Ventures, the strategic investing arm of Capital One. Sean brings nearly three decades of experience building and scaling mission critical security and infrastructure. In addition to serving as a startup investor and advisor for cybersecurity, cloud, and infrastructure companies, he has held a variety of senior technology roles at companies including Fastly, VeriSign, and Neustar. Sean holds 10 patents across cybersecurity, cloud, and network infrastructure and received his Bachelors of Science in Computer Science from the University of Delaware, where he played NCAA Division I football.

bio: Alaa AlFaadhel is the General Manager for Initiatives and Partnerships at the NCA, over 10+ years of experience in cybersecurity. Alaa's expertise spans the socio-economic and global dimensions of cybersecurity, where she has played a role in forging international partnerships. She has led international initiatives, including the Child Protection in Cyberspace and Women Empowerment in Cybersecurity. She has been instrumental in the establishment of the Global Cybersecurity Forum (GCF) Institute, non-profit organization dedicated to advancing global cyberspace safety and resilience. She has a Bachelor in IT from KSU and a Master in Cybersecurity from PSU. She also completed Stanford Business School's prestigious Executive Program for Leadership (LEAD).

bio: David Lashway is co-leader of the firm’s global Privacy and Cybersecurity practice and a member of the firm’s global Executive Committee. David also serves as a member of the firm’s Chambers Band 1 ranked Crisis Management and Strategic Response group, and the firm's White Collar Defense and Investigations Group, which is ranked among the top three law firms globally by the Global Investigations Review. David is widely recognized as a leading adviser for crisis management, cybersecurity, data security incidents, misinformation, trade secret theft, and related investigation and litigation matters. The firm’s practice is recognized by Chambers USA among “The Elite” for Nationwide Privacy & Data Security and is praised in Chambers as “an unrivaled firm for privacy work.

bio: Edward Crowder is an independent security researcher with over five years in threat intelligence and threat hunting. Published at USENIX Security 2025 for his malware assessment research, he specializes in applying AI/ML to security operation center and human risk workflows. Edward collaborates with Canadian universities (University of Waterloo and University of Guelph) as a visiting graduate researcher, focusing on bridging cutting-edge AI capabilities with practical security operations

bio: As Chief Information Security Officer at Vanta, Jadee Hanson leads all aspects of security, privacy, and enterprise engineering. To her position, she brings more than 20 years of Information Security and information technology experience. Prior to Vanta, Jadee was the CISO and Chief Information Officer at Code42, where she led the organization's security program, drove technology strategy for the organization, and played a key role in driving product features for Code42 customers. Jadee was named one of 2023’s Top Tech Leaders by Forbes CIO Next, 2023’s Top Cybersecurity Leaders by Security Magazine. Jadee is the Founder and CEO of the non-profit organization Building Without Borders, serving those in poverty-stricken areas throughout the world through housing services.

bio: Jianying Zhou is a Professor and Center Director for iTrust at SUTD, Singapore. He received a PhD in Information Security from Royal Holloway, University of London. His research interests are in applied cryptography and network security, cyber-physical system security, mobile, and wireless security. He is a Co-Founder and Steering Committee Co-Chair of ACNS. He is also Steering Committee Chair of ACM AsiaCCS, and Steering Committee Member of Asiacrypt. He is an IEEE Fellow and an ACM Distinguished Member. He received the ESORICS Outstanding Contribution Award in 2020, in recognition of contributions to the community.

bio: Abhilash Mamidela is a CISSP-certified Senior Security Consultant at ManageEngine, specializing in Identity and Access Management (IAM) and enterprise IT security. With deep expertise in hybrid Active Directory environments, IAM, and network security, he helps organizations design and strengthen resilient security frameworks. He spends much of his time on threat emulation and detection engineering, developing practical detection capabilities that closely reflect real-world adversary techniques. His hands-on approach and ability to simplify complex security concepts make him a trusted guide for navigating today’s evolving IAM and cybersecurity challenges.

bio: Brandon Karpf serves as Leader of Public-Private Partnerships for Security at NTT where he develops cybersecurity collaborations between government and industry across international markets. He is also an Operating Partner at Fulcrum Venture Group and Adjunct Professor at the US Naval Academy. Previously, he co-founded and served as CTO of Hedy Cyber, a computer networks startup, and led the core business unit at N2K Networks as Vice President. Karpf’s national security background includes distinguished service as a Cryptologic Warfare Officer in the US Navy with leadership positions at the National Security Agency and US Cyber Command. He holds an Executive MBA from Georgetown University, a Master of Science from MIT, and a Bachelor of Science from the US Naval Academy.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

bio: Paul joined the NCA in July 2019 in the National Intelligence Hub, where he led a range of capabilities including the National Firearms Targeting Centre, the National Drugs Targeting Centre and Tactical Analysis. In July 2021 he was appointed Deputy Director of National Tasking and Co-ordination to lead SOC System Tasking and the United Kingdom Protected Persons Service. In December 2022 he was appointed to lead the National Cyber Crime Unit. In this role he is the NCA’s Gold Commander for Operation CRONOS, the NCA led international response to Lockbit Ransomware. Paul chairs the Five Eyes Cybercrime Community of Practice. He also founded and previously chaired C9 (Cybercrime 9) - an international law enforcement collaboration with Europol, Dutch, German, French, and Five Eyes agencies.
globalBio: Paul joined the NCA in July 2019 in the National Intelligence Hub, where he led a range of capabilities including the National Firearms Targeting Centre, the National Drugs Targeting Centre and Tactical Analysis. In December 2022 he was appointed to lead the National Cyber Crime Unit. In this role he is the NCA’s Gold Commander for Operation CRONOS, the NCA led international response to Lockbit Ransomware. Paul chairs the Five Eyes Cybercrime Community of Practice. bio: Robert M. Lee is a leading authority on industrial cybersecurity, and CEO and Co-Founder of Dragos, a leader in OT cybersecurity. He also serves as a Lieutenant Colonel in the Army National Guard where he designs and leads OT cybersecurity and response efforts. Robert is a SANS Fellow, serves on World Economic Forum subcommittees on Cyber Resilience for the Oil & Gas and Electricity communities, and is a Member on the boards of the International Society of Automation and the National Cryptologic Foundation. He began pioneering work in OT cybersecurity as a US Air Force Cyber Warfare Operations Officer tasked to the NSA. Early in his career he helped lead the investigation into the 2015 attack on Ukraine's power grid, the first electric system taken down by a cyberattack.
companyName: Dragos, Inc. and SANS Institute Fellow
globalBio: Robert M. Lee is a leading authority on industrial cybersecurity, and CEO and Co-Founder of Dragos, a leader in OT cybersecurity. He also serves as a Lieutenant Colonel in the Army National Guard where he designs and leads OT cybersecurity and response efforts. Robert is a SANS Fellow, serves on World Economic Forum subcommittees on Cyber Resilience for the Oil & Gas and Electricity communities, and is a Member on the boards of the International Society of Automation and the National Cryptologic Foundation. He began pioneering work in OT cybersecurity as a US Air Force Cyber Warfare Operations Officer tasked to the NSA. Early in his career he helped lead the investigation into the 2015 attack on Ukraine's power grid, the first electric system taken down by a cyberattack.
globalCompany: Dragos, Inc. and SANS Institute Fellow

bio: Rob T. Lee is Chief AI Officer and Chief of Research at SANS Institute, leading AI governance and security transformation. He authored the SANS Secure AI Blueprint and SANS Critical AI Security Guidelines, which through OWASP partnership inform EU AI Act implementation. An Air Force Academy graduate, Rob founded the Air Force’s first cyber warfare unit and served in AFOSI, CIA, and NSA offensive cyber roles. At Mandiant, he co-authored early M-Trends reports on advanced threats. Known as the “Godfather of DFIR,” he formalized digital forensics, incident response, and threat intelligence as disciplines, training tens of thousands through SANS. He serves as Technical Advisor to the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court and Commissioner on the CSIS Commission on US Cyber Force Generation.
globalBio: Rob T. Lee is Chief AI Officer and Chief of Research at SANS Institute, leading AI governance and security transformation. He authored the SANS Secure AI Blueprint and SANS Critical AI Security Guidelines, which through OWASP partnership inform EU AI Act implementation. An Air Force Academy graduate, Rob founded the Air Force’s first cyber warfare unit and served in AFOSI, CIA, and NSA offensive cyber roles. At Mandiant, he co-authored early M-Trends reports on advanced threats. Known as the “Godfather of DFIR,” he formalized digital forensics, incident response, and threat intelligence as disciplines, training tens of thousands through SANS. He serves as Technical Advisor to the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court and Commissioner on the CSIS Commission on US Cyber Force Generation.

bio: Mahendra Ramsinghani is a venture investor investing in early-stage cybersecurity startups. As founder of Secure Octane, a San Francisco-based early-stage venture fund he has invested in over fifty leading cybersecurity and AI startups. He is the co-host of “Inside the Network,” a cybersecurity-focused podcast that brings insights from leading entrepreneurs and founders. He has authored three books on venture capital, entrepreneurship, and startups - “The Business of Venture Capital” (Wiley Finance, 3rd edition, 2021) “The Resilient Founder” (Wiley, 2022), and “Startup Boards” (Wiley, 2nd edition, 2022) co-authored with noted VC Brad Feld. His educational background includes a BEngg and MBA from the University of Pune, India.

bio: Rich Bush is an Information Security Manager at State Farm, where he currently leads the Cryptography team to strengthen the organization’s resilience against evolving threats. Over the past nine years, Rich has built a deep bench of expertise across multiple domains of cybersecurity—spanning cryptography, offensive security, threat hunting, and threat intelligence. At State Farm, he has progressed through leadership roles driving the development of proactive defense strategies, building red team capabilities, and establishing advanced threat hunting operations to identify risks before they escalate. With a career rooted in protecting data and disrupting adversaries, Rich brings both strategic vision and hands-on experience to this panel.

bio: Alex Waintraub is a cybersecurity leader with nearly 15 years of experience in security operations, threat intelligence, ransom negotiations, and DFIR. He has led large-scale IR investigations across aviation, finance, healthcare, and manufacturing, with a focus on ransomware, cloud intrusion, and social engineering attacks. Alex has built and scaled SOCs, developed IR playbooks, and advised organizations on proactive defense strategies. He previously served as Senior Director of Cybersecurity at VMG and Director of Incident Response at Arete and is the Founder of Waintraub Cyber Solutions. Alex is a frequent speaker at RSAC Conference, InfoSec World USA, IT Nation Connect, and SquadCon, and hosts the NJ Cyber Fireside Chat (cyberfiresidenj.com).

bio: Nick Ashton-Hart is the representative of Cybersecurity Tech Accord to the UN and APCO’s Senior Director for Digital Economy Policy based in New York. He is active in the General Assembly’s global cybersecurity discussions and was a lead negotiator for the private sector in the UN Cybercrime Convention negotiations. Over his 25-year public policy career he has been active in high-stakes multilateral negotiations across multiple digital economy domains from representing 38 European member-states at the ITU, various states in WTO ecommerce talks, and the tech sector’s de-facto Geneva representative for 15 years. Prior to his career in public policy, he was a Manager of popular musicians including the Godfather of Soul, James Brown, and multi-platinum electronic pop pioneers Heaven 17.

bio: Denise Anderson, MBA, is President and CEO of the Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (H-ISAC), a non-profit organization dedicated to protecting the global health sector from physical and cyberattacks and incidents through dissemination of trusted and timely information. Denise currently serves as Chair of the National Council of ISACs, sits on the Board of Directors for the Global Resilience Federation (GRF), and the Executive Committee of the Cyber Working Group for the Health and Public Health Sector Coordinating Council. In addition, she participates in numerous industry advisory groups and initiatives and has spoken at events all over the globe. She is a graduate of the Executive Leaders Program at the Naval Postgraduate School Center for Homeland Defense and Security.
globalBio: Denise Anderson, MBA, is President and CEO of the Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (H-ISAC), a non-profit organization dedicated to protecting the global health sector from physical and cyberattacks and incidents through dissemination of trusted and timely information. Denise currently serves as Chair of the National Council of ISACs, sits on the Board of Directors for the Global Resilience Federation (GRF), and the Executive Committee of the Cyber Working Group for the Health and Public Health Sector Coordinating Council. In addition, she participates in numerous industry advisory groups and initiatives and has spoken at events all over the globe. She is a graduate of the Executive Leaders Program at the Naval Postgraduate School Center for Homeland Defense and Security.

bio: Russell Eubanks is a Principal Consultant and Co-Founder of Cyverity, an Information Security consulting firm specializing in governance and fractional CISO. He is responsible for assessing the cybersecurity posture of many diverse organizations and increasing their maturity while decreasing the probability of a breach. As the former CIO and CISO of the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta, he’s especially passionate about helping new or aspiring cyber leaders increase their influence.

bio: Daniel Gorecki is the Principal and CISO at NGC Risk. With extensive leadership experience spanning startups to Fortune 200 companies across various verticals like financial services, pharmaceuticals, and hospitality, Dan excels in navigating the dynamic and constantly changing sea of cybersecurity, risk management, and information technology with over 20 years of security, risk, and IT experience. A resolute professional, Dan holds the Chief Risk Officer and Executive Education Certificate from Carnegie Mellon University, CISSP and CDPSE certifications, and actively participates on non-profit boards and advisory roles. Dan's academic foundation is rooted in his Computer Engineering degree from Stony Brook University, and leadership training from SIM's Rising Leadership Forum.

bio: Gianpietro Cutolo is a Researcher at Netskope’s Threat Research Labs, with a current focus on securing cloud and AI ecosystems. He began his career on the offensive side, conducting penetration tests and red teaming engagements for banks, telecom providers, and government agencies. He later transitioned to defensive security, working on endpoint protection and cloud incident response. Over the years, he has successfully built and led multiple Security Operations Centers (SOCs) across large organizations. He holds a BS in Computer Science, with a focus on optimizing large-scale matrix computation across diverse CPU architectures.

bio: Adam Pennington leads ATT&CK at The MITRE Corporation and collected much of the intelligence leveraged in creating ATT&CK’s initial techniques. He has spent much of his 13 years with MITRE studying and preaching the use of deception for intelligence gathering. Prior to joining MITRE, Adam was a Researcher at Carnegie Mellon's Parallel Data Lab and earned his BS and MS degrees in Computer Science and Electrical and Computer Engineering as well as the 2017 Alumni Service Award from Carnegie Mellon University. Adam has presented and published in a number of venues including FIRST CTI, USENIX Security, DEF CON, and ACM Transactions on Information and System Security.

bio: Frank Vukovits is the Chief Security Scientist at Delinea and a seasoned professional with over 35 years of experience in auditing, security, and business software. As a user, Frank has implemented and managed numerous ERP projects and now combines his software, security, and audit knowledge in his role at Delinea.  He is a frequent speaker at cybersecurity, user groups, and audit events. Frank has held corporate IT audit roles, as well as IT executive management positions, and he holds Certified Internal Auditor and Certified Information Systems Auditor designations.

bio: George Gerchow is a three-time CISO and Chief Security Officer at Bedrock Data, leading AI and cloud security strategy. Previously CISO at MongoDB, he built their global Trust program. At Sumo Logic, he was CSO and SVP of IT through startup to IPO and acquisition. With 20+ years in cybersecurity, compliance, and cloud security, his focus includes AI governance, model risk management, AI agent security with Model Context Protocol, and secure AI adoption controls. He Co-Founded VMware's Center for Policy and Compliance and advocates for secure architecture and DevSecOps. George is IANS Faculty, speaks at RSAC Conference, Black Hat, and TEDx, advises tech companies, and Co-Founded XFoundation, a fentanyl awareness nonprofit.

bio: Megan Stifel has worked at the intersection of national security, law, and technology for over two decades. She currently leads the cybersecurity and resilience work at the Institute for Security and Technology, where she has also served as Executive Director of the Ransomware Task Force. Megan previously served as a Director for International Cyber Policy at the National Security Council and in the US Department of Justice as Director for Cyber Policy in the National Security Division, as well as in the Criminal Division’s Computer Crime and Intellectual Property Section. She also worked for the U.S. House of Representatives Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence. Megan is a Member of the Aspen Global Leadership Network and a Fellow at the National Security Institute.

Matt is a frequent blogger, podcaster, and speaker at industry events such as RSAC. He is also on the Faculty at IANS Research.

bio: Brandon Dixon is CTO of Ent AI, where he is using AI to protect people and transform how security is done. A seasoned cybersecurity product leader and repeat founder, he has built market-shaping solutions across the industry. Previously Security AI Strategist at Microsoft Research, he led the launch of Security Copilot and advanced autonomous security outcomes. As VP of Strategy & Product at RiskIQ, he guided its acquisition by Microsoft and brought Defender Threat Intelligence and External Attack Surface Management to market. He also founded PassiveTotal (acquired by RiskIQ), NinjaJobs (acquired by Starfish Partners), PDF X-RAY, and Blockade.io.

A seasoned cybersecurity product leader and repeat founder, he has built market-shaping solutions across the industry. Previously Security AI Strategist at Microsoft Research, he led the launch of Security Copilot and advanced autonomous security outcomes. As VP of Strategy & Product at RiskIQ, he guided its acquisition by Microsoft and brought Defender Threat Intelligence and External Attack Surface Management to market. He also founded PassiveTotal (acquired by RiskIQ), NinjaJobs (acquired by Starfish Partners), PDF X-RAY, and Blockade.io.

bio: Jayesh Singh Chauhan is the Founder of Cloud Village. He has been in cybersecurity for the last 14 years, wearing various caps ranging from security engineer to Group CISO. He has been a trainer at conferences like Blackhat, nullcon, AppSec NZ, and has trained defense forces. He has also authored "Cloud Security Suite," "OWASP Skanda," "RFID_Cloner," and has presented his work in BlackHat Arsenal(USA, EU Asia), DEF CON DemoLabs, HackMiami, c0c0n, OWASP Global, and OffZone Moscow. He is also the Founder of Cloudurance Security, a company that provides vCISO and security advisory services to tech companies and provides bespoke training courses to train in-house employees into security engineers.

bio: Tomer Avni is VP Product at Tenable, leading Tenable’s AI Security business. Tomer was the co-founder at Apex Security, the leading AI security platform, funded by Sequoia, Index, and Sam Altman. Prior to founding Apex, Tomer led product at cybersecurity startups, was an investor in an early stage VC firm, and head of section at 8200 unit, where he won the Israel defense prize. Tomer received his Bachelor’s in Mathematics at the age of 19 and has an MBA and master's in engineering from Harvard.

bio: Erin West is a retired prosecutor and global speaker recognized for her frontline work combating transnational organized crime. She is the Founder of Operation Shamrock, a nonprofit uniting law enforcement, technologists, and financial leaders to disrupt pig butchering scams run from Southeast Asia. Erin has testified before Congress, been featured in The Wall Street Journal, and leads international conversations on the billions stolen through fraud and sextortion. She also hosts "Stolen: The Podcast," amplifying survivor voices and exposing the human toll of these crimes. With her direct, no-nonsense style, Erin delivers unique insight into how cyber-enabled fraud has become one of today’s most urgent security and human rights crises.

bio: Nick Bruno is a business focused and technical Information Security executive with over 20-years of experience building and leading global Information Security teams and cybersecurity programs as a critical business enabler across various industries and hosted cloud services. Focusing on risk and security strategies, assessing, and managing risks, regulatory and international data privacy compliance, security architecture and operations, agile development lifecycle, integrated application security (DevSecOps), and continuous improvement programs for protecting assets.

bio: Milan Duric is a Security Engineer at Helvetia Insurance, contributing to Switzerland’s second‑largest insurer’s multi-tier web ingress platform. Milan specializes in fine‑grained firewall strategy, automation, and defensive engineering. He’s deeply involved in our two‑layer WAF architecture, working on the ModSecurity reverse proxy and behavioral rules orchestration to minimize false positives without compromising threat detection. Passionate about transparency, scalability, and blending open source tooling with modern AI, Milan helps bridge the gap between operational safety and developer velocity. He is also an avid bug-bounty hunter and vulnerability researcher, with several CVEs in his track record.

bio: Dayane Horkos is a PhD researcher in Paris at Astran. Her work lies at the intersection of cryptography, cybersecurity, and applied mathematics, with a focus on strengthening multi-cloud storage security. She designs protocols and cryptographic primitives to improve confidentiality and integrity in multi-cloud settings. She holds a BSc in Mathematics and an MSc in Applied Algebra (scholarship) from Université Paris-Saclay/Versailles, and is currently pursuing a PhD between Astran, LRE EPITA/ Sorbonne University.

bio: Matt Triner is the CEO and Founder of Hunter Strategy, a HUBZone-certified federal cybersecurity firm serving the Defense and Intelligence Communities, civilian agencies, and Fortune 1000 enterprises. Matt leads mission-critical cybersecurity programs across DISA, NASA, NIH, NOAA, and DCSA, focusing on cloud, supply chain, and AI-driven security architectures. Matt serves on CISA working groups for critical infrastructure protection and advises Fortune 500 CISOs and Boards on cyber risk, supply chain security, and emerging technology governance. Matt is Adjunct Faculty at the Practicing Law Institute, a regular guest speaker at Loyola Law School, and a recognized leader on FedRAMP, CMMC, and defense industrial base security.
globalBio: Matt Triner is the CEO and Founder of Hunter Strategy, a HUBZone-certified federal cybersecurity firm serving the Defense and Intelligence Communities, civilian agencies, and Fortune 1000 enterprises. Matt leads mission-critical cybersecurity programs across DISA, NASA, NIH, NOAA, and DCSA, focusing on cloud, supply chain, and AI-driven security architectures. Matt serves on CISA working groups for critical infrastructure protection and advises Fortune 500 CISOs and Boards on cyber risk, supply chain security, and emerging technology governance. Matt is Adjunct Faculty at the Practicing Law Institute, a regular guest speaker at Loyola Law School, and a recognized leader on FedRAMP, CMMC, and defense industrial base security.

bio: Kate M. Growley (CIPP/US/G, CMMC RP, AIGP) is a Partner at Crowell & Moring LLP and a Senior Director in its consultancy Crowell Global Advisors. She focuses on complex digital regulation, particularly cybersecurity, AI, and digital infrastructure. Businesses around the globe seek her guidance on proactive compliance and risk management, incident response, internal and government-facing investigations, and policy engagement. With a unique combination of legal, policy, and consulting experience, Kate is known for translating daunting technical topics into practical advice that is informed by risk and business needs. She has been internationally recognized by Chambers, has held numerous leadership roles in the American Bar Association, and is a lifetime Fellow in the American Bar Foundation.

bio: Cynthia Kaiser is a senior cyber and national security executive with over two decades of experience defending against complex and evolving threats. She previously served as Deputy Assistant Director with FBI Cyber, as a Cyber Safety Review Board member, and as a President’s Daily Briefing (PDB) intelligence briefer in two administrations. Now leading the Halcyon Ransomware Research Center, Cynthia drives threat research and collaboration to detect, disrupt, and defeat ransomware. She is a trusted voice in cybersecurity, serving on advisory boards, frequently contributing to media discussions on cyberthreats and resilience, and is recognized as a top cyber executive by The Cyber Guild, FedScoop, CyberScoop, WashingtonExec, and GovCIO.

bio: Andrew Plummer is a Chief Scientist for AI ML in Cybersecurity and Technology Controls (CTC) at JPMorganChase. Former Technical Fellow and Staff AI ML Engineer at Northrop Grumman. Started off as a mathematician working in graph theory, formal logic, and theoretical computer science.  Andrew got interested in building formal and computational models of speech and natural language phenomena.  Ventured into formal foundations of artificial intelligence. Andrew is now applying all this experience in the cybersecurity domain.

bio: Paul McCarty is the Founder of OpenSourceMalware.com, the world's largest open database for software supply chain threat intel. He specializes in software supply chain security, and in particular he has focused on NPM for his research. Paul has worked for NASA, Boeing, and various government agencies, and is currently writing a book about the DPRK "Contagious Interview" campaign targeting software engineers with fake job interviews. When not researching security, he enjoys snowboarding with his wife and three kids.

bio: Eward Driehuis is VP of Fraud Engineering at ThreatFabric. He is a cybersecurity expert with 29 years of experience in threat intelligence, fraud prevention, and cyber defense for banks, governments, and enterprises. As a recognized speaker, Eward frequently shares his insights in the media and at international conferences. In his spare time, he serves as the Chairman of CSIRT.global, the global cyber firefighter’s brigade. Previously, he has held Executive positions at Cybersprint, SecureLink (Orange Cyberdefense), and Fox-IT (NCC Group), and was a CTO and Business Director in multiple IT and software companies.

bio: Kevin Kirkwood is the CISO at Exabeam, leading the OCISO Security Center of Excellence across governance, risk and compliance, application security, SOC, and physical security. After transitioning from IT to security at PepsiCo, he built deep expertise through roles like architecting security at the Federal Reserve, advancing secure development at Bank of America, and modernizing security for mid-sized companies. Kevin champions security as a proactive business enabler. He holds a BS in Computer Information Systems, CISSP and PMP certifications, and is actively pursuing OCISO certification.

bio: Tod Beardsley is VP of Security Research at runZero, where he spends an inordinate amount of time, effort, and CPU cycles identifying and counting various software, hardware, and firmware platforms connected to a multitude of networks. Most recently, he was Section Chief for Vulnerability Response at CISA. With 30+ years in security, from telephony switching to modern ICS/OT, he’s held IT, security, software, and management roles at Rapid7, 3Com, Dell, and Westinghouse. Tod is a Founder of Austin Hackers Anonymous!, and his career (and much of his personal life) is centered around vulnerability research and coordinated disclosure. Tod is a CVE Board member, author of papers, seasonal election worker, and internationally tolerated horror fiction expert.

bio: Greg Barnes is Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) at Regeneron Pharmaceuticals with over 30 years of cybersecurity leadership experience. He previously served as CISO at Highmark, Amgen, and Horizon BCBS of New Jersey. Earlier in his career, Greg held leadership roles at Lucent Technologies, designing advanced networks and security programs for Fortune 500 companies, and began his career in the U.S. Air Force managing classified intelligence and cyber operations. He serves as Vice Chair of the Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (H-ISAC) and chairs the HHS Cyber Working Group on Intellectual Property Protection. Greg holds a B.S. in Information Technology from the University of Phoenix and an M.S. in Information Assurance from Northeastern University.

bio: Adam Savage is a host, content creator, scientist, educator, producer, and television personality. He's best known for hosting 15 seasons of the renowned Discovery Channel series, MythBusters, which used scientific evidence to confirm or debunk popular beliefs, and the six-part series, Unchained Reactions, which pits two teams of varying backgrounds against each other to build an elaborate chain reaction contraption on a massive scale. Adam currently spends most of his time on his YouTube channel, Tested, which has grown to 7.05 million subscribers where him and his team explore the intersection of science, popular culture, and emerging technology, showing how we are all makers, inventors, and creators in some way or another.

bio: Junyan Guo is a Staff Software Engineer on Uber’s Engineering Security team. He leads development of Uber’s Kerberos infrastructure and contributes to AI Security & Compliance. A core builder of AI Guard—Uber’s orchestration and policy engine for securing LLMs, agents, and AI applications—he specializes in gateway integrations, parallel rail execution, and reliability/latency hardening across CPU/GPU models. He designed the platform’s shadow-mode rollout, observability, flagged-rate alerting, and partners closely with product teams to adopt guardrails in production.

He designed the platform’s shadow-mode rollout, observability, flagged-rate alerting, and partners closely with product teams to adopt guardrails in production.

bio: Stiv Kupchik is a Security Researcher at Lumia Security, his research revolves around AI and LLM, by trying to either bypass their defenses and attack them or finding innovative ways of increasing their security posture. Stiv has been responsible for reporting on a few previously undetected malware campaigns as well as uncovering several Windows vulnerabilities. He previously presented at Hexacon, BlackHat USA, 44Con, and NoHat. Besides cybersecurity, Stiv also has a Bsc in Physics and likes to read fantasy books and play video games in his spare time.

bio: Nil Ashkenazi is a Security Researcher at CyberArk Labs focused on AI security and the risks that arise when traditional software integrates with Large Language Models (LLMs). His research has surfaced multiple vulnerabilities at this boundary, from insecure tool integrations to prompt-driven abuse. Nil has been involved in creating "FuzzyAI," an automated framework for generating and evaluating jailbreaks against top LLMs. He’s passionate about making AI adoption safer.

bio: Michael Rogers is Managing Director of MOXFIVE’s Resilience Advisory with over 15 years in cybersecurity, helping enterprises strengthen resilience and respond to advanced threats. He partners with carriers, breach counsel, brokers, and claims teams to align technical response with legal and insurance priorities. Michael holds a Master’s in Cybersecurity and SANS certifications (GCFA, GDAT, GCIA, GOSI), and has led global SOCs, threat hunting, and infrastructure operations across cloud and hybrid environments. He also serves as President of ISC2 Tampa Bay and Chair of BSides Tampa.

bio: With over two decades in the technology sector, Rodrigo Loures is a distinguished IT executive known for his strategic foresight and technical acumen. A Computer Science graduate and specializing in production engineering, he began his career at 18, gaining expertise in software engineering and networking. With over ten years of leadership experience, Rodrigo currently serves as the Director of Infrastructure and Cloud at Alterdata Software. In this role, he steers the Development, IT, Cybersecurity, and Data Center departments, applying his vast experience to drive innovation, ensure rigorous Information Security, and guide high-performance teams through complex, mission-critical initiatives.

bio: Elisabetta Tiani is an accomplished privacy and AI governance leader with over a decade of experience in privacy and data protection. An Italian-trained attorney with a PhD, she is now registered as In-House Counsel in New York. Elisabetta holds multiple IAPP certifications for both US and EU privacy (CIPP) and AI Governance (AIGP). She currently heads the global data protection program and AI governance initiatives at Axonius, a NYC-based cybersecurity company, and also serves as a member of the IAPP Education Advisory Board for the 2026/2027 term.

bio: Whitfield Diffie is best known for pioneering public-key cryptography in the early 1970s. Before his 1976 paper: New Directions in Cryptography", written with Martin Hellman, encryption technology was primarily the domain of governments. Public-key cryptography and the Diffie-Hellman key negotiation protocol made cryptography scalable to the internet and revolutionized the landscape of security. For this work, Whitfield and Hellman shared the 2015 ACM Turing Award. Whitfield is a Member of the National Academy of Engineering, a Foreign Member of the Royal Society, and in 2020 was inducted into the Cryptologic Hall of Honor of the US National Security Agency.

For this work, Whitfield and Hellman shared the 2015 ACM Turing Award. Whitfield is a Member of the National Academy of Engineering, a Foreign Member of the Royal Society, and in 2020 was inducted into the Cryptologic Hall of Honor of the US National Security Agency.

bio: Charles Blauner is an internationally recognized expert advisor on Cyber Resiliency, Information Security Risk Management and Data Privacy. Charles is the President of Cyber Aegis, a boutique cyber risk management consultancy and is also an Operating Partner at Crosspoint Capital. Previously, Charles had a distinguished career working on Information Security for over 35 years, 25 years in Financial Services, including being the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) at JP Morgan, Deutsche Bank, and Citi. He has a MS in Computer Science from the University of Southern California (USC) and a BS in Computer Science from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI).

bio: Mr. David P. Luber is the former Director of the National Security Agency’s Cybersecurity Directorate and served as the Deputy National Manager for National Security Systems (NSS). In this capacity, he led efforts to prevent and eradicate threats to US National Security Systems and critical infrastructure. Previously, David served as Deputy Director of the Cybersecurity Directorate and was the Executive Director (ExDIR) at United States Cyber Command (USCYBERCOM), the highest-ranking civilian and third-in-command at USCYBERCOM.
globalBio: Mr. David P. Luber is the former Director of the National Security Agency’s Cybersecurity Directorate and served as the Deputy National Manager for National Security Systems (NSS). In this capacity, he led efforts to prevent and eradicate threats to US National Security Systems and critical infrastructure. Previously, David served as Deputy Director of the Cybersecurity Directorate and was the Executive Director (ExDIR) at United States Cyber Command (USCYBERCOM), the highest-ranking civilian and third-in-command at USCYBERCOM.

bio: Jackie Deloplaine, CISSP, is Director of Strategic Partnerships and Engagement and oversees the associate member program, leads core member engagement across working groups, and orchestrates industry-wide fraud intelligence collaboration, enabling retail and hospitality organizations to share fraud threats, indicators of compromise, and threat actor insights. Previously, Jackie was a Cybersecurity Threat Analyst with the FBI and a state fusion center, where she launched three cross-sector programs uniting government and private-sector partners to improve situational awareness and incident response. Jackie is President and Founder of the WiCyS Pittsburgh Affiliate and teaches cybersecurity and certification preparation courses to develop the next generation of security leaders.

Previously, Jackie was a Cybersecurity Threat Analyst with the FBI and a state fusion center, where she launched three cross-sector programs uniting government and private-sector partners to improve situational awareness and incident response. bio: Maxim Deweerdt is a Security Architect and Principal SANS Instructor with deep expertise in building and advising Security Operations Centers. He specializes in identity security across Microsoft and hybrid cloud, and at NVISO he supports the Managed Cyber Defense Services team on detection and response. Maxim teaches SANS courses worldwide, sharing lessons from more than a decade of advising governments and enterprises across EMEA. His field experience spans threat hunting, incident response, and SOC operations. He regularly teaches and writes on Microsoft Entra ID, Azure, and on-prem Active Directory. Maxim is passionate about turning real-world investigations into practical playbooks defenders can apply immediately.

bio: Maryam Rezapour is a PhD candidate in Computer Science at the University of Connecticut. Her research interests lie in cryptography, with a focus on search over encrypted data, error-correcting codes, authentication, and key extraction from fuzzy sources. Her work explores multiple models of searchable encryption, including proximity search, multi-dimensional data, and multi-user settings.

bio: Derek Manky leads FortiGuard Labs’ Global Threat Intelligence Team at Fortinet, bringing over 20 years of cybersecurity experience. He has established frameworks in the security industry including responsible vulnerability disclosure, which has exercised the responsible reporting of over 1000 zero-day vulnerabilities. He is highly engaged with collaborative industry efforts and public-private partnerships including the Cyber Threat Alliance, FIRST.org, NATO NICP, MITRE CTID, INTERPOL Project Gateway, and the World Economic Forum Partnership Against Cybercrime (PAC) and Cybercrime Atlas. In addition to the Cyber Threat Alliance board, Derek sits on the MITRE Engenuity Center for Threat Informed Defense Advisory Council and World Economic Forum Cybercrime Atlas Executive Committee.

bio: Edna Conway CEO, EMC Advisors, advises governments, CEOs, enterprises and capital investment organizations on security & resilience. A seasoned Board Director, she gives back on NYU’s Tandon School of Engineering Cyber Fellows Advisory Council, as faculty at the Institute for Applied Network Security, and Nonresident Scholar at Carnegie Endowment for International Peace. Former NH Assistant Attorney General, Microsoft Chief Security & Risk Officer, Cloud & Cisco’s CSO, Global Value Chain, she has testified at US Presidential Commissions, NATO, the Hague, and the UN. Her awards include Fortune’s Most Powerful Women Membership, ISSA Hall of Fame member, Institute for Critical Infrastructure  Pinnacle Award, Fed 100 Award, and CSO 50 Award.

bio: Devvret (Dev) Rishi serves as the General Manager of AI at Rubrik, The Security and AI Operations Company. He joined Rubrik through the acquisition of Predibase, an AI infrastructure startup he co-founded and led as CEO. Prior to starting Predibase, Dev was an ML product leader at Google. He drove key initiatives for Vertex AI, Google Assistant, Firebase, and Google Research. Notably, he also served as the first product lead for Kaggle, the world's largest data science community with over 15 million members. Dev holds both a Bachelor’s and a Master’s degree in Computer Science from Harvard University, where he specialized in machine learning.

bio: Heather Adkins has over 25 years of security experience, currently serving as Head of Google’s Office of Cybersecurity Resilience. She is co-author of "Building Secure and Reliable Systems" (O’Reilly, 2020) and served as the Deputy Chair of CISA’s Cyber Safety Review Board. Heather has a passion for maintaining an open and interoperable internet and finding new ways to solve classes of vulnerabilities in order to make technology fundamentally more secure for everyone.

bio: Burt Kaliski Jr. is Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer of Verisign. He leads Verisign’s long-term research program and is responsible for the company’s industry standards engagements, university collaborations, and technical community programs. He previously served as the Founding Director of the EMC Innovation Network, as Vice President of Research at RSA Security, and as the Founding Scientist of RSA Laboratories, where his contributions included the development of the Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS). He received a Doctorate, Master’s degree, and Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

He received a Doctorate, Master’s degree, and Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

bio: Tejas Dakve is a cybersecurity leader with a decade of work experience, currently serving as Senior Manager of Application Security at Bloomberg Industry Group. He leads a team focused on product security, vulnerability management, and security tooling across the SDLC. As the leader of the Application Security team, he is responsible for building and maturing the AppSec program, driving new security initiatives, contributing to cloud security, and incident response related matters, managing vendor relationships, and most importantly mentoring and developing his team of security engineers. Tejas thrives on identifying security gaps in the software development lifecycle and implementing practical solutions to close those gaps effectively.

bio: Lior Rochberger is a Senior Threat Researcher at Palo Alto Networks, focusing on threat hunting and malware research. Lior has a decade of experience, where she mostly focused on OSINT, incident response, threat hunting, and malware analysis. In the last few years, Lior specialized in tracking nation state threat actors and cybercrime groups.

bio: Eran Segal is a security researcher with over a decade of experience in cybersecurity. He currently serves as a Security Researcher at Kodem Security, where he focuses on analyzing the internals of high-level engines for advanced platform research. Prior to his current role, Eran was a key researcher at SafeBreach Labs, specializing in Windows internals and platform security research. Eran has presented his research at premier cybersecurity conferences, including Black-Hat and DEF CON. His expertise spans deep system internals, platform security analysis, and cutting-edge security research methodologies.

bio: He has more than 40 years of experience in security, intelligence and defense. Mr. Jerry Archer is currently a cybersecurity consultant and trusted partner in delivering comprehensive security solutions tailored to the unique needs of businesses across industries. a past board member and co-founder of the Cloud Security Alliance a non-profit organization of more than 100,000 members dedicated to enhancing security in all aspects of cloud computing. He is also the past president of the Security Advisor Alliance nonprofit organization founded by industry leading CISOs driving a movement of alliance, education, growth, an philanthropy. A fellow at the Ponemon Institute a global privacy research and advocacy organization.

bio: Sandy Dunn, CISO at Knowtion Health has more than 20 years of experience in Information Security leadership roles at top technology companies. She is the project lead for the OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications Cybersecurity and Governance Checklist, and a core Member of the OWASP GenAI Security Project and Gen AI Agentic Security Initiative. She is a sought-after speaker and advisor, Sandy serves as an Adjunct Cybersecurity Professor at Boise State University and sits on the board of directors for Boise State University's Institute for Pervasive Cybersecurity. She holds a Master’s degree in Information Security Management from SANS. Her certifications include a CISSP, SANS GSEC, GWAPT, GCPM, GCCC, GCIH, GLEG, GSNA, GSLC, GCPM, Security+, ISTQB, and FAIR.

bio: Bogdan Zavadovschi is a Security Researcher at Bitdefender, specializing in digital forensics and advanced threat analysis within the company’s Forensic Team. Over the past four years, he has investigated complex attack techniques and supported high-impact incident response cases worldwide. Beyond his role, Bogdan sharpens his skills in Capture the Flag competitions and software development, continually exploring new ways to address emerging security challenges. An avid motorsports fan, he also enjoys channeling his creativity through building with LEGO.

bio: Brad Paley’s Cognitive Engineering Design Methodology emerged in 1999, when Goldman Sachs asked him to optimize broker transactions at the NYSE. They’d refused earlier UX designs, so he drew their thoughts—making them the fastest on the floor, competitive with early electronic trades for years. The NYSE itself then hired him, and he sped refill orders by 15–20x. The CEDM has been applied across Wall St and 50+ other domains; it consistently delivers 10–100x more information, easier to read and act upon. An Adj. Assoc. Engineering Professor at Columbia and a Phi Beta Kappa UC Berkeley graduate, he holds four US patents (600+ citations). His award-winning work has been featured in the New York Times, ID Magazine, and Nature; exhibited at MoMA, the Whitney, and the Smithsonian Design Museum.

bio: Saikat Maiti is Chief Trust Officer at Commure, securing AI-powered healthcare infrastructure serving 250K+ providers. With 20+ years leading security at Varian Medical Systems ($6B, acquired by Siemens), Salesforce, Upstart, and Personal Capital, he's achieved a zero-breach record while pioneering "Invisible Security"—reducing clinical violations 91% without adding controls. As former CISO navigating various Healthcare crisis's, FDA medical device regulations, and HIPAA compliance, Saikat uniquely bridges clinical reality with security imperatives. He's built AI security frameworks for LLM-powered systems, reduced security costs 90% while improving detection 5X and transformed hostile medical staff into security champions. An ISE/TEN Most Popular CISO Award recipient & Dreamforce speaker.

bio: Vasu Jakkal is a passionate champion of building a better, safer, and more resilient world for all. She brings nearly 20 years of technology industry experience to Microsoft, where she is responsible for Microsoft’s Security business which includes Security, Compliance, Identity, Management and Privacy including crafting the strategy, partnering to shape product roadmaps and defining the go-to-market motions that help customers simplify and fortify their security posture. Jakkal is a dedicated advocate for diversity, and for expanding the opportunities for women in all fields of technology.

bio: Stephanie Gass is Senior Director of the Information Security program at CIS. She oversees security operations, external and internal audits, product risk assessment, and privacy, as well as ensuring CIS aligns to CIS Controls, SOC 2 Type 2, ISO:IEC 27001/27701, NIST 800-171, and FISMA Moderate. She is a Co-Chair of the AI Governance Board to promote advancement in AI usage at CIS. Prior to CIS, Stephanie was the US Information Security Officer and ITAR lead at GlobalFoundries, a global chip manufacturer. She has a Master’s from George Washington University in Cybersecurity. Stephanie was the Lead and Contributing Author to "Managing Cyber Threats through Effective Governance: A Call to Action for Governors and Legislatures." As well as speaking on the topic for the MS-ISAC Annual Meeting.

bio: As Senior Director of Global Security & Technology Strategy, Alex has shaped policies at the intersection of security, technology & telecoms in more than 60 countries and multilateral organizations around the world. At Venable, Alex leads initiatives covering cybersecurity, telecoms, and strategic competition. He also serves as the international policy lead for the Cybersecurity Coalition and the Coalition to Reduce Cyber Risk. Alex previously served as Director of Global Regulatory Cooperation at the US Chamber of Commerce, where he led global initiatives on cybersecurity, emerging tech, and regulatory cooperation. He is a Global Fellow at the Wahba Institute for Strategic Competition, and Member of the OECD Expert Groups on Cybersecurity Policy and Data Free Flows with Trust (DFFT).

bio: Oded Vanunu boasts two decades of InfoSec expertise, serving as a distinguished security leader and offensive security authority. Transforms security concepts into innovative products, with a portfolio of five patented cybersecurity defense methods. As the Author of "Cyber and Hacking in the Worlds of Blockchain & Crypto," Oded is a speaker at RSAC Conference, BlackHat, and Defcon. Renowned for uncovering critical vulnerabilities, he uncovered vulnerabilities on platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Telegram, TikTok, Amazon's Alexa, DJI Drones, Fortnite, Atlassian, OpenSea, and many more platforms.

bio: Rob Allen boasts over 20 years of experience in the IT sector. With deep technical knowledge gained from serving as a system administrator through various technical roles and on to leadership, this in-depth understanding of technology and client needs has established him as a dependable advisor. His expertise in mitigating and preventing cyber and ransomware attacks has strengthened the security postures of a wide variety of organizations. Rob has served as VP Operations EMEA and promoted to Chief Product Officer in 2023 in recognition of his role in tailoring ThreatLocker offerings to meet the evolving security demands of businesses globally.

bio: Juan David Alvarez Builes is a Sr. Cloud Security Consultant at AWS with 3+ years at Amazon, specializing in multi-cloud security architecture (AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI). Holds all AWS certifications plus CISM and AZ500. Vastly experienced in financial sector cybersecurity, implementing Zero Trust architectures, DevSecOps, and SASE frameworks for enterprise clients. Systems Engineer and Teleinformatics Specialist from Universidad EAFIT. Active AWS community speaker and evangelist, regularly presenting at security conferences. Based in Medellín, Colombia, with 1,644+ LinkedIn followers. Passionate about cybersecurity innovation and delivering organizational value through cloud security excellence.

bio: Dr. Sridhar Muppidi is an IBM Fellow and CTO for IBM Security. He is responsible for driving the technical strategy, architecture, and research for IBM’s Security portfolio of products and services. He is a results-oriented technical thought leader with 25+ years of experience building security products, delivering solutions for clients, driving open standards, and leading technical teams. He is one of the industry-recognized technical experts and thought leaders with a proven track record of blending technology vision with business acumen. He has an MS and a PhD in Computer Science from Texas A&M University and now serves on TAMU's board of directors. He is an IBM Master inventor with 60+ issued patents and has published numerous technical articles, blogs, conferences, and journals.

bio: Heather Linn is a Member of the GIAC Advisory Board, an AI red teamer, penetration tester, threat hunter, and cybersecurity strategist with more than 20 years of experience in the security industry. During her career, she has consulted as a penetration tester and digital forensics investigator and operated as a senior red team engineer inside Fortune 50 environments. In addition to being an accomplished technical editor, including "Gray Hat Hacking" (McGraw-Hill, 2018) and Author of the "CompTIA PenTest+ Certification All-in-One Exam Guide," Second Edition (Exam PT0-002), she written and delivered training for multiple security conferences and organizations including Black Hat USA and for Girls Who Code. Heather has contributed to open source frameworks for pentesting and threat hunting.

bio: Inés Atug is Head of Security Threat & Resilience at UniCredit Bank with over ten years of experience in cybersecurity, cloud, and risk management. As an accomplished leader, she drives strategy, resilience, and security enablement across complex organizations. Previously, she served as Senior Cloud Security Expert and Penetration Tester, advising enterprises and regulators. Certified in CISSP and ISO 27001, Inés holds an MSc in Applied IT Security and a BSc in Mathematics. She is recognized for her innovative, collaborative approach, published expertise, and commitment to operational excellence. Fluent in English and German, she excels at bridging business and technical objectives.

bio: Madelein Van der Hout is a Senior Analyst at Forrester serving security and risk professionals. She covers various topics from both European and global perspective. She supports security executives and professionals in building and maturing their security goals. She covers European security consulting services, (European) CISO strategy work and security operating models, Regulation and legislation, Trends, and API security. Madelein is frequently asked to comment on cybersecurity issues by press. She has a recent publication in FT Adviser and features in ITSPmagazine podcasts, BusinessWise, Cybersessies (RTLZ Dutch television), and was a judge for the Dutch CISO of the Year Award.
