bio: Vitaly Simonovich is a Senior Security Researcher at Cato Networks and Member of Cato CTRL. Currently, Vitaly focuses on researching topics related to LLM security, with a particular emphasis on jailbreaks and prompt injections. Prior to joining Cato in 2023, Vitaly worked at Incapsula and Imperva, where he led teams of security analysts and researchers. With over nine years of experience in cybersecurity, Vitaly specializes in application security, data security, and LLM security. An active contributor to the cybersecurity community, he regularly publishes research blogs, hosts webinars, and presents at conferences. In addition to his professional work, he teaches cybersecurity at local colleges and enjoys solving CTF challenges in his free time to stay sharp and enhance his skills.

bio: Jon Sabberton is a Senior Manager with Mandiant's Security Transformation Services team. He helps clients implement recommendations for enhancing detections, hardening environments, and bolstering security during incident response and proactive engagements. He was also the Principal Designer of the Active Directory Tier Model Design and implementation, as well as the Enhanced Security Administration Environment (ESAE) aka Red Forest when he worked at Microsoft in Microsoft Consulting Services.

bio: Carraig Stanwyck began his career with ten years in the intelligence community, specializing in human and identity intelligence, and spending much of that time on overseas deployments. This experience laid the groundwork for his transition to cybersecurity, where, over the past decade, he has built a reputation for creating proactive and effective cybersecurity programs. Carraig is recognized for his practical insights into business-centric security, talent acquisition, and fostering diversity and neurodiversity in STEM. Drawing from his diverse experience in intelligence and cybersecurity, Carraig has developed successful programs for government entities, startups, and global enterprises.

bio: Matt Kelly is a Litigation Counsel in Debevoise & Plimpton’s New York office and a member of the Data Strategy & Security Group. His practice focuses on AI governance, regulatory compliance and risk management, cybersecurity, and data privacy. He advises clients on litigation, investigations, and regulatory matters involving complex technology- and data-driven issues, including data governance, model risk, and quantitative tools. Matt has led advisory, litigation, and regulatory matters involving algorithmic trading, cybersecurity, and data governance, including matters before the SEC, CFTC, FINRA, and the New York Attorney General. He is ranked by Chambers for Privacy & Data Security, recognized by The Legal 500 US for Cyber Law, named an “AI Visionary” by Relativity in 2025.

bio: Dave DeWalt is Founder, CEO, and Managing Director of NightDragon, an investment and advisory firm focused on SecureTech companies, including cybersecurity and defense. He is a veteran CEO, Advisor, and Investor who has led companies, from startups to the Fortune 500, on a transformational journey of success. Dave helped create more than $20 billion in shareholder value during his 15-plus years as President and CEO of Documentum, McAfee, and FireEye. That includes driving the most successful cybersecurity IPO ever in 2013 and leading the largest all-cash deal in technology history in 2010. In addition to NightDragon, he is an Investor and Board Member in the world’s most innovative companies such as Delta Airlines and Exelon.

That includes driving the most successful cybersecurity IPO ever in 2013 and leading the largest all-cash deal in technology history in 2010. In addition to NightDragon, he is an Investor and Board Member in the world’s most innovative companies such as Delta Airlines and Exelon.

bio: Alyssa Robinson is the Chief Information Security Officer for HubSpot, leading the teams responsible for corporate information technology, corporate and product security, compliance, and trust and safety. Alyssa joined HubSpot in January of 2019. Prior to HubSpot, Alyssa has held positions in security and infrastructure at Cisco, Kantar Media, the Broad Institute, and Akamai. She is a graduate of MIT and the SANS Technology Institute. Outside of work, Alyssa is active in the League of Women Voters. She loves hiking, climbing, running, and snowboarding with her husband, kids, and dog. Fun Fact: In addition to degrees in Computer Science and Information Security, Alyssa graduated from the Culinary Certificate program at the Cambridge School of Culinary Arts.

bio: Samuel Cameron is a cybersecurity leader with 12+ years of expertise in security operations, architecture, and AI engineering. As Principal AI Engineer in Cyber Defense at Verizon, he spearheads mission-critical initiatives to secure and optimize enterprise-scale AI deployments. He previously held roles at Pearson and Cisco, where he helped develop the CCNP–CyberOps certification. A veteran of the United States Army, he was awarded the Network and Enterprise Technology Command Soldier of the Year. Samuel holds 13 industry certifications, an undergraduate degree in Computer Science and Mathematics, and a graduate degree in Analytics from Wake Forest University. He served on the Technology Advisory Board for Wake Forest, NC for six years, and has spoken at events like InfoSec World.

bio: Larry is Head of Global Technology Strategy, Innovation & Partnerships at JPMorgan Chase and a senior member of its Global Technology Operating Committee. He leads innovation and strategy through partnerships across the tech ecosystem, focusing on Data & AI/ML, Cloud, Engineering, Experience, and Cybersecurity.  Larry joined JPMorgan Chase in 2008 after 25 years in tech and financial services. At Morgan Stanley (2002–2008), he drove software and infrastructure strategy. Earlier, he held executive roles at Sybase, CrossWorlds (IBM), and Vitria, and began his career in database and application development consulting for Wall Street firms.

bio: Sylvain Hirsch, a Mandiant Security Strategy Manager at Google Cloud, is a distinguished expert in incident response, threat intelligence, and cyber resilience strategy. Leveraging extensive experience from Mandiant's frontline investigations and a distinguished tenure at Credit Suisse, Sylvain has led high-stakes responses to advanced threats and impactful cyber defense exercises. In his current role, he strategically advises Web2 and Web3 organizations, guiding them in elevating their cyber detection, response capabilities, and leading technical and executive-level attack simulations. Sylvain also shares his deep expertise as a Guest Lecturer at the University of Lausanne and a frequent speaker at international cybersecurity conferences.

bio: Throughout her 30+ year career, Heather has thrived in leading security transformations for industry leaders like IBM, RingCentral, PagerDuty, and Sitecore. She is passionate about building collaborative security cultures that prioritize measurable business value. Her expertise spans technical and business solutions providing strategic security leadership, product security lifecycle best practices, technology due diligence including risk-based adoption of technologies and regulations, (open source) software and standards, and cyber governance and risk management. She has helped guide companies and clients through the security and business implications of technology change, including web-based applications, mobile technologies, Cloud (IaaS, PaaS and SaaS) and big data including AI.

bio: Sarah Guo is the Founder and a Partner at Conviction, an AI-native venture capital firm founded in 2022. Prior, she was a General Partner at Greylock. She has been an early investor and partner to 50+ companies including Figma, Harvey, Sierra, HeyGen, Mistral, Cognition, Stackblitz and more. Sarah is from Wisconsin, has four degrees from University of Pennsylvania, and lives in the Bay Area with her husband and three kids. She co-hosts the AI podcast "No Priors" with Elad Gil.

bio: Lei Sun is a Senior Staff Engineer and Technical Lead Manager on Uber’s Engineering Security team. He leads multiple initiatives including AI Guard, Uber’s centralized platform for securing LLMs, agents, AI applications, and DataK9, a GenAI-powered solution that auto-classifies data at the field level across Uber’s storage systems. His team builds reliable, cost-efficient privacy and safety infrastructure that enables product teams to integrate security, compliance, and privacy by default. Previously, Lei worked at Amazon and Microsoft, and he has 18+ years of industry experience.

bio: Mike Wilkes is a Chief Information Security Officer that has built, transformed, and protected companies such as Major League Soccer, SecurityScorecard, ASCAP, Marvel, AQR Capital, ING Bank, Rabobank, CME Group, Sony, Macy's, as well as European banks and airlines. Nominated in 2020 to the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer, he provides thought leadership on cyber resilience in the oil and gas industry as well as quantum security working groups. A graduate of Stanford University and author of a book for Cisco Press in 2002, he is a featured speaker at technology conferences for Black Hat, Gartner, GovWare, and SANS and is a Professor at NYU and Columbia University teaching cybersecurity courses.

bio: Abhishek Shukla is the Managing Director and Head of North America at Prosperity7 Ventures, a $7B venture capital fund backed by Aramco. A global operator turned venture investor, he specializes in scaling enterprise tech and deep-tech companies. With an MBA from UC Berkeley’s Haas School of Business and a Bachelor’s in Electronics and Communications from Delhi College of Engineering, Abhishek has a robust investment track record across cyber, AI, and cloud. Previously, he held leadership roles at Hewlett Packard Enterprise and GE Ventures. Abhishek has driven successful exits (e.g., Cellwize, Pachyderm,and IonQ IPO).
globalBio: Abhishek Shukla is the Managing Director and Head of North America at Prosperity7 Ventures, a $7B venture capital fund backed by Aramco. A global operator turned venture investor, he specializes in scaling enterprise tech and deep-tech companies. With an MBA from UC Berkeley’s Haas School of Business and a Bachelor’s in Electronics and Communications from Delhi College of Engineering, Abhishek has a robust investment track record across cyber, AI, and cloud. Previously, he held leadership roles at Hewlett Packard Enterprise and GE Ventures. Abhishek has driven successful exits (e.g., Cellwize, Pachyderm,and IonQ IPO).

bio: Christopher D. Hale is the Senior Director for Cyber and National Security Law at Cisco, where he leads the legal team responsible for advising and driving compliance strategies for legal and policy matters related to cybersecurity and operational resilience. He joined Cisco from Raytheon Technologies and previously held roles at Microsoft and the Department of Justice’s National Security Division. Christopher is a Visiting Fellow at the National Security Institute at George Mason University and a contributor to the Practicing Law Institute treatise, "Cybersecurity: A Practical Guide to the Law of Cyber Risk." He is a Fulbright research grantee and received a JD from Columbia Law School and a BS in Foreign Service from Georgetown University.

bio: Erin Joe has held executive roles in the Office of the CISO at Google Cloud and was an SVP at Mandiant. Erin was the second Director of the US government's Cyber Threat Intelligence Integration Center. Erin previously reached Senior Executive Service leadership levels over cyber operations at the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), collaborating with global governments and private industry to counter the world’s top cyberthreats. Erin gained expertise in crisis preparedness, cyberthreats, and response over her 25 years as an FBI Special Agent. Erin is an Attorney and enjoys her Adjunct Professor and Advisory Board roles.

bio: Sean Juroviesky is a dedicated cybersecurity, risk management, and privacy advocate, speaking on those topics at conferences across the world including DEF CON, CypherCon, CornCon, BSides Rochester, SecretCon, Sec-T, and more. Sean also acts as a Cybersecurity Architect for a large music streaming provider.  Beyond their professional pursuits, Sean finds joy in backpacking through the mountains with their adventurous Australian Shepherd, partner, and twins, embracing the serenity of nature and the thrill of exploration.

bio: Maril Vernon is the Field CISO at FireCompass with a background in offensive and cloud security. She has built and advised red, purple, application security, and continuous security validation programs from startup to large enterprises and highly regulated industries. A MITRE ATT&CK contributor, CSO Online contributing writer, and CIS Benchmark author, Maril specializes in translating real-world attacker behavior into clear technical strategy and executive-level decisions. She partners closely with both engineering and go-to-market teams to ensure security initiatives drive measurable outcomes and stand up to real-world scrutiny.

bio: Niloofar Razi is a investor, executive, and entrepreneur in technology for over 30 years, with 20 years focused on cybersecurity. She most recently served as Chief Strategy Officer and SVP of Strategy and Operations at RSA, a global cybersecurity company, where she led corporate strategy, development and planning, business development, global program management, operations, security operations, and Federal business development. Prior to RSA, she was Chief Strategy Officer at Endgame. She is an Operating Partner at Capitol Meridian Partners and serves on the boards of Tenable, Morgan Stanley Banks, Pondurance (Chair), Recorded Future, and NetSPI, and advises RangeForce, Dragos, and Picnic. She is also a Distinguished Visiting Professor at Vanderbilt University’s National Security Institute.

bio: Jeremiah Kung is AppLovin’s Global Head of Information Security and Compliance. AppLovin enables developers to grow their business with a powerful set of industry-leading solutions. Jeremiah is a risk based cybersecurity and technology executive with strong beliefs in innovation and partnership. He has led multiple digital transformations and has found that the constant drive to improve along with the business is the key factor to leading a successful security program in any company. Jeremiah is a results-oriented hands-on cybersecurity professional with 20 years of successful history of leading cybersecurity, data privacy, and risk management programs for large, multi-national organizations and Fortune 500 companies including Bank of America, Capital One, and Visa.

He focuses on building scalable, adaptive defense systems that continuously learn and respond to sophisticated threats, accelerating the use of AI to secure modern, large‑scale platforms.

bio: Armin Buescher is an R&D leader at RSAC focused on practical applications of large language models in cybersecurity. His work centers on designing evaluations, stress-testing limitations, advising companies on AI programs, and building prototypes. With 15+ years across the cybersecurity stack, from malware analysis to cloud security, he began building ML detection systems at Symantec/Norton and advanced AI techniques through recent LLM breakthroughs. At Crosspoint Labs, Armin contributed across the PE value chain through due diligence, leadership partnerships, and AI support systems. Earlier R&D roles at FireEye, Blue Coat, and Websense led to patents and zero-day disclosures. A regular conference speaker and media spokesperson, he holds an MSc in Computer Science from TU Dortmund.

bio: Ariel Simon is a seasoned cybersecurity researcher with extensive expertise in cloud security, vulnerability research, and identity management. Currently, he works as a Security Researcher at Token Security. Ariel mainly works on uncovering critical vulnerabilities in cloud environments. Before joining Token Security, Ariel served in the IDF, as a Senior Security Researcher in Unit 81. There, he led large-scale cyber projects. His hands-on experience includes whitebox and blackbox application research, advanced penetration testing, and malware analysis.

bio: Daniel Miessler spent his career at the intersection of cybersecurity and technology, leading programs at Apple, Robinhood, IOActive, HP, and more, while advising Fortune 10 to Global 1000 companies. Since 2022, he runs Unsupervised Learning, focused on AI that upgrades humans, and advise organizations on secure AI adoption. Daniel created the Fabric AI Framework, a crowd-sourced library of GenAI coding solutions with 30K+ stars and conduct three-five Security/AI assessments per year. His work bridges security, AI, and real-world engineering to help teams adopt GenAI safely and effectively.

bio: Joseph Mehegan is the Practice Leader for North America Security Architecture within Google's Mandiant Consulting division, bringing over 25 years of deep expertise in Security Architecture, Enterprise Architecture, Cloud, and Information Security. Joe focuses on providing strategic guidance and hands-on support to organizations, particularly in areas such as incident response remediation, enhancing security visibility across complex environments, and proactively modernizing and hardening security architectures against sophisticated and evolving threats.

bio: Tiffany Wilson is a recognized expert at the intersection of accessibility and cybersecurity. With over 15 years of healthcare compliance and assistive technology (AT) experience, she specializes in identifying security vulnerabilities in consumer technology used for healthcare purposes. For nearly a decade, she guided Alaska's federally funded AT program, overseeing deployments across diverse and complex environments while delivering solutions to unique challenges. Her IEEE-published paper, "The Unintended Harm of IoT Devices in Assistive Technology Distribution Programs," pinpoints security gaps as everyday technology becomes healthcare infrastructure. Her extensive work with vulnerable populations offers critical insight into regulatory gaps and privacy risks often left unaddressed.

bio: Jason Garbis is Founder and CEO at Numberline Security, a consulting firm that helps enterprises create and execute effective Zero Trust strategies. Jason is an IANS Faculty Member, Author of the well-regarded book "Zero Trust Security: An Enterprise Guide", Co-Chair of the Zero Trust Working Group at the Cloud Security Alliance, and is a frequent contributor to and speaker at industry conferences. Jason holds a CISSP certification, a BS in Computer Science from Cornell, and an MBA from Northeastern. Previously, he served as Chief Product Officer at Appgate, and held roles at security firms including RSA and Aveksa. Outside of Information Security, he enjoys running, biking, cooking, vegetable gardening, and spending time with his family and dogs.

bio: Colin Ahern was appointed by Governor Kathy Hochul in June 2022 as the state’s first Chief Cyber Officer, overseeing all cyberthreat assessment, mitigation, and response efforts. Prior to joining state service Colin served as First Deputy Director of New York City Cyber Command and Acting Chief Information Security Officer of New York City and earlier as a security engineer in financial services. Colin enlisted in the Army reserves after 9/11 and later served on active duty as an Army officer, including two, year-long tours in Afghanistan. He was promoted to multiple leadership roles and ended his Army career as a company commander in the Army Cyber Brigade. His military decorations include the Bronze Star and the Afghanistan Campaign Medal with three campaign stars.

bio: Julio C. Padilha is the Chief Information Security Officer for Volkswagen and Audi South America, responsible for strengthening cyber defenses across six industrial plants and shaping the Group’s Information Security Strategy. With deep expertise in standards and regulations such as ISO 27001, GDPR, and CCPA, he has built a career protecting critical information assets in highly regulated environments. Julio has held cybersecurity and risk leadership roles in global financial institutions, focusing on security governance and enterprise risk management. He serves on multiple IT Security Councils, advising organizations on Information Security best practices, resilience, and compliance, and holds advanced degrees in Informatics and Cybersecurity.

bio:
Anish Menon, a Senior Security Software Architect and Engineer at Netflix, leads initiatives to harmonize security with product requirements for features like Password Sharing and Netflix Preview Club. An EB1-A visa recipient, he's recognized for exceptional contributions, specializing in secure risk management.
Before joining Netflix, Anish honed his skills at Apple and Qualcomm, where he was instrumental in developing and improving protocols for device security and DRM systems. At Netflix, Anish explores applying AI to security frameworks and developing AI Assistants to enhance security operations, supporting the integration of advanced technologies to secure Netflix's ecosystem.

bio: Ann Cleaveland is the Executive Director of the UC Berkeley Center for Long-Term Cybersecurity (CLTC), where she is responsible for growing key partnerships, managing day-to-day operations, and stewarding a strategy to fulfill the mission of CLTC’s multidisciplinary research center. Her research interests include cybersecurity futures, digital risk communications, and governance of cyber risk. She also co-founded and leads the university-based Consortium of Cybersecurity Clinics. Ann is a senior leader and business manager with experience in philanthropy, non-profit management, and industry. Prior to joining CLTC, she served as the Senior Director of Strategic Planning at the ClimateWorks Foundation.

bio: J. Wolfgang Goerlich is a CISO in the public sector. Prior to this role, he led IT and IT security in the healthcare, financial services, and tech verticals. Wolfgang has held senior positions at several consulting firms, leading security advisory and assessment practices. He is a strong presence in the security community, contributing to the establishment and organization of multiple groups and events. Wolfgang focuses on strategy, governance, identity and access management, and resilience.

bio: Nevena Rupp is Director-General of Directorate-General D – Digitization and Identities at the Federal Office for Information Security (BSI). Her portfolio covers key areas such as electronic identities, the national EUDI Wallet, public sector identity management including applications like border control under the Schengen framework as well as secure digitalization across sectors such as energy, automotive, IoT, e-health, and public administration. Prior to joining BSI, she held senior IT leadership roles at Deutsche Post DHL Group and worked as an international management consultant. With over 25 years of experience in digital transformation, agile methods, and innovation, she is a passionate leader who thrives on fostering diverse and empowered teams.

bio: Rear Admiral (Ret) Mark Montgomery serves as the Executive Director of Cybersolarium.org, a non-profit organization which works to implement the recommendations of the Cyberspace Solarium Commission, where he was Executive Director from 2019 to 2021. He is also the Senior Director of the Center on Cyber and Technology Innovation and a Senior Fellow at the Foundation for Defense of Democracies. Prior to this, Mark was Policy Director for the Senate Armed Services Committee under the leadership of Senator John S. McCain and completed 32 years as a Nuclear Trained Surface Warfare Officer in the US Navy, retiring as a Rear Admiral in 2017.

bio: Raghav Verma is a Security Engineer at Google focused on executing adversarial security exercises to strengthen Alphabet’s security posture by exploring known security risks and uncovering new ones. In addition to this, Raghav also works on enhancing adversarial realism by improving internally developed offensive security tools and reducing the cost of operations through extensive research.

bio: Dr. Susan Bernstein is CEO of Powerful Under Pressure, a boutique consulting firm helping leaders at companies like Bloomberg, Cisco, and Uber to excel in demanding conditions. With a UC Berkeley MBA and leadership roles at Intel and Accenture, she brings deep expertise in strategic foresight and organizational complexity. Her PhD in Somatic Psychology adds a critical dimension: the ability to sustain performance under relentless pressure. Having navigated intense demands firsthand, Susan developed the "Powerful Under Pressure™" framework to strengthen operational capacity by increasing the resilience and clarity of the people leading critical teams. She understands that when stakes are high and pressure is constant, leaders need practical tools to stay clear, focused, and effective.

bio: Dori Fisher is a seasoned cybersecurity executive currently VP product at Port0 and serving as a Strategic Advisor at BDO Managed detection response services. With over 20 years in detection and response, Dori built a reputation as a technical authority in cyber and Information Security, working extensively across SIEM, SOC, and detection & Response projects. Dori played a pivotal role in over a 100 security operations center implementations - serving as consultant, integrator, and CTO, developing proprietary monitoring methodologies and leading threat-intelligence initiatives. Dori holds a BA in Sociology and Criminology with excellence honors and has been a certified CISSP in 2004.

bio: Andrew McCormick is a seasoned IT professional with over ten years of experience driving innovation at scale in DevSecOps, SRE, and cybersecurity engineering. He spent most of his career securing distributed retail edge environments at Starbucks. Now he specializes in Workload Identity and Access Management and enabling DevSecOps at massive scale across diverse technology ecosystems. He is also a self-taught CISSP and a contributor to several CSA and IETF working groups.

bio: Mark Alba is a seasoned cybersecurity executive with over 20 years of product leadership at companies including Symantec, HPE, and Unisys. He has launched award-winning innovations that strengthen cyber defense while reducing cognitive load, addressing alert fatigue, and operational burnout. As Co-Founder and COO of Mesh Commons, Mark leads the execution of cognitively engineered decision frameworks that help CISOs and executive teams make faster, clearer, and more aligned decisions under pressure. A trusted advisor and frequent industry speaker, he brings a human-centered perspective at the intersection of cybersecurity, UX, automation, and leadership.

bio: George Kamide is the Co-Founder and Executive Director of Mind Over Cyber, a nonprofit dedicated to equipping infosec professionals with techniques to reduce stress and burnout. He speaks frequently on the human issues in cybersecurity, as a panelist and main stage presenter. George has spoken to organizations as varied as international NGOs to Fortune500 enterprises and at numerous conferences in the US and Canada. He has contributed to disinformation research widely covered in The Washington Post, The Guardian, and BBC News. Moreover, he has briefed US Cyber Command and the Congressional Cyber Caucus on the mechanics of influence operations.

bio: Rob Joyce served over 34 years at the NSA in multiple roles. Rob finished his career as the Head of the Agency’s Cybersecurity Directorate. He also served on the White House National Security Council as a Special Assistant to the President and Cybersecurity Coordinator, as well as Acting Homeland Security Advisor. Throughout his career, Rob led operations pursuing the most sophisticated hackers and innovated technologies to protect vital national assets—including US classified networks and nuclear authorization codes. He is now the Founder of Joyce Cyber LLC and serves on boards and in advisory capacities, utilizing his cybersecurity expertise. He is a frequent speaker, talking about cyberthreat, artificial intelligence, and cyber policy.

He is now the Founder of Joyce Cyber LLC and serves on boards and in advisory capacities, utilizing his cybersecurity expertise. He is a frequent speaker, talking about cyberthreat, artificial intelligence, and cyber policy.

bio: Katie Gray is the Senior Partner for the cyber practice at In-Q-Tel (IQT) where she is responsible for identifying technologies that address challenges faced by the US Intelligence Community. She has led investments in venture-backed startups in the areas of application security, cryptography, cloud security, threat intelligence, security operations, industrial control system security, and more. Katie has been on the IQT investment team since 2011 and has led investments in more than 30 companies during her tenure. Katie earned both a Bachelor’s degree and an MBA from Stanford University.

bio: Gérôme Billois is an Administrator of Campus Cyber, France’s cross-industry, government-led hub for cybersecurity, and Co-leads Cyber4Tomorrow, a global collaboration advancing in particular cyber sustainability. He Co-authored the first open source methodology to cut cybersecurity’s CO₂ impact without increasing risk. As a Partner at Wavestone consultancy with more than 20 years of experience, Gérôme has guided CISOs through major crises, digital transformations, and emerging technology challenges. A frequent speaker at global conferences and in the media, he is known for creating the "CISO Radar," the "AI Cyber Startup Radar," and multiple publications that bridge deep technical expertise with pragmatic, actionable leadership.

As a Partner at Wavestone consultancy with more than 20 years of experience, Gérôme has guided CISOs through major crises, digital transformations, and emerging technology challenges. A frequent speaker at global conferences and in the media, he is known for creating the "CISO Radar," the "AI Cyber Startup Radar," and multiple publications that bridge deep technical expertise with pragmatic, actionable leadership.

bio: Mea Clift is a seasoned cybersecurity leader with a multi-decade career marked by excellence, innovation, and mission-driven practices. As Principal Executive Advisor for Cyber Risk Engineering, she guides underwriters on cyber risks and educates insureds on trends and maturity. Previously, she focused on cybersecurity in Critical Infrastructure. A mentor and advocate for diversity, Mea actively participates in Cyversity and ISACA programs, teaching Fundamentals of GRC. Known for her credibility with executives, clients, and peers, she is also a dedicated quilter and quilt historian living in St. Paul, Minnesota.

bio: David Brauchler is an NCC Group Technical Director in Dallas, Texas. He leads the North America AI/ML Security Practice and operates as an application security specialist and penetration tester, and his skillset includes web, mobile, native, AI/ML, and application threat modeling. David has a Master's degree in Security Engineering and is passionate about all forms of technology, especially in the security space. David has a long portfolio of technical presentations through his adjunct lecturing, conference talks, special guest lectures, podcasts, news broadcasts, media commentary, and more.

bio: Dr. Yonesy Núñez is a global cybersecurity executive, board director, and five-time CISO with over two decades of experience leading enterprise cybersecurity across financial institutions. He serves on the Boards of Pentegra Retirement Services and Chain Bridge Bancorp (NYSE: CBNA), providing oversight on technology, cybersecurity, and AI. Most recently, Yonesy was Managing Director and CISO at DTCC, leading global cybersecurity and establishing 24/7 Cyber Threat Fusion Centers across critical market infrastructure. He has held senior roles at Jack Henry & Associates, Wells Fargo, Citi, and PwC. Yonesy holds a Doctorate in Computing from Pace University.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

bio: Patrick Johnson is Director of Military Programs at CompTIA, where he leads engagement across government, industry, and academia to strengthen cyber workforce capability and align development efforts to operational mission needs for the Department of Defense and allied militaries. Previously, he served in the Office of the DoD Chief Information Officer, leading workforce innovation efforts that supported development of the DoD Cyber Workforce Framework (DCWF) and the 8140 Qualification Program. His work focuses on translating emerging risk—especially AI-driven risk—into practical governance, workforce, and operational controls that scale in large organizations.

His work focuses on translating emerging risk—especially AI-driven risk—into practical governance, workforce, and operational controls that scale in large organizations.

bio: Nir Zadok is a rocket scientist who got a bit bored, so he moved to cybersecurity. Since then, as a Whitehat, he has managed to break dozens of mobile, web, and desktop applications. These days Nir is focused on software supply chain and innovative attack vector research via widely used software components exploitation. Nir holds a BSc degree in Physics from Tel Aviv University. He enjoys sports and learning languages.

bio: Sofia Martinez Gomez is a cybersecurity and technology expert at AlixPartners, where she helps organizations navigate their most complex challenges during critical moments. In her current role, she guides clients toward cybersecurity and privacy excellence, ensuring regulatory compliance and operational efficiency. Leveraging on her technical background, she specializes in digital transformation and redesigning operating models to improve performance and resilience. Sofia is also an active member of the Geneva Dialogue—a public–private initiative led by the Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs—working toward responsible behavior in cyberspace. Before joining AlixPartners, Sofia led the global product security and privacy function at Roche Diagnostics.

bio: Captain Houston Mills is President of Flight Operations at UPS Airlines, overseeing global activities and regulatory compliance for one of the world’s largest cargo carriers. His UPS career includes roles as Director of Global Aviation Strategy & Public Policy and Part 119 Director of Airline Safety and Compliance. In 2024, the US Secretary of Transportation appointed him to the FAA Management Advisory Council; he also formerly chaired the FAA Advanced Aviation Advisory Committee. A former Marine Corps officer and F/A-18 pilot, Houston is an internationally qualified Boeing 757/767 Captain. He holds an MBA from Webster University and an Honorary Doctor of Science from Vaughn College. In December 2020, he captained the first COVID-19 flight in the US.

bio: John Banghart, a Senior Director for Cybersecurity Services at Venable, leverages his extensive experience to help clients navigate complex cybersecurity challenges. He previously served as the National Security Council's Director for Federal Cybersecurity under the Obama administration and held senior roles at Microsoft, NIST, and CMS. His expertise covers risk management, government policy, and incident response.

bio: Ron leads Troutman Pepper Locke's Privacy + Cyber team. Drawing from nearly 30 years of experience, he provides comprehensive services to companies in all aspects of privacy, security, data use, and risk mitigation. Clients rely on his in-depth understanding of technology and its application to their business to solve their most important challenges—from implementation and strategy to litigation and incident response. Ron and his team have redefined the boundaries of typical law firm privacy and cyber services in offering a 360 degree approach to tackling information governance issues. Their holistic services include drafting and implementing bespoke privacy programs, program implementation, licensing, incident response, privacy and cyber litigation, and regulatory investigations.

bio: Dianna Moore serves as a concierge-based Integrated 360 Executive Coach, strategic advisor, and professional speaker. She brings more than 25 years of leadership experience across aerospace, venture-backed startups, and wellness to her work with leaders worldwide. For over a decade, she has coached hundreds of individuals across 14 countries guiding them toward breakthroughs that are both measurable and deeply meaningful. Her clients include cybersecurity executives, medical doctors, corporate leaders, and founders who operate daily in high-stakes, high-complexity environments. Through her holistic 360 approach, Dianna helps them align leadership, life, and legacy while optimizing their energy, decision-making, and strategic influence.

bio: Noora Ahmed-Moshe is the Vice President of Strategy and Operations at Hoxhunt, where she works with teams, customers, and partners to build the future of Human Risk Management. With around 20 years of experience in digital product and strategy development across international environments, Noora is a strong advocate for the role of culture in fostering secure behaviors and bridging the gap between technology and human interaction. She is dedicated to creating environments where diverse teams can thrive. An accomplished keynote speaker, she has delivered presentations at leading conferences across Europe, the UK, and the USA, and regularly hosts and appears on webinars and podcasts. Noora holds an MA in Digital Media and a BA in Media and Cultural Studies.

bio: David N. Patariu, PLS, CISSP, FIP, is product counsel focused on privacy, children’s privacy, IoT, wearables, monetization, and AI at Lenovo and Motorola. He advises on global compliance (COPPA, GDPR, UK Online Safety Act, CCPA/CPRA), product design, and trust & safety, and previously led Yahoo’s response to a $5m COPPA fine. He has earned graduate degrees in Computer Science and Informatics from Cornell and Stanford. A former in-house and law-firm Attorney, he has managed incident response, data governance, and vendor risk, negotiated complex data/AI terms, and supported youth features. He brings a builder’s lens—PIAs/DPIAs, red-team tests, and vendor terms that ship—and translates law into deployable controls such as bracketed age tokens, consent signals, and minors-by-design defaults.

bio: Meet Ayleen Charlotte – Scam Fighter of the Year 2023, Founder of S.A.F.E. by Ayleen Charlotte, Board Member of GASA and UN fraud education contributor. Rising to global recognition through Netflix’s The Tinder Swindler, she turned her experience as a victim of one of the world’s most notorious fraud cases into a mission to combat scams. Today, Ayleen works with individuals, financial institutions, law enforcement, and NGOs to identify, prevent, and respond to fraud with empathy and decisive action. Through her initiatives with GASA, the UN, and S.A.F.E. by Ayleen Charlotte, she drives policy change, raises awareness and promotes victim-centered support. Combining her story with expert insight, she inspires audiences worldwide to fight fraud with resilience, knowledge and empowerment.

bio: Fredrick “Flee” Lee is Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) at Reddit. With over 20 years of experience leading global security and privacy at companies including Square and Gusto, Flee oversees Reddit’s Privacy and Security teams, protecting the platform’s integrity and user trust. A seasoned leader and technical expert, he has built resilient, adaptive defenses against evolving threats. Raised in Mississippi, Flee holds a Bachelor’s in Computer Engineering from the University of Oklahoma and is an avid climber, snowboarder, and Redditor.

bio: Cassie Crossley is Co-Founder/CEO of an AI cybersecurity startup focused on software supply chain vulnerability intelligence. A global leader in technology and risk management, she has more than 25 years of experience driving innovation and resilience across critical infrastructure, manufacturing, and technology sectors. Previously Vice President of Supply Chain Security at Schneider Electric, Cassie established one of the industry’s most comprehensive supplier cybersecurity programs and helped shape global standards for software supply chain assurance. She is the author of “Software Supply Chain Security: Securing the End-to-End Supply Chain for Software, Firmware, and Hardware” (O’Reilly Media) and a recognized authority on operational resilience, transparency, and cyber risk governance.

bio: Monta Elkins is a recognized expert in hardware OT cybersecurity with engagements around the world.  Monta was recognized as the OT Cybersecurity Professional of the Year 2018 by EnergySec. He is a Principal Instructor for SANS teaching OT cybersecurity. He has presented at over 70 security conferences and events including Defcon, RSAC ISB, EnergySec, Toshiba Users Group, AREVA, Woodward, GridSecCon, UTC, ICS Cybersecurity, Hack the Capital, BSidesLV, ICS Village, Protect our Power, CS3 Stockholm, CrisisCon, PAINE, Hollywood Hackfest, Hardware.io, S4, and others. His work is referenced in cybersecurity textbooks and featured on Wired.com. Monta is an ICS Cybersecurity US patent grantee and cybersecurity training class author, his most recent is “Hardware Hacking Essentials.”

bio: Phil Englert is a seasoned healthcare technology leader with extensive experience in medical device cybersecurity and healthcare technology management. As the Director of Medical Device Security at Health-ISAC, he leads efforts to improve the security and safety of medical devices across the healthcare sector. Phil has a diverse background, having served in various leadership roles at Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia, Catholic Health Initiatives, and Tenet Healthcare. His expertise spans healthcare technology management, clinical engineering, and cybersecurity strategy, making him a trusted voice in the healthcare industry. Phil is recognized for his work in guiding healthcare organizations to improve medical device security practices and compliance with regulatory standards.

bio: Ashwani Mahajan holds a Master’s degree in Cybersecurity from NYU (2017) and has been working in the security field since 2015. He started his career focusing on penetration testing and secure design, which laid the foundation for his transition into broader application and product security. He joined SoFi in 2020, where he led the Threat and Vulnerability Management (TVM) program for two years. Currently, he manages the TVM team, where he focuses on automating and scaling vulnerability management processes, implementing contextual risk-based prioritization, and driving measurable improvements in remediation efficiency across multi-cloud environments.

bio: Deidre Diamond is the Founder and CEO of CyberSN, specializing in cybersecurity workforce risk management and talent acquisition. Her career began at Motion Recruitment, Rapid7 (RPD), and Percussion Software, gaining 21 years of experience under pioneering entrepreneurs. With degrees in Sociology and Criminal Justice, she launched CyberSN in 2014 to fix the broken job searching system, leading workforce risk management, and improving job matching with the CyberSN Taxonomy. A strong advocate for diversity, Deidre Founded Secure Diversity in 2015 and Co-Founded the Day of Shecurity Conference. Named a Top 25 Women in Cybersecurity, she fosters retention and development across the industry.

bio: Andy Boyd is the CEO of REDLattice, a US-based global defense tech company and an Operating Partner at AE Industrial Partners. He brings extensive experience in national security, cyber intelligence, and strategic leadership. He previously served as a Senior Intelligence Service officer with the CIA, where his career culminated as Director of the Center for Cyber Intelligence. In that role, he directed global intelligence collection, analysis, and operations against foreign cyberthreats, engaging regularly with the White House, Congress, and international partners. Earlier in his CIA career, he was Chief of Operations at the Counterterrorism Mission Center, overseeing worldwide counterterrorism efforts against major terrorist organizations.
globalBio: Andy Boyd is the CEO of REDLattice, a US-based global defense tech company and an Operating Partner at AE Industrial Partners. He brings extensive experience in national security, cyber intelligence, and strategic leadership. He previously served as a Senior Intelligence Service officer with the CIA, where his career culminated as Director of the Center for Cyber Intelligence. In that role, he directed global intelligence collection, analysis, and operations against foreign cyberthreats, engaging regularly with the White House, Congress, and international partners. Earlier in his CIA career, he was Chief of Operations at the Counterterrorism Mission Center, overseeing worldwide counterterrorism efforts against major terrorist organizations.

bio: Charles Carmakal is the Chief Technology Officer of Mandiant Consulting, the security consulting organization of Google Cloud. He oversees a team of incident responders, analysts, and security consultants that have helped thousands of organizations respond to complex security breaches orchestrated by foreign governments and organized criminals. Charles led the teams that discovered and responded to some of the most impactful security events, including the SolarWinds supply chain attack and the Colonial Pipeline cyber disruption. Charles has testified before Congress on multiple cybersecurity topics. He is regularly interviewed by mainstream media organizations and has been included in hundreds of television and print stories on cybersecurity topics.

He is regularly interviewed by mainstream media organizations and has been included in hundreds of television and print stories on cybersecurity topics.

bio: Kennedy Toomey is an Application Security Researcher & Advocate at Datadog, specializing in bridging the gap between developers and security teams. With a background as an Application Security Engineer, she has worked closely with engineering teams to remediate vulnerabilities and design resilient systems. Kennedy regularly speaks and writes about modern application security practices, with a focus on runtime security and developer enablement.

bio: Ray Harishankar is an IBM Fellow within the Quantum team focused on Quantum Safe. Ray is responsible for driving the overall strategy for IBM Quantum Safe, quantum safe product strategy and product engineering. Ray leverages the deep technical expertise of IBM in security services, post quantum cryptography, and pragmatically applies it at clients. He advocates IBM capabilities and leadership in Quantum Safe with clients. Ray engages with customers across insurance, banking, tele-communications, and government and is on the technology advisory council for selected clients and universities. Ray was nominated as an IBM Fellow in ’06, named an Asian American Engineer of the Year, a Distinguished Alumnus by the OSU College of Engineering, and included in Marquis Who’s Who. He holds 23 patents.

bio: Orin Israely is a Senior Manager of Product at Rubrik, where he launched and currently leads the Identity Resilience product. With 15 years in cybersecurity, Orin has focused on building new market categories, including his work as a founding PM at Laminar (acquired by Rubrik), where he brought DSPM to market. He previously served as a group leader in Unit 8200, leading large-scale initiatives that earned the Israel Defense Prize. Orin is an honors graduate of the elite Havatzalot intelligence program.

bio: Mike Paquette joined Elastic in 2016 from Prelert. At Elastic, Mike is Product Lead for the Elastic Security solution. Starting his career as an ASIC designer, Mike has led development of SIEM, IPS, DDoS Defense, and networking solutions. Mike is co-author of patents on DDoS defense and logging schema.

bio: Nicole Tisdale is Interim Senior Director and long-time Senior Advisor to the Cybersecurity Programs at Aspen Digital. She has eighteen years of experience as a national security attorney at The White House – National Security Council and the US Congress’ House Committee on Homeland Security, complemented by consulting for philanthropic and corporate clients. Her expertise spans cybersecurity, counterintelligence, and cyber impacts on rural and low-income communities. At the White House, she led cybersecurity advocacy before Congress, driving creation of the $1 billion cybersecurity grant program and passage of the cyber incident reporting law. She has represented the US in 40 international delegations across 28 countries and spoken at more than 80 conferences in three years.

bio: Kelly Shortridge is Fastly’s Chief Product Officer after leading Fastly’s Security business and serving in the Office of the CTO. The author of "Security Chaos Engineering: Sustaining Resilience in Software and Systems" (O'Reilly Media), Kelly is best known as an expert on software resilience, modernizing cybersecurity to align with platform engineering practices, and the application of behavioral economics to cyber defense. Kelly holds a patent for resilience stress testing software at scale and has published research in leading computer science journals, including ACM, IEEE, and USENIX. Beyond leading the security industry out of its dark ages, Kelly is also passionate about software quality and serves on the Editorial Board of ACM Queue magazine.

bio: Dr. Mengce Zheng is an Associate Professor and the Head of the Cybersecurity major at Zhejiang Wanli University. He received his PhD from the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) and has been a Postdoctoral Researcher at USTC, and a Visiting Scholar at the University of Tokyo and the University of Caen Normandy. His research focuses on cryptographic algorithms, cryptanalysis, and post-quantum security. He has published over 30 papers in related journals and conferences. Mengce is a recipient of the Zhejiang Province University Leading Talent award.

bio: John P. Carlin is Co-Chair of Paul Weiss’s Investigations, Cybersecurity & Data Protection, and National Security Practice Groups. A distinguished litigator, he advises top organizations on privacy, cybersecurity, crisis management, CFIUS, sanctions, export control, white collar defense, and internal investigations. He has served as a top-level official in both Republican and Democratic administrations, including Acting Deputy Attorney General, top National Security Official at the DOJ, FBI Chief of Staff, and Assistant US Attorney. John is a recognized authority on cyber and economic espionage, featured in major media outlets like The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Wall Street Journal, and more.

John is a recognized authority on cyber and economic espionage, featured in major media outlets like The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Wall Street Journal, and more.

bio:
Abhijith “Abx” B R has over a decade long experience in the offensive cyber security domain. Currently, he is building BreachSimRange.io and involved with multiple organizations as an independent consultant.
In the past, he managed offensive security at Envestnet, Inc., served as Dy. Manager of Cybersecurity at Nissan Motor Corporation, and prior to that worked at EY as a Sr. Security Analyst. He is the Founder of Adversary Village at DEF CON hacking conference, a community focused on Adversary simulation, offensive cybersecurity, purple teaming, etc. Abhijith has spoken at various security conferences such as DEF CON, RSAC Conference, The Diana Initiative, Opensource India, BSidesLV, BSidesSF, BSides Tampa, BSides Delhi, Hack Space Con, Nullcon, c0c0n, etc.

bio: Wendy Nather is the Senior Research Initiatives Director at 1Password. She was previously the Director of Advisory CISOs at Duo Security, Research Director at the Retail ISAC, and Research Director of the Information Security Practice at 451 Research. Wendy led IT security for the EMEA region of the investment banking division of Swiss Bank Corporation (now UBS) and served as CISO of the Texas Education Agency. She was inducted into the Infosecurity Europe Hall of Fame in 2021. Wendy serves on the board of directors for Sightline Security, is on the steering committee for the IST Ransomware Task Force, and is a Senior Fellow at the Atlantic Council's Cyber Statecraft Initiative.
globalBio: Wendy Nather is the Senior Research Initiatives Director at 1Password. Wendy led IT security for the EMEA region of the investment banking division of Swiss Bank Corporation (now UBS) and served as CISO of the Texas Education Agency. She was inducted into the Infosecurity Europe Hall of Fame in 2021. Wendy serves on the board of directors for Sightline Security, is on the steering committee for the IST Ransomware Task Force, and is a Senior Fellow at the Atlantic Council's Cyber Statecraft Initiative.

bio: Petros Efstathopoulos is VP of Research at RSAC. He has been working on computer security, privacy, and systems architecture for more than 20 years. He got his PhD in Computer Science at UCLA, specializing in secure and private operating systems. Petros has conducted original research in the areas of security, operating systems, networks, cloud, mobile, and IoT systems. He is serving as a program committee member for multiple conferences, provides media commentary on security and privacy issues, and has been invited as a guest speaker at conferences and events. In the past, he worked at Intel Research and led a team of researchers at Symantec/NortonLifeLock/Gen for many years as the VP of Innovation. He has published more than 20 papers at top-tier academic venues and holds 48 US Patents.

bio: Jenko Hwong is a Principal Threat Researcher at Huntress Labs. He was formerly a Principal Threat Researcher at Netskope, speaks regularly at RSAC Conference and DEFCON, and helps run Cloud Village CTFs. He brings 30 years of customer and product experience working in research, product management, and engineering at companies such as Cisco, TIBCO, and security startups in vulnerability scanning, anti-virus/anti-spam appliances, penetration-testing, threat intelligence, and Active Directory security. He has founded a startup in the enterprise monitoring market and led production deployments with enterprise customers including Walmart, Microsoft, Lucent, Chase, and European banks. He holds a BS in Computer Systems Engineering from Stanford University.

He holds a BS in Computer Systems Engineering from Stanford University.

bio:
Lessie Skiba, CISSP, is Deputy Managing Director at the Cyber Readiness Institute (CRI), where she leads global initiatives to strengthen cybersecurity resilience for small and medium-sized businesses. She builds strategic partnerships with industry leaders and government stakeholders to secure supply chains and expand cybersecurity capacity in developing economies.

She also serves as Chief of Staff at NetRise, a software supply chain security company, where she drives internal strategy, operational alignment, and cultural transformation to enhance organizational effectiveness.

With a career spanning cybersecurity, venture capital, and high-growth startups, Lessie previously held leadership roles at Nisos and an early-stage investment firm.

bio: Todd Inskeep has delivered security leadership and innovation for over 25 years, and currently leads Incovate Solutions, focusing on executive engagement for cyber risk management and security program leadership throughout digital transformations. He has led innovation and cybersecurity projects and assessments for global and regional companies (oil and gas, hi-tech and global manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, and financial service), he's been a CISO, and worked cyber and online banking security. Todd has multiple patents and was Executive-in-Residence at the MIT Media Lab. He started his career at the National Security Agency, and holds both a BSEE and a Master of Science in Strategic Intelligence.

bio: Zach Edwards is a Staff Threat Researcher at Infoblox, joining the team in 2026, with a focus on understanding and tracking how APT groups are evolving. His expertise includes a deep knowledge of global data supply chains and advertising systems. Zach is passionate about data privacy, is active in numerous communities, and has been involved in high-profile GDPR complaints, including cases against online dating apps and Google auction systems. Zach has presented at high profile events, including a 2023 Blackhat USA session titled, “Kids in the Ad Fraud Crosshair: Why International Threat Actors are Targeting Children to Steal Money from Banks and Major Corporations.”

bio: Ed Skoudis has taught over 40,000 security professionals globally in penetration testing and incident handling. Ed currently serves as the President of the SANS Technology Institute college, supporting over 2,500 students earning their master’s degrees, bachelor’s degrees, and cyber security certificates. Ed is consistently one of the first authorities brought in to provide post-attack analysis on major breaches. Ed is also the founder of the SANS Penetration Testing Curriculum; the CEO and founder of the Counter Hack consulting firm; and the leader of the team that builds SANS NetWars and the SANS Holiday Hack Challenge. Ed is a keynote speaker and an Advisory Board member for RSA Conference.  He is also on the board of directors for a community bank, a charity, and another college.

bio: Todd Fitzgerald promotes CISO/CPO leadership by advising CISOs, board participation, podcasts, and international speaking engagements. Todd founded the successful CISO STORIES leadership podcast and hosted the first 190 episodes. Todd authored 5 books, including #1 New Release (2024) "Privacy Leader Compass: A Comprehensive Roadmap for Building and Leading Practical Privacy Programs," and #1 Best-selling (2019-2024) and Cybersecurity Canon's 2020 Hall of Fame, "CISO COMPASS: Navigating Cybersecurity Leadership Challenges with Insights from Pioneers." Named 2016 & 17 Chicago CISO of the Year, Todd's senior leadership positions include Northern Trust, Grant Thornton International, Ltd, ManpowerGroup, Wellpoint/National Government Services, Zeneca/Syngenta, IMS Health, and American Airlines.

bio: Joshua Wright is the senior technical director for Counter Hack Innovations and a faculty fellow for the SANS Institute. As a professional penetration tester, he has identified and disclosed critical security vulnerabilities for Fortune 500 companies, national infrastructure providers, casinos, banks, cloud service providers, smart toys, and more. He is the author of the SANS course SEC504: Hacker Tools, Techniques, and Incident Handling, and is the dean of students for the SANS Technology Institute, a career-focused undergraduate and graduate college dedicated exclusively on cybersecurity. "We can choose to accept that widespread compromise is inevitable for every company, or we can apply deep technical insight and understanding to protect what is most important. I prefer the latter."

bio: Ryan René Rosado is a dynamic emerging leader and respected voice in the cybersecurity community, with 15 years of experience across public, private, and academic sectors. She is a Manager in RSM US’s Cyber Strategy Consulting Practice, Head Teaching Assistant at Harvard Extension School, and Advisor to Ally Security. With roots as a US Air Force Cyber Intelligence Analyst, Ryan went on to strengthen the security posture of leading organizations such as EY, Avanade, and Optiv. She holds dual BS degrees in Cybersecurity (Utica College) and Disaster Management (SUNY Empire State College) and was named an AFCEA Emerging Leader in 2018. She has presented at multiple conferences and on many podcasts. Ryan is passionate about mentorship, leadership, emerging tech, and building community.

bio: Dave Merkel is the Co-Founder and CEO of Expel. He’s been involved in the information security field for nearly 30 years, first as a federal agent pursuing early cybercriminals, then as CTO and VP of products at Mandiant. Following FireEye’s acquisition of Mandiant, Dave served as the global CTO of FireEye. Dave got his start as a security practitioner: first as a Special Agent in the Air Force Office of Special Investigations, conducting digital forensic investigations, and later as head of AOL’s technical security organization. While at AOL, he created and ran the first incident response capability for AOL and Time Warner, managed software security and policy programs, and built technologies for AOL’s security infrastructure.

bio: Nishant Kaushik is the CTO of the FIDO Alliance. A distinguished executive and technologist with over 25 years of leadership in digital identity and security, he has shaped strategies and built market-leading solutions at startups and global enterprises, with leadership roles at Thor Technologies, Oracle, Uniken, SCUID and CA Technologies. In his current role, he is leaning into his passion for advancing cybersecurity and digital trust with cutting-edge technology, industry standards, human-centric design and strategic foresight.

bio: Ali Zohaib is a PhD Candidate in the College of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. His research lies at the intersection of network security, privacy, and Internet measurement. He focuses on characterizing large-scale Internet censorship and developing empirical, measurement-driven defenses to safeguard online freedom and connectivity.

He focuses on characterizing large-scale Internet censorship and developing empirical, measurement-driven defenses to safeguard online freedom and connectivity.

bio: Andy Ozment is the Chief Technology Risk Officer and EVP at Capital One, where he also leads data management risk. Previously, he was CISO and a Partner at Goldman Sachs. In government, Andy was the Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity at the US Department of Homeland Security from 2014-2017. His team of ~700 employees protected 2M government users, supported private companies, and responded to dozens of incidents like the breach of the Ukrainian power grid in 2015. From 2012-2014, Andy led national policy for President Obama at the White House, where he served as Deputy Cyber Czar. He was responsible for the Executive Order that created the NIST Cybersecurity Framework. Andy earned a BS in Computer Science from Georgia Tech, an MS from the LSE, and a PhD from Cambridge.

bio: Jaz Banga is a serial Silicon Valley entrepreneur and the Founder/CEO of Airspace Defense, a leader in airspace security. His team invented the FAA's Remote ID standard, the core technology for tracking drones. Recognizing his expertise, the FAA appointed him to the Drone Advisory Committee, where he helps shape national policy for unmanned aircraft integration. Before Airspace, Jaz founded Feeva Technology, which delivered the Google Wi-Fi project to San Francisco. He also founded ProximityWare and co-founded Connected Patents. A prolific inventor, he holds 55 patents in technologies from internet connectivity to drone guidance. His unique blend of policy, tech, and entrepreneurial leadership gives him an unparalleled perspective on the drone era.

bio: Ryan Bergsma serves as Technology Director and Security Manager at the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA), where he leads three teams focused on IT operations, application development, and customer support. He oversees CSA’s cloud-based infrastructure and its security, while managing the use, integration, and security of AI tools across the organization. A CCSK holder, Ryan led the development of CSA’s first online self-paced CCSK training program and has contributed to multiple CSA research artifacts. His work bridges technical implementation with strategic security leadership, helping organizations worldwide approach cloud security certification and risk assessment. Ryan holds a BS in Computer Information System Security from Western Washington University.

bio: Alex “Jay” Balan is the CISO at Super Technologies. With over 20 years of experience in Information Security, innovation, and product strategy, he has been a driving force behind major initiatives shaping these fields. Throughout his career, Jay has shared his expertise as a speaker at top international security conferences, including DEFCON, RSAC Conference, ISC China, DerbyCon, and many others. His forward-thinking approach to research, security, and privacy has led to policy shifts and mindset changes across organizations worldwide, aligning them better with today’s realities.

bio: Ryan Miller is a Sr. Director at Target Corporation, where he leads Cyber Threat Operations including Cyber Threat Intel, Fraud Intel, and Reverse Engineering teams. His experience includes leading and supporting cyberthreat intelligence operations in large fusion centers including the National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center (NCCIC) and the National Cyber Investigative Joint Task Force (NCIJTF).  Ryan is an industry recognized leader who regularly participates and shares threat intelligence, processes, and best practices through forums such as vendor conferences, ISAC communities, and RSAC eFraud Global Forum (eFG). Ryan also serves as a Program Committee member on the RSAC eFG, helping drive engagement and content development.

bio: Terry Woodman is the Director of Cyber Defense: Enterprise Incident Management at Target, where he leads the response to the most critical security and privacy events. He holds an MBA from Hamline University and a CISSP certification. Terry is the inventor of EasySweep, an open source, patented tool that detects card skimmers on payment terminals. A champion of intel sharing, he believes collaboration is key to defeating cyberthreats.

bio: Margaret Hu is Professor of Law, Director of the Digital Democracy Lab, and Faculty Affiliate with the Global Research Institute and School of Computing, Data Sciences & Physics at William & Mary. Her research focuses on the intersection of AI governance, national security, cybersecurity, cybersurveillance, constitutional, and civil rights. She is Author of "AI Law & Policy" (Aspen Publishing 2025) and Editor of "Pandemic Surveillance: Privacy, Security, and Ethics" (Elgar Publishing 2022). She previously served as Special Policy Counsel in the Civil Rights Division of the US Department of Justice and as Senior Policy Advisor in the Obama Administration’s White House Initiative for Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders. She holds degrees from University of Kansas and Duke Law School.

bio: Sunita Patel is Senior Assistant General Counsel for Product Security at Micron, where she drives strategies to secure advanced memory and storage technologies shaping our digital future. With 18+ years in cybersecurity, supply chain security, and national security, she influences global security dialogue by connecting law, policy, and technology to address emerging threats and enable innovation. Previously, Sunita served at the White House Office of the National Cyber Director and held roles in other US Government agencies. She is a Member of the ABA Standing Committee on Law and National Security and earned her JD from Syracuse University.

bio: Principal Analyst Todd Thiemann has over 20 years of experience in cybersecurity marketing and strategy and helps clients understand emerging market trends, refine product strategy, and ensure customer alignment. Todd has spent most of his career leading cybersecurity marketing and product marketing at category leaders including ReliaQuest, Arctic Wolf Networks, Socure, Vormetic (now Thales), Nok Nok Labs (now OneSpan), and Trend Micro. Todd has written for Dark Reading and has been quoted in The New York Times, CSO, eWeek, CFO, The Register, SCWorld, InfoWorld, and SearchSecurity, among others. Todd holds a BS from the School of Foreign Service at Georgetown University in Washington, DC and an MBA from the UCLA Anderson School of Management in Los Angeles, California.

bio: Norbert Pohlmann is Professor in the Computer Science Department for cybersecurity and the Director of the Institute for Internet Security at the Westphalian University of Applied Sciences Gelsenkirchen. He is also Chairman of the Board of the IT Security Association TeleTrusT and Member of the Board of the Internet Industry Association Eco. His research interests include Internet of Things security, blockchain security, cyber situation awareness, AI for cybersecurity, trusted IT systems, modern authentication/signature systems, IT security in the health care sector, Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI), and trustworthiness for IT-systems and companies.

bio: Kevin O’Connor is Director of Threat Research at N-able (via the 2024 Adlumin acquisition), leading detection engineering and incident response for MSP and mid-market defenders. A former NSA Security Engineer and CNO Technical Director, he later worked with CrowdStrike’s research team. He’s published on threats like PowerDrop and contributes commentary to Dark Reading and SC Media. Degrees: Penn State; post-grad NPS

bio: Ben Horowitz is a co-founder and general partner at Andreessen Horowitz, a venture capital firm that backs bold entrepreneurs building the future through technology. With $90 billion under management across multiple funds, a16z has invested in companies like Airbnb, Anduril, Coinbase, Cursor, Databricks, Deel, Devoted Health, Figma, GitHub, Okta, Roblox, SpaceX, Stripe, and Waymo. Ben is the author of the New York Times bestsellers The Hard Thing About Hard Things and What You Do Is Who You Are. Prior to a16z, Ben was co-founder and CEO of Opsware (formerly Loudcloud), which was acquired by Hewlett-Packard for $1.6 billion in 2007. Previously, Ben ran several product divisions at Netscape Communications, including VP of Netscape’s widely acclaimed Directory and Security product line.

bio: Sven Cattell founded the AI Village and was the main organizer of its Generative Red Team at DEFCON 31 and 32. Sven is also the founder of nbhd.ai, a startup focused on the security and integrity of datasets and the AI they build. He was previously a Senior Data Scientist at Elastic where he built the malware model training pipeline. He has a PhD in Algebraic Topology, and a postdoc in geometric machine learning where he focused on anomaly and novelty detection.

bio: Sam Ng is an application security lead at a global cryptocurrency fintech platform, where he builds secure infrastructure and leads research on applied cryptography for digital assets. He has authored over 14 patents and peer‑reviewed publications on privacy‑preserving digital signatures, Threshold ECDSA, and zero‑knowledge proof‑of‑reserves and related protocols. His recent work bridges advanced cryptography with production systems, including ECDSA‑compatible privacy‑preserving signatures and blockchain‑based proofs for asset transparency.

bio: James Rundle is a reporter covering the cybersecurity industry, national cyber policy, and privacy for The Wall Street Journal. His stories often focus on the people behind the headlines, such as those who respond to cyberattacks, the lawmakers defining a new era of rules for companies, and those who fall victim to criminals and nation-states. He writes frequently about the evolving industries involved in cybersecurity, including the technology companies use to defend against hackers, the insurance they buy to protect themselves, and the money involved in all of it. James joined the Journal in 2019, after covering financial regulation, markets and technology for over a decade for Dow Jones & Co. and other publishers. Originally from London, UK, he is now based in New York.

bio: General Timothy D. Haugh (Ret.) is the former NSA Director and Commander of US Cyber Command. As a top military commander, he drove efforts to strengthen the nation’s cyber posture, enhance operational readiness, and deepen partnerships with international allies and the private sector. Under his leadership at NSA and USCYBERCOM, he confronted a wide range of emerging threats – from ransomware attacks to high-profile cyber espionage campaigns – while advancing innovation across the defense and intelligence ecosystem. Gen. Haugh is a Blue Senior Fellow at the Yale Jackson School of Global Affairs and a Strategic Advisor to Ballistic Ventures.

bio: Anirudh Khanna is a distinguished technical and thought leader in Data Protection and Cybersecurity. With 17+ years of experience, Anirudh has led teams responsible for safeguarding data and ensuring business continuity at several Fortune 500 companies. A prolific author, Anirudh has published 20+ research papers in reputed journals and presented at over nine international conferences. Anirudh's expertise and commitment to advancing the field of data protection have been recognized with prestigious awards, including Stevie, Globee, and Titan Awards for technological excellence. His extensive body of work, including articles and research papers, highlights his capabilities as a visionary in data protection and cyber recovery, cementing his status as a respected authority in the industry.

bio: Sarah is a Managing Director and the Head of Cyber Resiliency and Human Defense at Wells Fargo where she is leading the firm’s human-centric strategy against sophisticated cyber threats through advanced simulations, training, and education. She is a globally recognized cybersecurity expert and thought leader in human risk management and behavioral psychology, specializing in people-centric cyber defense and crisis strategies for the Financial Services sector. With over 20 years of experience at the intersection of technology and finance, Sarah has built a career in executive leadership, technology management, and business operations. She has held several Board of Directors positions, and as a successful entrepreneur, she helped launch 4 companies and develop over 30 leading brands.

bio: Dr Katie Paxton-Fear is a security expert and a Security Advocate at Semgrep, in her words: she used to make applications and now she breaks them. A former API developer turned API hacker. She has found vulnerabilities in organizations ranging from the Department of Defense to Verizon, with simple API vulnerabilities. Katie regularly delivers security training and security research to some of the largest brands worldwide. She combines easy-to-understand explanations with key technical details that turn security into something everyone can get.

She has found vulnerabilities in organizations ranging from the Department of Defense to Verizon, with simple API vulnerabilities. Katie regularly delivers security training and security research to some of the largest brands worldwide. She combines easy-to-understand explanations with key technical details that turn security into something everyone can get.

bio: Michael Dolan is Vice President and Chief Privacy Officer at Best Buy, where he leads enterprise privacy, data protection, and cyber risk governance. He partners across legal, security, and technology teams to operationalize privacy and compliance in support of business growth and customer trust. Michael oversees privacy engineering, data loss prevention, information governance, and regulatory response. He is a frequent speaker on privacy and cybersecurity risk, including appearances at CES and national policy forums. He holds a JD and an MBA from the University of Minnesota.

bio:
Tomer Weingarten is a co-founder and CEO of SentinelOne. He is responsible for the company’s
direction, products, and strategy. Prior to joining SentinelOne, Tomer led product development and
strategy for the partially Nielsen-owned ITWP where he held the position of VP of Products after joining
via the acquisition of the statistical significance based sentiment analysis and polling start up he
founded. Prior to that he held several senior application development, security and consulting roles at
various enterprises, and at Carambola, the machine-learning based video ad-network where he served
as the Chief Technology Officer. Tomer also serves as an advisor for security companies Javelin Networks
(acquired by Symantec), SecuredTouch, Cycognito and deep learning analytics company Imubit.

Currently, she works at Microsoft, leading marketing effort for security for AI solutions. She also works closely with the product engineering team to drive product strategy and roadmap.

bio: Kevin Mandia is one of the world’s most recognized experts in cybersecurity and a relentless warrior deeply engaged in fighting cyberthreats. At Ballistic Ventures, he invests in entrepreneurs, using his extensive knowledge of the threat landscape and strengths as a successful Founder and CEO. Kevin was CEO of Mandiant, including through a successful acquisition by Google in 2022. He has spent more than 30 years in infosec helping make organizations secure from threats. Kevin has held senior positions in the security consulting divisions of Sytex, acquired by Lockheed Martin, and Foundstone, acquired by McAfee. In the US Air Force, he served as a Computer Security Officer at the Pentagon, and later a Special Agent in the Air Force Office of Special Investigations.

bio: Admiral Mike Rogers retired from the US Navy in June 2018 after 37 years of naval service rising to the rank of four-star admiral. He culminated his career with a four-year tour as Commander, US Cyber Command, and Director, National Security Agency. Mike is a graduate of Auburn University and holds a Masters of Science in National Security. He is a distinguished graduate of the National War College and a graduate of highest distinction from the Naval War College. He is also an MIT Seminar XXI fellow and a Harvard Senior Executive in National Security alum. Mike currently supports companies in the private sector as an advisor and board member and is an Operating Partner at global venture fund Team8.

bio: Brandon Park is CTO and co-founder of Galvanick. He started his career building industrial cybersecurity capabilities for Merck and Bechtel, where his work spanned environments from pharmaceutical manufacturing to nuclear facilities. At Amazon, Brandon led the Global Industrial Security team, overseeing more than 700 facilities across 40 countries with a team of just four FTEs. That experience operating at massive scale with minimal resources shaped Galvanick's approach: delivering meaningful threat detection through multi-source visibility and automated correlation, all without introducing risk to production systems. Under his technical leadership, Galvanick now protects some of the nation's most critical manufacturing facilities.

Under his technical leadership, Galvanick now protects some of the nation's most critical manufacturing facilities.

bio: Zhengyu Liu is a third-year PhD student in Computer Science at Johns Hopkins University, advised by Prof. Yinzhi Cao. His research focuses on Web and Software Security. He has published in top-tier venues including IEEE S&P ’26/’25/’24, USENIX Security ’25, and Computers & Security, receiving the Distinguished Paper Award (S&P ’25), Honorable Mention (USENIX Security ’25), and Best Student Paper Award (ICICS ’22). His work has uncovered numerous critical zero-day vulnerabilities (50+ CVEs) in widely deployed software, earning acknowledgments from major vendors including Google, Microsoft, Meta, Vercel, ByteDance, and Ant Group.
