bio: Joe Spracklen is a third year PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Texas at San Antonio where his research focuses on hallucinations in large language models. He is also an active duty Major in the United States Army, most recently assigned to Army Cyber Command in a variety of roles, including Deputy Director of Analytics, Incident Response Team Lead, and Company Commander. Joe received his commission from West Point as an Air Defense Artillery Officer and also hold a Master's degree in Computer Science from Georgia Tech.

bio: Meg Anderson is a retired senior executive and former VP-Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) for Principal Financial Group®, where she led the vision and execution of the company's enterprise-wide cybersecurity and cyber risk strategy for over 17 years. Meg is now a member of the faculty of IANS (Institute for Applied Network Security) where she continues to share her experience and problem-solving with clients across all industries. As CISO, Meg was responsible for safeguarding customer data, ensuring regulatory compliance across global operations, and protecting critical assets in an ever evolving and expanding threat landscape. Meg’s contributions to the cybersecurity field were honored in 2025 when she was inducted into the CSO Hall of Fame.

bio: Enrique joined Bain Capital Ventures in 2014, where he focuses on infrastructure software and services with a specialization in cybersecurity.  He was previously the president and CEO of Symantec (Nasdaq: SYMC) and brings more than 27 years of executive experience in technology and security to Bain Capital Ventures. Through his 19 years as the global leader for security, backup, and availability solutions, Salem also served as the executive vice president of worldwide sales and marketing and president of consumer products. Before Symantec, he was president and CEO of Brightmail, the leading anti-spam software company acquired by Symantec in 2004. In March 2011, Enrique was appointed to President Barack Obama’s Management Advisory Board.

bio: Bob Lord is a cybersecurity executive and public-interest technologist with deep experience building and defending high profile digital systems. He has led major secure by design initiatives at the Institute for Security and Technology (IST) and at the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), where he served as a Senior Technical Advisor focused on shifting more responsibility for customer safety to software manufacturers. He was the first Chief Security Officer (CSO) at the Democratic National Committee (DNC), boosting the security of the Committee along with state parties and campaigns. Earlier in his career he was the CISO at Yahoo and the first security hire at X/Twitter, where he built and led the Information Security program from the ground up.

bio: Pat Opet is Global CISO and Head of Cybersecurity & Technology Controls at JPMorganChase. He is a member of the firm’s Global Technology Leadership Team and leads an organization of several thousand cybersecurity and technology controls professionals across all lines of business in every geography where the firm operates. They focus on securely enabling business growth and resilience and partner closely with government agencies and companies across industry to advance early warning and operational collaboration. Pat is Vice Chair of the Analysis & Resilience Center for Systemic Risk (ARC). He has an M.S. from the University of Maryland in Computer Systems Management & Information Assurance and a B.S. from George Washington University in Computer Engineering.

bio: Leslie Kershaw is CISO at Capella Space. With 20+ years of experience, Leslie is a visionary cyber leader and operational expert. Prior to Capella Space, she served as the Cyber Technical Director of Space DELTA 6 (DEL 6), Space Operations Command, United States Space Force, where she directed cyber capabilities and architecture for a mission-critical team spanning 13 geographically-separated locations. Leslie started her career as an Army Signals Intelligence Analyst and became the Army’s first female Interactive On-Net operator certified by the NSA. She’s also an advocate for fostering cyber talent, serving as a mentor for Cyber Patriots and co-founding the Colorado chapter of Military Cyber Professionals.

bio: Nicholas Leiserson is the Senior Vice President for Policy at the Institute for Security and Technology. A legislative strategist and technologist, he has spent more than 15 years addressing cybersecurity risk and resilience and managing teams of senior professionals at the White House and on Capitol Hill. He was integral in the creation of the Office of the National Cyber Director and served as one of its first employees where he built the infrastructure for an office that grew to over 80 people in two years. Nicholas spent more than a decade on the staff of former Congressman James R. Langevin, most recently as his Chief of Staff. He created and executed the House legislative strategy for the Cyberspace Solarium Commission. He holds a degree in Computer Science from Brown University.

bio: Chris Bevil is a former CISO and cybersecurity advisor who brings real-world perspective to cyber resilience, recovery and incident response. As Principal Consultant at Commvault, he works directly with security and technology leaders to help them prepare for, respond to and recover from cyber incidents when the pressure is highest. He spent over a decade advising organizations in highly regulated industries helping executives answer the hardest questions: Are we truly resilient? Can we recover? Can we stand behind our decisions in front of boards, regulators and customers? A national, regional and local speaker, Chris is known for his engaging, interactive style, bringing audiences into the conversation and making complex cyber challenges practical, approachable, and enjoyable to explore.

bio: Kristin Madigan, a partner at Crowell & Moring, previously served as an attorney at the FTC in Washington, DC in the Bureau of Consumer Protection, Division of Privacy and Identity Protection. She led nonpublic investigations and prosecuted unfair and deceptive practices in privacy and data security matters. Her practice focuses on privacy and complex litigation disputes. Kristin regularly counsels' clients on state and federal privacy laws in a range of contexts. She is a Certified Information Privacy Professional/United States (CIPP/US). Kristin is Vice-Chair of the ABA Section of Science & Technology Law: Internet of Things, is on the San Francisco Bar Association Cybersecurity Section Board, and the Board of Governors of the Association of Business Trial Lawyers Northern California.

bio: Dr. Chase Cunningham (“DrZeroTrust”) is a cybersecurity executive, former Forrester VP/Principal Analyst, and retired U.S. Navy Chief Cryptologist. He created the Zero Trust eXtended (ZTX) framework and advises boards and security leaders on modern defense strategy, risk, and resilience. As founder of Demo-Force, he helps organizations evaluate security technology through hands-on, measurable demos that accelerate decisions and outcomes. He also hosts The DrZeroTrust Show, bringing practitioner-grade insight and candid industry analysis to a global audience.

bio: Michael McLaughlin is a practicing attorney and chairs Buchanan’s cybersecurity practice group. He advises clients on cybersecurity, data privacy, technology, and compliance. A Navy veteran, he served over 15 years as an intelligence officer, and has extensive experience in cyber operations, incident response, remediation, and governance. His postings include Senior Counterintelligence Advisor for US Cyber Command and Chief of Counterintelligence and Human Intelligence for the Cyber National Mission Force, where he oversaw operations, investigations, and law enforcement support for US military cyberspace efforts. He co-authored “Battlefield Cyber” and is CEO of VeridatAI, a data marketplace connecting data owners with AI/ML developers.

bio: Tulasi Pilli is a Staff Application Security Engineer at Rivian, a US patent holder in Software Supply Chain Security and an AWS Certified Security Specialist. He specializes in automating security within the SDLC, leveraging Large Language Models like Gemini and Azure OpenAI to mitigate OWASP Top 10 risks. With a deep background in threat modeling, SAST/SCA integration, and bug bounty management at companies including Malwarebytes and State Street, Tulasi brings practical, hands-on experience in building the next generation of application security tooling. He holds a Master's degree in Information Security from Wilmington University.

bio: Christiane Kirketerp de Viron is the Acting Director for Cybersecurity and Trust at the Directorate-General for Communications Networks, Content, and Technology (DG CONNECT) of the European Commission, covering cybersecurity, digital identity, and trust services. She was previously Head of Unit for cybersecurity and digital privacy policy, covering critical infrastructure resilience, product security, cyber defense, and international cybersecurity cooperation. She was previously also Member of the Cabinet to the Commissioner for Budget and Administration, Johannes Hahn (2019-2022), covering digital transformation and cybersecurity of the EU institutions and bodies. She is a political scientist from the University of Copenhagen.

She is a political scientist from the University of Copenhagen.

bio: Rick Swenson is Head of Enterprise Fraud Management at TIAA managing fraud prevention for all lines of business, channels, and products. He has 34+ years of financial services expertise specializing in enterprise fraud prevention, financial crimes management, and omni-channel payments risk across banking, brokerage, and insurance. Rick is a Certified Fraud Examiner. He is a graduate of Augustana College (BA) and The Wharton Graduate School of Banking.

bio: Lisa Plaggemier is Executive Director at the National Cybersecurity Alliance. Lisa is on a mission to bridge the communications gap between security professionals fighting to protect us and our way of life, and the rest of us, struggling with the lingo and trying to keep ourselves and our loved ones safe. Lisa started her career in marketing with Ford Motor Company before moving into security at ADP Dealer Services (now CDK). Lisa has served on the US Secret Service Cyber Investigations Advisory Board, the board of human trafficking nonprofit Allies Against Slavery, the Advisory Board of the Identity Theft Resource Center, and the board of US Cyber Games. She is a University of Michigan graduate and while she wasn’t born in Austin, Texas, she got there as fast as she could.

bio: Rob Juncker brings 25+ years of security, cloud, and IT leadership to Mimecast as Chief Product Officer. A trusted advisor to enterprise CISOs, Rob chairs Advisory Boards with Fortune 500 companies on security strategies from platform consolidation to AI governance, helping leaders transform from reactive threat response to proactive human risk management. As former CTO at Code42 (acquired by Mimecast in 2024), Rob led development of the Incydr insider risk solution, transforming the company from on-premises backup to cloud-delivered cybersecurity at global scale. Prior roles at Ivanti and VMware reinforced his security and enterprise IT expertise. Rob frequently keynotes on emerging threats and modernization strategies.

Prior roles at Ivanti and VMware reinforced his security and enterprise IT expertise. Rob frequently keynotes on emerging threats and modernization strategies.

bio: Brian Vecci supports a wide range of security and technology initiatives by helping Varonis’ customers and partners get the most out of the company’s products. In his 20-year technical career, he served as a developer, tech architect, engineer, and product manager for companies in financial services, legal, and cybersecurity. Brian joined Varonis in 2010 in technical marketing, led education and development, and now serves as the company’s Field CTO. He holds a CISSP certification and frequently speaks on topics related to security and technology. He has been quoted in news sources ranging from the Financial Times to Dark Reading and has made multiple appearances on CNBC.

bio: Carl is Executive Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) for Fortinet, Inc. (FTNT), where he has helped to drive product security & strategy for over 20 years. With prior roles in System Engineering, Sales and Product Management and the CTO Office, leading SDWAN and SASE strategy.  He is now responsible for driving Product Security across the company.    Prior to working at Fortinet Carl was Chief Technical Architect responsible for managed security service strategy with a focus on networking and security services at European Datacenter company TeleCity (now Equinix).

bio: Lawrence Baldwin is credited with developing intelligence packages for law enforcement around the world that ultimately led to the successful takedown of some of the largest transnational cybercrime groups of the last two decades (e.g. JabberZeus, Gozi). His work covered ACH and wire fraud, stock and futures trading fraud, reshipping schemes, and tax refund fraud, with an emphasis on translating complex technical evidence into actionable intelligence. Previously, he was a network forensics and cyber-crime intelligence professional specializing in high-dollar cyber fraud investigations and adversary infrastructure analysis. Today he leads a nonprofit focused on a different network challenge: reducing social disconnection including developing innovative, practical approaches to homelessness.

bio: At Google, Royal Hansen manages cybersecurity threat detection, analysis and counter abuse, building advanced AI/ML security technologies, and protecting privacy, identity, and data. Prior to Google, he worked in the financial services industry, with leadership positions at American Express, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Fidelity Investments. In these roles, he focused on protecting the security and integrity of the companies’ technology systems and the information they processed, managed regulatory risk and compliance standards, and enabled technical resilience through his teams’ work on disaster recovery and business continuity. He began his career in cybersecurity at @stake and studied Computer Science at Yale University. He received a Fulbright fellowship in Arabic language study.

bio: Paul Kocher is a security researcher and entrepreneur. His technical work includes co-authoring the SSL/TLS protocol, discovering differential power analysis, co-discovering the Spectre vulnerability, and architecting many security hardware cores. He founded Cryptography Research in 1995, which he led until its acquisition by Rambus, where he served as SVP/Chief Scientist until 2017. He now leads research efforts exploring how cryptography, compilers, AI, and computer architectures can help secure complex systems. He advises and invests in security start-ups. He is a member of the US National Academy of Engineering, an International Association for Cryptologic Research Fellow, and received the 2019 Marconi Prize (with Taher Elgamal) and the RSA 2023 Award for Excellence in Mathematics.

bio: Moira Bergin serves as Director for the Subcommittee Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection at the House Committee on Homeland Security. Moira advises Members on policies related to cybersecurity, critical infrastructure protection, cyberthreat information-sharing, supply chain risk management, and election security. Prior to joining the Committee, Moira served as Law Clerk at the Maryland Court of Special Appeals and as Senior Legislative Assistant to Congresswoman Louise M. Slaughter of New York. Moira earned her Juris Doctorate, magna cum laude, from the Catholic University Columbus School of Law, and is licensed to practice law in Maryland and New York. She earned her Bachelor of Arts in Government and Politics from the University of Maryland, College Park.

bio: Chris Edmundson is a cybersecurity leader with 15+ years of experience in vulnerability management, cloud security, and healthcare IT. As Solution Delivery Manager at WWT, he drives complex security initiatives, guiding organizations through risk management, resilience building, and secure digital transformation. A former Security Operations Manager and Information Security Officer at the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus, Chris advanced healthcare cybersecurity through cloud frameworks, compliance alignment, and secure application design. A certified SANS instructor, he mentors professionals, contributes to the security community, and champions best practices in vulnerability and patch management.

bio: Michael Sentonas serves as President of CrowdStrike, overseeing product and go-to-market functions, including sales, marketing, product & engineering, threat intelligence, privacy & policy, corporate development, corporate strategy, and the CTO teams. A 20+ year cybersecurity veteran, he is a recognized authority on security and the evolving threat landscape, frequently speaking at industry events and advising governments and company boards. Since joining CrowdStrike in 2016, he has held leadership roles as VP of Technology Strategy and CTO. Previously, he held multiple executive roles at McAfee.

bio: Dan Harif is the CISO at Vale and works to turn security into trust and complexity into clear execution. With 30+ years in technology and security, he balances protection with business speed, focusing on critical mining operations (OT/ICS), privacy, and resilience. He leads the responsible adoption of AI, reduces control friction, and promotes a culture grounded in safe behavior. People first and pragmatic, he translates risk into board level decisions and outcomes that enable sustainable business performance.

bio: Matthias Frielingsdorf is the Co-Founder and VP of Research at iVerify. With over a decade of experience, Matthias has focused on understanding iOS exploitation and malware development. His achievements include his work on iOS threat research, discovering and analyzing a new Pegasus sample in 2023, security solutions for mobile devices at Deutsche Bahn, and testing mobile security products for T-Systems. Matthias has conducted extensive research on iOS exploits and malware detections, regularly presenting his findings at conferences such as BlackHat, OBTS, and LabsCon. He is also a sought-after trainer in detecting commercial spyware on iOS, conducting training sessions at both private and public seminars. Beyond his professional pursuits, Matthias enjoys playing basketball and hiking.

bio: Hans de Vries is the Chief Cybersecurity and Operations Officer (COO) at the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA) since April 2024. He provides guidance and direction on the Agency’s operations activities and strategically advises the Executive Director. Hans represents ENISA in the NIS Cooperation Group, the European Cyber Crisis Liaison Organisation Network (EU-CyCLONe), and the CSIRTs Network, composed of CSIRTs appointed by EU Member States and CERT- EU. His primary focus is the NIS2 implementation in the EU Member States strengthening the current state of cybersecurity in Europe. He was the Director of the Dutch National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC-NL), a Member of the ENISA Management and Executive Board, and one of the main organizational forces of The Hague’s ‘ONE Conference.

bio: Lorrie Faith Cranor is Director and Bosch Distinguished Professor of the CyLab Security and Privacy Institute and FORE Systems University Professor of Computer Science and of Engineering and Public Policy at Carnegie Mellon University. She directs the CyLab Usable Privacy and Security Laboratory (CUPS) and co-directs the Privacy Engineering program. In 2016 she served as Chief Technologist at the US Federal Trade Commission. She co-founded Wombat Security Technologies. She is a fellow of the ACM, IEEE, and AAAS; a member of the ACM CHI Academy; and the author of a children's book about privacy.
companyName: Carnegie Mellon University, CyLab Security & Privacy Inst.

bio: David DiMolfetta is a reporter for GovExec’s Nextgov/FCW covering US federal cybersecurity and intelligence policy. His coverage focuses on how the US government—including the White House, executive branch agencies, the intelligence community, and private sector government contractors—work to combat hacking threats from nation-state adversaries and cybercrime groups, as well as the legal, regulatory, and personnel challenges that present themselves along the way.

bio: Boaz Gelbord is SVP and Chief Security Officer at Akamai, where he leads the global Information Security organization. He is responsible for leading cybersecurity, regulatory compliance, and protecting Akamai’s systems, data, employees, and the world’s leading intelligent edge platform across more than 4,000 locations in 135 countries. Boaz joined Akamai in 2021 and brings over 15 years of global experience building and leading security teams including as CISO of Bloomberg and Dun and Bradstreet. He holds a BSc in Mathematics from the University of Calgary, an MSc from the University of Toronto, and a PhD in Mathematics from the Technion in Israel. Boaz has authored multiple security-related patents and speaks English, Hebrew, Dutch, French, and Spanish.
globalBio: Boaz Gelbord is SVP and Chief Security Officer at Akamai, where he leads the global Information Security organization. He is responsible for leading cybersecurity, regulatory compliance, and protecting Akamai’s systems, data, employees, and the world’s leading intelligent edge platform across more than 4,000 locations in 135 countries. Boaz joined Akamai in 2021 and brings over 15 years of global experience building and leading security teams including as CISO of Bloomberg and Dun and Bradstreet. He holds a BSc in Mathematics from the University of Calgary, an MSc from the University of Toronto, and a PhD in Mathematics from the Technion in Israel. Boaz has authored multiple security-related patents and speaks English, Hebrew, Dutch, French, and Spanish.

bio: Rich Mogull is a multi-decade cloud security veteran, currently the Chief Analyst of the CSA and an IANS Faculty member. He has over 25 years of security experience and currently specializes in cloud security, DevSecOps, and AI with extensive hands-on technical and strategic advisory experience. He is also the Principal Course Designer of the Cloud Security Alliance training class, primary Author of the latest version of the "CSA Security Guidance," and actively works on developing hands-on cloud security techniques. Prior to joining the CSA, he founded Securosis and DisruptOps and was a Research Vice President at Gartner on the security team.

bio: Ilona Cohen is the Chief Legal and Policy Officer at HackerOne, Inc., a leader in AI red teaming, security, and safety. Ilona was formerly a Senior Lawyer to President Obama and served as General Counsel of the White House Office of Management and Budget (OMB), where she helped shape the federal government’s cybersecurity policies. At HackerOne, Ilona uses her experience to advise government and industry on strong cybersecurity and AI regulation and law.

At HackerOne, Ilona uses her experience to advise government and industry on strong cybersecurity and AI regulation and law.

bio: A leading expert in cybersecurity policy after working in the UK Government’s cybersecurity directorate for over eight years, Edward Venmore-Rowland currently serves as Head of AI Cyber Security Policy. In that role, he has led a global consultation, research, and the development of a Code of Practice and Implementation Guide which have now informed a global standard that sets baseline security requirements for AI.

bio: Joshua Corman is the Founder of I Am The Cavalry, a grassroots organization focused on the intersection of digital security, public safety, and human life. He was formerly Chief Strategist of CISA's COVID Task Force, where he advised on the pandemic response, provided cybersecurity expertise on healthcare infrastructure, and supported control systems and life safety initiatives. Prior to CISA, Josh was SVP and Chief Security Officer at PTC, where he accelerated cyber safety maturity across industries. Previously, he served as Director of the Atlantic Council's Cyber Statecraft Initiative, on the Congressional Task Force for Healthcare Industry Cybersecurity, and in leadership roles at Sonatype, Akamai, IBM, and the 451 Group.

bio: Keith Wojcieszek is a noted authority on cyber and intelligence topics, leading FTI Consulting’s cyber threat intelligence function. He advises on cyber investigations, intellectual property theft, data breaches, computer intrusions, account fraud, money-laundering, and employee misconduct, using complex methodologies to provide findings to counsel and executives. Before FTI, he founded a global cyber threat intelligence program at an advisory firm, managing cybercrime, data loss, and incident response investigations. As a certified expert witness, he is often invited to speak as a thought leader. Joining the US Secret Service in 2002, he led the Cyber Intelligence Section, managing national responses to protect the financial infrastructure of the US.

bio: As the National Managing Principal, Doug Barbin is responsible for the strategy, development, growth, and delivery of Schellman’s global services portfolio. Since joining in 2009, his primary focus has been to expand the strong foundation in IT audit and assurance to make Schellman a market leading diversified cybersecurity and compliance services provider. He has developed many of Schellman's service offerings, served global clients, and now focuses on leading and supporting the service delivery professionals, practice leaders, and the business development teams. Doug brings more than 27 years’ experience in technology focused services having served as technology product management executive, mortgage firm CTO/COO, and fraud and computer forensic investigations leader.

bio: James Stanger is Chief Technology Evangelist at CompTIA. He works with technologists, hiring managers, CIOs, CISOs, and educators worldwide. James has worked as a cloud services administrator, security analyst, penetration tester, Linux systems administrator, and network administrator. Organizations he has consulted with include Mandiant, AWS, Target, the University of Cambridge, the United States Department of Defense, Netflix, Northrop Grumman, and Microsoft. He is also an award-winning author, blogger, and presenter. James has helped design, manage, and deliver education programs in topics as diverse as security analytics, web development, Linux, kayaking, and British Romantic literature. He lives and plays in the Puget Sound area in the United States.

bio: Charles Nwatu is a security engineering leader with over 15 years of experience scaling programs at Netflix, Stitch Fix, Twilio, and LinkedIn. Currently Head of Security and Compliance at Delve, he specializes in "GRC Engineering"—the practice of integrating risk management into developer workflows through automation and DevOps principles. Charles is a frequent speaker on security culture, empathy in leadership, and building trust between engineering and security teams. His work focuses on transforming GRC from a reactive function into a proactive business enabler. Charles shares insights on navigating complex risk landscapes and scaling security in high-growth, innovative technology environments.

bio: DJ Jablanski leads STV’s operational technology (OT) cybersecurity consulting program, advising clients in security program development, strategy, tool selection, and deployment to mitigate cybersecurity threats facing operational technology and cyber-physical environments across transportation, energy, water, and infrastructure projects. Formerly a SME in the Office of the Technical Director at CISA, DJ developed OT and industrial control systems (ICS) strategy for cybersecurity division. In 2022 DJ joined the Atlantic Council as a non-resident fellow, focusing on operational technology and workforce development issues. She is also an adjunct professor, who enjoys teaching Intro to ICS cybersecurity at Dallas College and Cyber-Physical Defense at the Middlebury Institute.
globalBio: DJ Jablanski leads STV’s operational technology (OT) cybersecurity consulting program, advising clients in security program development, strategy, tool selection, and deployment to mitigate cybersecurity threats facing operational technology and cyber-physical environments across transportation, energy, water, and infrastructure projects. In 2022 DJ joined the Atlantic Council as a non-resident fellow, focusing on operational technology and workforce development issues. She is also an adjunct professor, who enjoys teaching Intro to ICS cybersecurity at Dallas College and Cyber-Physical Defense at the Middlebury Institute.

bio: Bryan Vorndran is Microsoft's Deputy CISO, where he is responsible for securing the company's global supply chains. He leads the initiative to protect Microsoft's vast third-party ecosystem, which includes hardware, software, and human elements. Before joining Microsoft, Bryan was the Assistant Director of the FBI's Cyber Division.

bio: Katie Noble is a proven cybersecurity leader with over 15 years of experience spanning national security, intelligence operations, and the private sector. She currently serves as a Director of Product Security Incident Response and Bug Bounty. She is a passionate community activist, Katie is a long-standing CVE Program Board member, Bug Bounty Community of Interest Founding member, and Hacking Policy Council Member, she is driven by positive progress in cyber defense through collaborative initiatives. Prior to her private sector role, she held key positions in the US Government. Katie is recognized for her expertise in incident response, vulnerability disclosure, and emerging technology risk mitigation, and is a trusted advisor to international stakeholders.

bio: Russ Schafer has more than 25 years of success driving growth as a marketing executive at large billion-dollar companies and high growth startups in security, SaaS, enterprise software, semiconductor, media, and advertising industries. In his role at Fortinet, Russ leads corporate marketing including product marketing, corporate brand initiatives, demand generation, campaigns, marketing operations, analyst relations, US field marketing, and creative services. Prior to working at Fortinet, Russ was Head of Product Marketing and Analyst Relations at a cybersecurity firm. Before his time there, Russ was SVP and GM of Technology at THX. Earlier in his career, Russ held a range of key senior leadership roles at AOL, Yahoo!, Intel, and IBM.

bio: Geoff Brown is CEO of Silobreaker, an intelligence technology company that for twenty years has developed and delivered advanced analytics and workflow through AI to help confront the security challenges of Fortune 100 clients and Western governments. He held previous executive positions with incident response and managed service provider Arete, and with intelligence platform provider Recorded Future. Between 2016 and 2022, Geoff was Chief Information Security Officer for the City of New York and founding Director of New York City's own cybersecurity agency, NYC Cyber Command.

bio: Bill O’Connell is responsible for Commvault’s cyber defense, product security, and customer assurance, further strengthening the company’s presence as a trusted innovator and partner for today’s evolving threat landscape. Bill has over 20 years of expertise in cybersecurity and data privacy. As Head of Product Security at Roche, Bill led a team of cybersecurity experts delivering secure medical technology, digital health, and solutions on-premises and in the cloud across care settings. In his 12 years at ADP, Bill led a variety of business risk, privacy, and security operations, including five years as Chief Business Security Officer. Prior to joining ADP, Bill worked for Deloitte, building and executing strategic information security roadmaps for global Fortune 500 firms.

bio: Dave Scott serves as a Managing Director in EY’s Forensic & Integrity Services practice, helping clients navigate and manage complex investigations, crisis, and emerging technology risk. Dave retired from the Federal Bureau of Investigation as the Assistant Director overseeing the Counterterrorism Division. He previously served as the FBI’s Deputy Assistant Director for Cyber Operations, Director of the National Cyber Investigative Joint Task Force, and Special Agent in Charge of the Criminal & Cyber Division of the Washington Field Office. Prior to the FBI, Dave was an Infantry officer in the US Army.

bio: Brian Hale is Vice President at Booz Allen, leading the Reputation and Impact team. He oversees public relations strategies, serves as spokesperson, manages media inquiries, and builds relationships with key stakeholders. Previously, he was Managing Director at FTI Consulting, investigating cybersecurity matters. In government, he led the FBI Public Affairs Division and directed public affairs teams at ODNI, and DHS, providing strategic communications and crisis counsel.

bio: Arie Olshtein is a Malware Researcher with deep expertise in threat detection and adversary behavior. His work focuses on disrupting large-scale Malware-as-a-Service operations by identifying attacks in their early stages before a malicious payload is executed. He has published technical analyses on stealthy loaders, including "TrickGate and GuLoader," and has contributed to the MITRE ATT&CK framework. His recent research focuses on passkey abuse and cloud-based authenticators, continuing his early-stage prevention approach to stay ahead of one of today’s leading threats: credential stealers. Arie has presented at industry conferences and actively collaborates with the security community on threat intelligence and prevention efforts.

bio: Joe Petrocelli currently serves as Vice President of Communications Services at AT&T, a role held since February 2025. Prior to this position, Joe held the title of Vice President of Product Management at Qualys and Senior Director of Product Management at Tenable, where leadership involved overseeing Core Applications, Research Product Management, and UX teams that managed over $400 million in annual product revenue. Joe's experience also includes a Director of Product Management role at McAfee, leading the Security Management PM team and driving security solutions for a wide range of customers. Joe's earlier career includes roles at AT&T, the United States Department of Defense, BAE Systems, and HP Enterprise Services.

bio: Jessica Colvin is the Global head of Cyber Security Operations at Citi. Responsible for all cyber operations, she oversees Security Operations Centers, Offensive Security & Vulnerability Management, Cyber Fusion Centers, Operational strategy, and CISO Industry partnerships. Jessica joined Citi in 2022 as Head of Cyber Fusion overseeing Citi's Cyber Security Fusion teams, where she spearheaded a multi-year transformation program that modernized cyber fusion operations and firmwide vulnerability management. Prior to joining Citi, Jessica spent 17 years at JPMorgan Chase where her career spanned across the Global Technology and the CISO organizations.

bio: Jinseo Lee is a PhD student in Computer Science at KAIST. His research focuses on secure and open communication on the Internet, with an emphasis on analyzing protocols to identify vulnerabilities that compromise user privacy. His primary interests include network security and privacy, anonymity networks, Internet measurements, and censorship and surveillance.

His research focuses on secure and open communication on the Internet, with an emphasis on analyzing protocols to identify vulnerabilities that compromise user privacy. His primary interests include network security and privacy, anonymity networks, Internet measurements, and censorship and surveillance.

bio: Dr. Valerie Lyons serves on the advisory board of CeADAR Irelands National Centre for AI, and has 3 decades of experience as a senior cybersecurity and privacy leader. Currently she serves as Board Director, and Chief Operations Officer at BH Consulting, a data protection and cybersecurity firm based in Ireland. She was included in Europe's top 100 women in cybersecurity and is a member of the European Data Protection Board's pool of experts. She also lectures on cybersecurity, privacy, and ethics in several Irish academic institutions. Valerie holds an award-winning PhD in organizational approaches to Information Privacy, Ethics and CSR. She is also author of the best-selling book The Privacy Leader Compass.

bio: Jon-Michael C. Brook is a certified, 25+ year practitioner of cybersecurity, cloud, and privacy. He is the principal contributor to certification sites for privacy and cloud security and has published books on privacy. Jon-Michael received numerous awards and recognition during his time with Raytheon, Northrop Grumman, Symantec, and Starbucks. He holds patents and trade secrets in intrusion detection, GUI design, and semantic data redaction. He is recognized as a Research Fellow with the Cloud Security Alliance and currently co-chairs the CSA’s Top Threats to Cloud Security and Enterprise Architecture Working Groups. Jon-Michael is a certified trainer for the CSA's Cloud Security (CCSK+) and Cloud Governance (CGC), teaching the CCSK+ training at RSAC, Black Hat, and ISC2 conferences.

bio: Sriram Santhanam is a senior cybersecurity and identity leader with more than two decades of experience building and scaling enterprise security programs across cloud and complex hybrid environments. He has led initiatives protecting large global workforces, partners, and millions of customers. His expertise spans workforce identity, access governance, and the growing challenge of securing non-human identities across automation and AI ecosystems. Sriram brings a pragmatic, operator-first perspective on governing identity at scale in the AI era.

bio: Jeff Pollard primarily contributes to Forrester's offerings for security and risk professionals. He leads Forrester’s research on the role of the CISO, specializing in topics related to security strategy, budgets, metrics, business cases, and presenting to the board. His research also includes security services, featuring global coverage of managed security services, professional security services, and security-as-a-service. Jeff also takes an active role in Forrester’s forward-looking research on security innovation, the security market, and security predictions.

bio: Madison Oliver is a vulnerability transparency advocate and Senior Security Manager at GitHub, leading the advisory database team. She is passionate about vulnerability reporting, response, and disclosure, and co-chairs the relevant Open Source Security Foundation (OpenSSF) working group and serves on the CVE Program Board. Her views are enriched by her prior experience as a Product Incident Response Analyst at GitHub and as a Vulnerability Coordinator at the CERT Coordination Center at the Software Engineering Institute at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU).

bio: Kevin Kennedy is VP of Product Marketing for Cisco Security. He works with product management and engineering on security platform strategy and architecture, focusing on how AI is reshaping the threat landscape and security. With two decades in cybersecurity product leadership, Kevin has helped define markets like secure web gateway and network detection and response. Before Cisco, he was SVP of Products at Vectra AI, shaping the NDR category with AI. He also led product at Agari and held senior roles at Juniper Networks and Cisco. He enjoys cooking, cycling, and toddler-proofing.

bio: Andrew McClure is a Managing Director at Forgepoint and invests in early stage and growth stage companies that protect the digital world. He currently serves on the Board at Constella Intelligence, Converge Insurance, CyberCube Analytics, Hyperproof, and Surefire Cyber. He was previously on the Board at Prevoty (acquired by Imperva), BehavioSec (acq. by LexisNexis), Cysiv (acq. by ForeScout), and WireWheel (acq. by Osano). Andrew has led several spinout investments for Forgepoint and has incubated two companies within the firm. Earlier in his career, Andrew served as an Intelligence Officer in the US Marine Corps, where he led teams in Afghanistan, the Middle East, East Africa, and Australia focused on signals intelligence and cyber operations. He remains affiliated in the Marine Reserves.

bio: A native of White Bear Lake, MN, Paul M. Nakasone is the Founding Director of Vanderbilt University's Institute of National Security, focused on building the next generation of leaders with the knowledge, skills, and abilities to succeed in a dynamic security environment. Paul served for more than three decades in the United States Army, including nearly six years as the Commander of US Cyber Command and the Director of the National Security Agency.

bio: Kandyce Young is a Principal Technical Product Manager for the PCI Security Standards Council where she spearheads the strategic roadmap, providing direction and thought leadership to drive the evolution of the Data and Environment Product family, which includes PCI DSS, while overseeing all of its global initiatives. This includes regular global engagements with key PCI SSC stakeholder groups. Prior to this strategic role, Kandyce worked on the development of PCI DSS v4 and its supporting materials for five years. Before joining the Council in 2019, Ms. Young was an Internal Security Assessor (ISA) for a large data transmission and storage organization. Kandyce holds the CISM, CISSP, and PMP designations.

This includes regular global engagements with key PCI SSC stakeholder groups. Prior to this strategic role, Kandyce worked on the development of PCI DSS v4 and its supporting materials for five years. Before joining the Council in 2019, Ms. Young was an Internal Security Assessor (ISA) for a large data transmission and storage organization. Kandyce holds the CISM, CISSP, and PMP designations.

bio: Keatron Evans is VP of AI Enablement and Strategy at Cengage, leading a portfolio spanning Higher Education, Workforce Development and Trades into an AI-first organization. With 20+ years as an AI pioneer, cybersecurity expert and intelligence-sector innovator, he drives AI strategy, governance and enablement across workforce operations and product innovation. He holds pending patents for AI-powered systems leveraging behavioral intelligence, computer vision and generative AI to reimagine talent assessment and learning at scale. An AWS-certified Generative AI SME, Founding Member of an AI firm that built offensive cybersecurity tools for US Intelligence and Author of Chained Exploits: Advanced Hacking Attacks from Start to Finish, Keatron is a sought-after speaker and trusted media expert.

bio: Heather Barnhart is a forensic expert of choice for law enforcement and intelligence agencies. She has worked on high profile cases from child exploitation, Osama Bin Laden’s digital media, and led the digital forensics effort in the Idaho Murders investigation. Her book series, Practical Mobile Forensics, is a best-selling guide to mobile forensics. As a Faculty Fellow, she leads the Smartphone Forensic Analysis In-Depth and Windows Forensic Analysis courses and is Head of Faculty and the DFIR curriculum lead at SANS. As a Senior Forensic Expert, Heather consults for Cellebrite supporting the CTF, forensic research, case support, and the annual C2C Summit. "Nothing compares to knowing that the effort you put into developing and teaching a course makes the world a better and safer place.”

bio: The Right Honourable Dame Jacinda Ardern served as the 40th Prime Minister of New Zealand. Assuming office at just 37, she championed an inclusive and empathetic leadership style that made bold policy change and successfully guided her nation through unprecedented global and domestic challenges. Responding with a people-first approach grounded in kindness, she helped New Zealand achieve one of the lowest losses of life during the pandemic among developed nations, instituted a ban on military-style semi-automatic weapons, and created the Christchurch Call to Eliminate Violent Extremism Online, for which she remains an active Patron. In 2024, Ms. Ardern founded Field, a first of its kind fellowship programme that fosters empathetic leadership in politics.
fullName: The Rt. Hon. Dame Jacinda Ardern

bio: Michael Wylie, MBA, CISSP, is a seasoned cybersecurity leader and author who leads Threat Hunting at Zscaler. He previously served as the Director of Threat Hunting at CrowdStrike and as Director of Cybersecurity Services at a prominent consulting firm, where he built and scaled DFIR and proactive hunting operations from the ground up. Michael's extensive background in technical education—including developing courses for the US Department of Defense and teaching at universities—equips him with a unique ability to translate complex threat hunting concepts into actionable insights for experienced professionals. His perspective is rooted in real-world incidents, offering a valuable blend of strategic leadership and tactical expertise.

bio: Mayana Wanderley Pereira is a Director at Capital One, where she leads the research and development of privacy-enhancing technologies with a focus on differential privacy. A recognized expert in the field and a two-time speaker at RSAC Conference, she is the Author of "Hands-On Differential Privacy" (O'Reilly). Her research has been published in prestigious venues such as ICML, Science Advances, and IEEE Transactions. Her work is centered on applying machine learning and privacy-preserving techniques to solve critical, real-world problems, with past projects including the development of applications for digital safety, cybersecurity, and software security.

bio: Jeroen Vandeleur is a seasoned security professional with an edge in security architecture and technology integrations within large environments. At Proximus NXT, he applies over 15 years of cybersecurity experience to offer advanced blueprints that cater to specific challenges, advising on evasion, detection, and response to cyberthreats. Jeroen is also a distinguished SANS Author and Instructor for the "AI and Security Automation for Red, Blue, and Purple Teams" course. His profound knowledge of security architecture, cloud integration, and incident handling positions him as an expert in adversary emulation and purple teaming. Passionate about elevating SOC operations via innovative automation and Gen AI, Jeroen continually strives to be at the forefront of his field.

bio: Gadalia is the founder and CEO of Dapple Security. She served as a cryptomathematician at the National Security Agency (NSA) for nearly a decade, and has built a successful career as a senior technology leader, operator, founder and investor, specializing in security and data technologies that transform business, impact mission, and create change in the world. Gadalia has a graduate degree in Mathematics from UCLA and invests in fostering entrepreneurship and interest in STEM fields, increasing equity and representation in technology, and using technology for good.

bio: Francis deSouza is the Chief Operating Officer and President, Security Products at Google Cloud, where he leads strategic operations and the company’s world-class security portfolio across products, threat intelligence, consulting, and governance. He joined Google in 2025 after three decades as an engineer, technology executive, security expert, entrepreneur, board member, and investor. Prior to Google, Francis was the CEO of Illumina, where he led the company's growth and innovation in DNA sequencing. He also served as President at Symantec, overseeing their security and data management portfolio. Francis also co-founded several companies including IMlogic (an IT security company acquired by Symantec), and Flash Communications (an instant messaging company acquired by Microsoft).

He also served as President at Symantec, overseeing their security and data management portfolio. bio: Deepak Behal, Information Security Officer at Capital One, has more than two decades of experience in cybersecurity across telecom and financial industry. He is regular speaker on industry conferences. His areas of expertise include cryptographic protocols and advanced encryption techniques; AI-driven threats and advanced cyber defense mechanisms, protecting critical infrastructure from emerging threats, identity and access management, threat modeling, defining security policies; technical hardening standards, solution design, implementation and testing of cybersecurity controls, security architecture reviews, security risk assessments, incident management, and vulnerability management. Prior to joining Capital One, Deepak worked in multinational organizations including Nokia and T-Mobile.

bio: Ayoub Fandi is a Staff Security Assurance Engineer and Security Assurance Automation Team Lead at GitLab. He's also the creator of the "GRC Engineer," a podcast and newsletter dedicated to pushing the GRC engineering revolution forward. He's the Co-Author of the "grc.engineering Manifesto" and has experience working with GRC leaders and vendors to infuse GRC Engineering principles into their practice and products.

bio: Wouter Joosen is full professor at the Department of Computer Science of KU Leuven in Belgium, where he is heading the DistriNet research group. Wouter teaches courses on secure software and application security, distributed systems, and the engineering of secure service platforms. He's a director of Flanders' Cybersecurity Research Program, and founder of multiple security ventures.

bio: Aaron Turner is a three-decade veteran of the cybersecurity industry. From his days as a penetration tester in the 1990s to helping found many of Microsoft's cybersecurity programs, he saw firsthand how the lack of attention to cybersecurity in product development and technology deployment projects put users and data at risk. He has helped design and deploy a wide variety of identity and access systems in over 90 countries around the world, from standard enterprise deployments to critical infrastructure and government systems. He has been an IANS Research Faculty member since 2006 and has helped train tens of thousands of cybersecurity professionals at IANS events and RSAC Conference sessions, attending RSAC Conference since 2000.

He has helped design and deploy a wide variety of identity and access systems in over 90 countries around the world, from standard enterprise deployments to critical infrastructure and government systems. He has been an IANS Research Faculty member since 2006 and has helped train tens of thousands of cybersecurity professionals at IANS events and RSAC Conference sessions, attending RSAC Conference since 2000.

bio: Ken Huang is a leading author and expert in AI applications and agentic AI security, serving as CEO and Chief AI Officer at DistributedApps.ai. He is Co-Chair of AI Safety groups at the Cloud Security Alliance and the OWASP AIVSS project, and Co-Chair of the AI STR Working Group at the World Digital Technology Academy. An Adjunct Professor at the University of San Francisco, he co-authored "OWASP's Top 10 for LLM Applications" and contributes to the NIST Generative AI Public Working Group. He has written books with Springer, Cambridge, Wiley, Packt, and China Machine Press, including "Generative AI Security," "Agentic AI Theories and Practices," and "Securing AI Agents." A frequent global speaker, he engages at major technology and policy forums.

bio: Jamil N. Jaffer is a Venture Partner at Paladin Capital, where he leads work on defense tech, invests in cybersecurity companies, and serves on the Board of RangeForce and as a Board Observer for Steg.AI. Jamil is also the Founder & Executive Director of the National Security Institute and NSI’s Cyber & Tech Center at GMU Law and serves on the VA Governor’s Task Force on AI, the board of the National Cryptologic Foundation, the advisory board of US Strategic Metals, and is affiliated with Stanford University. Jamil also previously served on DHS’s Cyber Safety Review Board, as an SVP at IronNet Cybersecurity, and on leadership team/senior staff of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, House Intelligence Committee, and DOJ’s National Security Division, as well as in the Bush White House.
globalBio: Jamil N. Jaffer is a Venture Partner at Paladin Capital, where he leads work on defense tech, invests in cybersecurity companies, and serves on the Board of RangeForce and as a Board Observer for Steg.AI. Jamil is also the Founder & Executive Director of the National Security Institute and NSI’s Cyber & Tech Center at GMU Law and serves on the VA Governor’s Task Force on AI, the board of the National Cryptologic Foundation, the advisory board of US Strategic Metals, and is affiliated with Stanford University. Jamil also previously served on DHS’s Cyber Safety Review Board, as an SVP at IronNet Cybersecurity, and on leadership team/senior staff of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, House Intelligence Committee, and DOJ’s National Security Division, as well as in the Bush White House.

bio: Roland Yap is an Associate Professor in the School of Computing, National University of Singapore. He obtained his PhD from Monash University. His research interests are in Cybersecurity particularly in bug finding, defensive technologies, and malware. Other research interests include AI, Big Data, Programming Languages, and Social Networks. He is particularly interested in defensive technologies with notable works in the area of state-of-art memory safety defenses. Where source code is available, sanitizer defenses such as LowFat and EffectiveSan. For closed-source binaries without source code, binary hardening defenses include RedFat and FRP (Fully Randomized Pointers). He is also well known for work in Programming Languages.

bio: Andréanne Bergeron is a Cybersecurity Researcher at Flare and specializes in the behavior of online attackers. Her expertise lies at the intersection of criminology and cybersecurity. Andréanne is also an Affiliate Professor in the Department of Criminology at the Université de Montréal, bridging the gap between academia and industry. Involved in the community, she serves as a Vice President on the NorthSec organizing committee. Andréanne has presented her research at prestigious conferences such as BlackHat USA, Defcon, and ShmooCon.

bio: Christiaan Beek is Vice President of Cyber Intelligence at Rapid7, where he leads global threat intelligence, advanced research, and strategic detection initiatives. With over two decades of experience, he specializes in nation-state operations, advanced adversary tradecraft, and AI-driven security risks. A patent holder in threat detection innovation, Christiaan has built large-scale intelligence platforms and pioneered novel approaches to vulnerability and attack analysis. He is a trusted advisor to enterprises and government agencies worldwide, and a frequent international speaker and author on cyber espionage, emerging threats, and defensive innovation.

bio: Lisa Olson is a Principal Security Release Program Manager at Microsoft, where she has led the Patch Tuesday release process since 2013. A Member of the CVE Board since 2018, Lisa is a passionate advocate for improving vulnerability communication through automation and machine-readable formats. Her work focuses on transforming how security information is shared to help organizations respond faster and more effectively.

bio: Christopher Ganas is the Director of Product Security at Palo Alto Networks. He provides security engineering leadership across the product portfolio, heading the company's Deep Product Security Research team, and driving the cyber resilient product strategy to protect customers from advanced threats. An expert in secure coding and incident response, Christopher has extensive experience managing Product Security Incident Response Teams and leading 0-day vulnerability responses. He has helped shape both CVSS and PSIRT standards through his work with the Forum of Incident Response and Security Teams. A security researcher at heart, he honed his technical skills leading the renowned Plaid Parliament of Pwning CTF hacking team. He holds a BS in Computer Science from Carnegie Mellon University

bio: Nadir Izrael guides the technology vision for Armis. Drawing from his deep programming and software engineering expertise, he has overseen the rapid evolution of the Armis Cyber Exposure Management Platform. Nadir Co-Founded Armis in 2015 with his friend and army colleague, Yevgeny Dibrov, after the two started looking for new and interesting problems to solve in technology. Prior to founding Armis, Nadir spent four years as a Senior Software Manager at Google, working on Google Maps and Google Autocomplete. He began his career in the Israel Defense Forces in the elite Unit 8200 intelligence corps where he served first as a Software Developer and then as a team leader, ultimately achieving the rank of Captain.

bio:
Mitendra Mahto is an engineering leader with over 20 years of experience building large-scale distributed systems and security infrastructure. At LinkedIn, he leads initiatives in schema modeling, developer experience, and traffic infrastructure, with a focus on resilience, compliance, and secure system design.
He has deep expertise in reverse proxies, service discovery, and load balancing, having operated edge infrastructure serving billions of requests daily. Mitendra is also the author of several technical publications and articles on reverse proxy architecture. With a career spanning hands-on systems engineering to organizational leadership, he brings a unique perspective on bridging technical depth with strategic vision.

bio: Anna Pham (@RussianPanda) is a Senior Hunt & Response Analyst at Huntress, with previous experience at leading cybersecurity vendors, consulting firms, and MSSPs. A GREM-certified malware researcher and previous speaker at RSAC Conference and Virus Bulletin, she specializes in reverse engineering different malware families and threat research. Anna actively contributes to LummaLabs and The DFIR Report and writes detection rules and open source tools for the security community.

bio: Sarah Mader is a Senior Consultant at NVISO, with a focus on Red Team Assessments. Complementing her cybersecurity experience, she has developed proficiency in operational technology (OT) assessments and continues to specialize further in this area.​ She possesses a Master's degree in Applied IT Security, which has been enriched by her diverse experiences in cybersecurity roles across various companies.​ In addition to her professional work, Sarah is dedicated to contributing to the community by leading workshops and delivering presentations at industry conferences.​

Complementing her cybersecurity experience, she has developed proficiency in operational technology (OT) assessments and continues to specialize further in this area.​ She possesses a Master's degree in Applied IT Security, which has been enriched by her diverse experiences in cybersecurity roles across various companies.​ In addition to her professional work, Sarah is dedicated to contributing to the community by leading workshops and delivering presentations at industry conferences.​

bio: Sandra is a cybersecurity leader with 26 years of intelligence experience. She leads Google Threat Intelligence and joined Google in 2022, following Google’s acquisition of Mandiant. Sandra is a retired U.S. Air Force Reserve officer and serves as a faculty member and on the Board of Visitors at the National Intelligence University. She is a member of the Aspen Institute Cybersecurity Working Group, the strategic council of the Silverado Policy Accelerator, and the Institute for Security and Technology’s Ransomware Task Force Steering Committee. Sandra is also a visiting fellow at the National Security Institute, and joined the Board of Directors at Crane NXT. Sandra is pursuing her PhD at Johns Hopkins University. She has an MBA from MIT.

bio: Michael Leland joined Island in October 2024 as Field CTO, bringing over 30 years of data networking, operations, and cybersecurity domain expertise. He formerly served as Head of Technical Marketing and Chief Cybersecurity Evangelist at SentinelOne where he was responsible for messaging and strategic development of their XDR product roadmap as well as the identity security portfolio. Prior to SentinelOne he held the title of Chief Technical Strategist for McAfee. Michael was the Co-Founder and CTO of NitroSecurity – later acquired by McAfee - where he was responsible for developing and implementing their overall SIEM technology vision and roadmap and has held senior technical management positions at Cabletron and Avaya.

bio: Robert Lipovsky is a Principal Threat Intelligence Researcher for ESET, with over 15 years' experience in cybersecurity and a broad spectrum of expertise covering both targeted APTs and crimeware. He is responsible for threat intelligence and malware analysis and leads the Malware Research Team at ESET headquarters in Bratislava. He is a regular speaker at security conferences, including RSAC Conference, Black Hat USA, Virus Bulletin, BlueHat, MITRE ATT&CKcon, Gartner Security & Risk Management Summit, and various NATO-organized conferences. He also teaches reverse engineering at the Slovak University of Technology – his alma mater – and at Comenius University. When not bound to a keyboard, he enjoys traveling, playing guitar, and flying single-engine airplanes.

bio: Jeetu Patel is Cisco’s President and Chief Product Officer, leading global product vision and strategy. Under his leadership, Cisco has driven innovation across its portfolio, establishing the company as critical infrastructure for the AI era. Patel joined Cisco in 2020 to lead collaboration and security, transforming Webex and supporting customers during the pandemic. Promoted to Chief Product Officer in 2024, he now oversees networking, computing, security, Splunk, and more. He’s held senior roles at Box, EMC, and Doculabs, serves on JLL’s board, and holds a B.S. from the University of Illinois, Chicago.

bio: TJ White presently serves as the Chief, Texas Cyber Command (TXCC). In this capacity, he is responsible for securing, protecting, and defending Texas and Texans from cyber incidents.  He is also charged with posturing to prevent cyber incidents and promote Texas’s cyber readiness and resiliency. Prior to serving with TXCC, he was a national security practitioner with over 35 years of experience as a strategist and cyber operations expert leading joint military formations and combined intelligence community organizations. He commanded at all levels within the Navy and Joint Force, most recently as the Commander, United States Fleet Cyber Command/United States TENTH Fleet/United States Navy Space Command and previously as the Commander, United States Cyber National Mission Force/USCYBERCOM.

bio: Kang Wang is a Staff Security Engineer on the security research team of the Alibaba Group. He received his BSc from Tsinghua University. Proudly worked with TUNA. He is a four-time speaker at Black Hat. He also delivers talks in Virus Bulletin '18, HITB Dubai '18, and Authenticate Con '23, '24, and '25. He shared his open source project at FOSDEM 2024.

bio: Jen Easterly is the CEO of RSAC, leading its global portfolio, including its annual flagship conference and emerging professional membership platform. A cybersecurity pioneer, combat veteran, and national security expert, she brings decades of leadership experience across the public and private sectors and a relentless focus on people, mission, and community. Jen previously served as Director of the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency, the Head of Firm Resilience at Morgan Stanley, and in senior roles at the National Security Agency. A West Point graduate and Rhodes Scholar, Jen is a two-time recipient of the Bronze Star and the George C. Marshall Award in Ethical Leadership. She’s a proud mom, mental health advocate, Rubik's Cuber, and aspiring electric guitarist.

bio: Yaroslav Rosomakho is Chief Scientist at Zscaler, where he leads research and strategy across emerging technologies, secure networking, and cryptographic protocols. He is an active contributor to the IETF, participating in working groups focused on TLS, QUIC, HTTP, and secure transport. Yaroslav has a background in building large-scale security systems and has held leadership roles at Netskope and Arbor Networks. He is passionate about bridging deep technical insight with practical deployment strategies.
globalBio: Yaroslav Rosomakho is Chief Scientist at Zscaler, where he leads research and strategy across emerging technologies, secure networking, and cryptographic protocols. He is an active contributor to the IETF, participating in working groups focused on TLS, QUIC, HTTP, and secure transport. Yaroslav has a background in building large-scale security systems and has held leadership roles at Netskope and Arbor Networks. He is passionate about bridging deep technical insight with practical deployment strategies.

bio: Sam Curry is SVP & CISO at Zscaler and a Fellow at the National Security Institute. Prior to Zscaler, Sam was CSO & CPO at Cybereason, CTO & CISO for Arbor Networks (NetScout), and was CSO & SVP R&D at Microstrategy. He has also held executive roles at McAfee and CA. He spent seven years at RSA (EMC), as General Manager, CTO, Head of RSA Labs (MIT) and SVP of Product. Sam also has over two dozen patents, teaches undergraduate and graduate curricula (Wentworth Institute of Technology and Nichols College) and has been a leader in two successful startups. He is currently a Board Member of the Cybersecurity Coalition, Rampart Inc and most recently CyberTrust Massachusetts in addition to a number of advisor-ships. Sam has degrees in Physics, English, Philosophy, and Counter Terrorism.

bio: Tori Westerhoff is a Principal AI Security Researcher and Director of Microsoft's AI Red Team Operations. She manages the team of AI hackers who test high risk GenAI across models, systems, and products. Tori leads red teaming strategy for AI Security, Responsible AI, and Frontier Harms, driving innovation on AI red teaming methods for novel AI harms. Tori brings 15+ years of strategy, technology, and analytics experience across Microsoft and national security organizations, via Deloitte Consulting, such as the CIA, FBI, Department of State, and Homeland Security. Her broad approach to AI security pulls from her degree in Cognitive Neuroscience at Yale with Honors and her MBA from Wharton at UPenn, where she served as a Leadership Fellow and researched with Wharton Neuroscience Initiative.

bio: Richard Horne has been CEO of the NCSC since October 2024. Before joining the NCSC, He was a Cyber Security Partner and chair of the Cyber Security Practice at PwC UK, where he helped global boards and executives shape their cyber risk strategies and led the response to critical cyber incidents. He oversaw the post incident review for the Irish Health Service after the ransomware attack that disrupted healthcare services across Ireland in 2021. Before PwC, he was Managing Director of Cyber Security for Barclays PLC, where he was responsible for cyber security risk management. He has represented the UK on security matters at international organisations such as the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development, the European Commission and the International Standards Organisation.

bio: Wendi Whitmore is the Chief Security Intelligence Officer at Palo Alto Networks, where she leads efforts to transform complex cyberthreats into actionable intelligence. With over 20 years of experience, Wendi has built and led incident response and threat intelligence teams that have helped organizations respond to some of the most significant breaches in history. Previously, she led Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 and held executive roles at IBM, CrowdStrike, and Mandiant. Wendi began her career as a Special Agent with the US Air Force. She serves on cybersecurity advisory boards for Duke University and the University of San Diego, and was an inaugural member of the Cyber Safety Review Board launched by the United States Department of Homeland Security.

bio: Mr. Justin Fanelli is the CTO for the Dept of Navy and the Technical Director (TD) of PEO Digital. As CTO, his office is laser focused on measurably improving technology-driven mission outcomes within the Dept of Navy. As TD, his Program Executive Office is expediting the performant, secure transformation of enterprise information technology infrastructure. Central to both of these roles is unleashing the private-public mesh to innovate faster with higher value on investment outcomes than ever before seen. He currently serves as an Advisor for various national Science and Technology agencies and advisory boards inside and outside of government.

bio: Romaric Duvignau is an Associate Professor in the Distributed Computing and Systems research group at Chalmers University of Technology, Gothenburg, Sweden. His core research focuses on designing data-driven algorithms for distributed applications, addressing challenges in fault tolerance, cybersecurity, privacy, big data and streaming analytics. Prof. Duvignau's current interests include the efficient monitoring of large-scale distributed systems, intelligent data management and decision making in smart grids, federated learning, programmable networks, and network traffic classification. Recipient of Chalmers Pedagogic Prize 2023 and an Honorable Mention Award at USENIX Security 2025.

bio: Dr. Hugh Thompson is the Executive Chairman of RSAC and also leads the Conference Program Committee, where he is responsible for collaborating with the cybersecurity community to identify global trends and set the agenda for RSAC Conference. A world-renowned security expert and former Adjunct Professor at Columbia University, Hugh holds a BS, MS and PhD in applied mathematics. He has co-authored four books and more than 100 publications on security and has testified before Congress on cybersecurity. In 2006 he was named one of the “Top 5 Most Influential Thinkers in IT Security” by SC Magazine. Hugh is also a Managing Partner at Crosspoint Capital Partners.

bio: Robert McArdle is a Director in TrendAI'S Forward Looking Threat Research (FTR) and Adversary Intelligence and Monitoring (AIM) teams, where he is involved in analyzing and monitoring the latest cybercrime threats - specializing in researching the future threat landscape, Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI), and coordinating investigations with international law enforcement. Robert is a regular presenter for the press and at security conferences. He also has lectured in Malware Analysis and Cybercrime Investigations on MSc modules at Munster Technological University (MTU) and University College Dublin (UCD). He worries that his hobby and job are one and the same and constantly wonders if "normal" people have that problem.
globalBio: Robert McArdle is a Director in TrendAI'S Forward Looking Threat Research (FTR) and Adversary Intelligence and Monitoring (AIM) teams, where he is involved in analyzing and monitoring the latest cybercrime threats - specializing in researching the future threat landscape, Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI), and coordinating investigations with international law enforcement. Robert is a regular presenter for the press and at security conferences. He also has lectured in Malware Analysis and Cybercrime Investigations on MSc modules at Munster Technological University (MTU) and University College Dublin (UCD). He worries that his hobby and job are one and the same and constantly wonders if "normal" people have that problem.

bio: Zully Romero is a Architect at Bancolombia with a background in Information Security, certified in CISM, ITIL, and three AWS certifications including Solutions Architect Associate and AI Practitioner. Zully is also a leader of AWS Women Colombia, the largest community of women in tech in Latin America. Zully has experience in cloud governance, security architecture, vulnerability management, and platform assurance. Zully recently transitioned from security architecture to solution architecture to gain a more holistic view of the business and strengthen critical areas across the organization.

bio: Tom Patrick is an experienced cybersecurity professional who has spent over 15 years working in positions of leadership across cyber, security, intelligence, and defense roles in a variety of UK Government Departments. He is currently UK Representative for Cybersecurity in the United States, working closely with CISA and DoE CESER. In this, he leads in-country engagement for UK stakeholders on strategic initiatives to enhance the resilience of critical national infrastructure. He has fulfilled roles in cyber operations, risk management, cyber policy, and Information Security. He holds a Masters in Intelligence and International Relations and has worked on secondment in a UK cybersecurity technology startup.

bio: Stephen Hilt is a Senior Threat Researcher at TrendAI, specializing in cybercrime infrastructure and APTs. His work explores the overlap between cybercriminal actors and state sponsored operations, with a focus on attacker-built tooling, infrastructure abuse, and global threat ecosystems. Stephen has presented at conferences around the world and has authored many reports on evolving threat actor behavior.

bio: H.E. Dr. Mohamed Al Kuwaiti is the Head of Cyber Security for the UAE. Since his appointment in 2020, he has led national efforts to develop and implement cybersecurity strategies, elevating the UAE to the #1 position in the Global Cybersecurity Index 2024. He spearheads initiatives in emerging technologies, public-private partnerships, and international collaboration, representing the UAE on the global stage. He previously held key roles, including Executive Director of Government Operations at NESA and Chief Technical Analyst at the Ministry of Interior. With a 20-year career in defense and cybersecurity, he holds a Ph.D. from George Washington University and has earned numerous international awards for his leadership and contributions to the field.

bio: Chris Inglis serves on the boards of AIG, MITRE, Huntington Bancshares and Andesite and is advisor to Paladin Capital and Ballistic Ventures. Chris was US National Cyber Director from 2021-23, National Security Agency Deputy Director from 2006-14, and was a member of the departments of Computer/Cyber Science, and Mechanical Engineering at the US Military, Naval and Air Force Academies. He served on the US Defense Science Board, Navy Science Board, National Intelligence University Board, and Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Agency Advisory Council. He has graduate degrees from Columbia, Johns Hopkins and George Washington Universities, and an honorary doctorate from the National Intelligence University. He was a US Air Force command pilot and Brigadier General in active/reserve service.

bio: Cecilia curates RSAC™ Innovation Sandbox Contest which awards Most Innovative Startup annually. She launched RSAC™ Early Stage Expo, exposing nascent startups to industry decision makers. Tapping into her global network of venture capitalists, entrepreneurs, and accelerators she designs and moderates the monthly RSAC™ Innovation Showcase. To attract and support the next generation of cybersecurity warriors, she created RSAC™ Security Scholars program and RSAC™ College Day. Prior to working at RSAC, she spent seven years with Monitor Group, a boutique firm that develops new approaches to the complex problems facing the US Government Intelligence Community. She also served on the Commonwealth Club’s Inforum Board and currently serves on the Schools That Can’s Cyber Brain Trust.

bio: Jesse Tadlock is a cybersecurity leader with 15+ years of experience in defense and retail. As Group Director of Information Security at Walmart, he leads the Security Partners team, aligning cybersecurity with business delivery. His team's vision—“Effortless Security to Support the Speed of Business”—drives proactive collaboration with engineering to embed security from the start. Jesse previously led incident response at Raytheon with various other roles prior. He holds an MBA from Boston University, dual bachelor’s degrees from the University of Arizona, and CISSP and ITIL Expert certifications. A frequent speaker, Jesse is known for pragmatic leadership and mentoring of emerging talent.

bio: Rebecca Jarvis is an Emmy Award- winning journalist. She is ABC News’ Chief Business, Technology & Economics Correspondent; the host and creator of The Dropout, a top rated podcast which chronicles the rise and fall of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes; and the host and creator of the highly acclaimed No Limits with Rebecca Jarvis podcast, which features game changing women. As Chief Business, Technology & Economics Correspondent, Jarvis reports for all ABC News programs including Good Morning America, World News Tonight with David Muir, Nightline, 20/20, and This Week with George Stephanopoulos. She is a recipient of the Edward R. Murrow Award for Overall Excellence in Television and Radio. A graduate of the University of Chicago, Jarvis holds a degree in Economics and Constitutional Law.
globalBio: Rebecca Jarvis is an Emmy Award- winning journalist. She is ABC News’ Chief Business, Technology & Economics Correspondent; the host and creator of The Dropout, a top rated podcast which chronicles the rise and fall of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes; and the host and creator of the highly acclaimed No Limits with Rebecca Jarvis podcast, which features game changing women. As Chief Business, Technology & Economics Correspondent, Jarvis reports for all ABC News programs including Good Morning America, World News Tonight with David Muir, Nightline, 20/20, and This Week with George Stephanopoulos. She is a recipient of the Edward R. Murrow Award for Overall Excellence in Television and Radio. A graduate of the University of Chicago, Jarvis holds a degree in Economics and Constitutional Law.

bio: Mike Gordon is Vice President and Chief Information Security Office for Lockheed Martin Corporation. He is responsible for leading the corporation’s overall Information Security strategy, policy, security engineering, operations, and cyberthreat detection and response. With his 20 years of experience, Gordon oversees Intelligence Driven Defense® operations including both the Computer Incident Response Team and a global network of Security Intelligence Centers. Gordon is a Founder and is serving his 10th year on board of directors for the Defense Information Security Exchange and the National Defense Information Sharing and Analysis Center. Gordon also serves as the Chairman of the Defense Industrial Base Sector Coordinating Council for the protection of critical national infrastructures.
