bio: Leeron Walter is an award-winning marketing leader, startup advisor, AI expert, and Forbes Council member with over 15 years of experience driving growth for B2B SaaS and cybersecurity companies—from early-stage startups to global enterprises. As Vice President of Marketing & Strategy at Teramind, she is known for transforming complex technologies into high-impact business narratives, launching new categories, and executing innovative go-to-market strategies. Leeron is also a recognized global speaker and thought leader, specializing in authentic brand engagement and the intersection of cybersecurity, AI, and marketing innovation.

bio: Yaki Faitelson is the CEO and co-founder of Varonis. Under his leadership, Varonis has become the global leader in data security. With over two decades of experience in cybersecurity and enterprise technology, Yaki continues to drive innovation in data-centric security, helping organizations safeguard their most valuable information. Before founding Varonis, Yaki held leadership positions in the global professional services and systems integration divisions of NetVision and NetApp.

bio: Pamela Dingle is a veteran of the identity management world, working first as an identity architect and then in the Office of the CTO for Ping Identity. Pamela is now the Director of Identity Standards at Microsoft, where she collaborates in various industry contexts such as IETF, OpenID Foundation, FIDO Alliance, and Decentralized Identity Foundation to create the specifications that underlie modern identity. She is also a founder of Women in Identity.

bio: Despina Spanou is the Deputy Director-General in charge of the Directorate for Cybersecurity and Trust in the Directorate-General for Communications Networks, Content, and Technology (DG CONNECT) of the European Commission. She was previously the Head of the Cabinet of the Vice-President of the European Commission, Margaritis Schinas (2019-2024), covering security, migration and asylum, health, skills, education, culture, and sports. She is a Founding Member of the Women4Cyber initiative and advocate for the need for more cybersecurity experts in Europe. She also teaches EU Cybersecurity policy at Harvard Kennedy School. She is a member of the Athens Bar Association and holds a PhD in European law from the University of Cambridge.

bio: Gary Lopez is the Founder of Tinycode, a venture-backed startup helping organizations build and deploy safe and secure AI systems. Gary spent four years at Microsoft, most recently serving as a Principal Offensive AI Scientist. On the AI Red Team, he created PyRIT (Python Risk Identification Toolkit)—an open source tool now widely used across industry for AI security assessment. During his tenure, he helped lead dozens of red teaming operations and spearheaded work on catastrophic AI risks, including chemical and biological threats. Gary actively contributes to the community by training professionals at Black Hat and publishing research on AI security. Before Microsoft, he worked at Booz Allen Hamilton identifying and remediating zero-day vulnerabilities in critical infrastructure systems.

bio: Atul Tulshibagwale is the Senior Director of Continuous Identity Strategy at CrowdStrike. He was previously the CTO of SGNL, the leading continuous identity company that CrowdStrike acquired. Named in the Okta “Identity 25”, Atul is a federated identity pioneer and the inventor of the Continuous Access Evaluation Protocol (CAEP). He co-chairs the Shared Signals, AuthZen, and AI Identity Management groups in the OpenID Foundation. His leadership in developing and promoting SSF and CAEP, the critical Zero Trust standards, has influenced their widespread adoption. Apple, Google, IBM, Okta, and others have announced support for these standards. Previously, Atul was the Co-founder and CEO of Trustgenix, which created the first federated identity server and was acquired by HP.

bio: Satnam Singh Narang is an Independent Researcher who has tracked online scams since 2007. His work includes uncovering the first Tinder bots in 2014, a Twitter/X weight loss scam botnet of 750,000 accounts in 2015, cryptocurrency and Cash App giveaway scams in 2018-2019, various TikTok scams from 2019-2021, and comprehensive pig-butchering/romance baiting campaigns on dating apps and social media in 2024. His insights have been quoted in the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, BBC News, NBC Nightly News, and Bloomberg. Satnam is the creator of the "Scam Classification & Mapping System" (SC&MS) Framework, a publicly available, six-stage taxonomy for classifying scam lifecycles end-to-end.
globalBio: Satnam Singh Narang is an Independent Researcher who has tracked online scams since 2007. His insights have been quoted in the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, BBC News, NBC Nightly News, and Bloomberg. Satnam is the creator of the "Scam Classification & Mapping System" (SC&MS) Framework, a publicly available, six-stage taxonomy for classifying scam lifecycles end-to-end.

bio: Rebekah Skeete is the Chief Operating Officer at BlackGirlsHack, where she drives efforts to empower underrepresented groups in cybersecurity through education and mentorship. As a Senior Security Engineer, she develops cutting-edge solutions to combat cyberthreats, blending technical expertise with a talent for clear communication. A sought-after speaker, podcaster, and voice-over artist, Rebekah inspires audiences with her insights on tech, career growth, and diversity. Honored as a 2024 Dallas Business Journal 40 Under 40, she’s celebrated for her leadership, innovation, and commitment to creating opportunities for others in tech.
globalBio: Rebekah Skeete is the Chief Operating Officer at BlackGirlsHack, where she drives efforts to empower underrepresented groups in cybersecurity through education and mentorship. As a Senior Security Engineer, she develops cutting-edge solutions to combat cyberthreats, blending technical expertise with a talent for clear communication. A sought-after speaker, podcaster, and voice-over artist, Rebekah inspires audiences with her insights on tech, career growth, and diversity. Honored as a 2024 Dallas Business Journal 40 Under 40, she’s celebrated for her leadership, innovation, and commitment to creating opportunities for others in tech.

bio: Mihir Bellare is a cryptographer whose work has focused on the development of practical cryptography with proven-security guarantees. He obtained his BS at Caltech and his PhD at MIT. He worked at IBM Research before joining UCSD, where he is now a Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. He is a Fellow of the ACM, a Fellow of the IACR, a recipient of the ACM Paris Kanellakis Theory and Practice Award, a recipient of the Levchin prize and a recipient of a Packard Foundation Fellowship in Science and Engineering. He has an h-index of 123 and over 76,000 citations as per Google Scholar. Cryptographic algorithms that he has co-developed include HMAC, RSA-OAEP, RSA-PSS, and DHIES. Many of his algorithms have been standardized by NIST and are used in TLS.

bio: Anh Vu is a Security Researcher at the University of Cambridge. His work provides large-scale empirical insights into cyberspace and its societal impact, with a particular focus on underground subcultures that enable online crime, abuse, and harm. By integrating insights from both academia and industry, his work blends computer science and criminology to better understand emerging online threats and inform evidence-based safety and security policy. His research has received an Honourable Mention Award at the USENIX Security Symposium 2025 and has been featured in major news outlets, including New Scientist, Fast Company, and CoinDesk.

bio: With over 15 years of leadership, John Bates offers a unique dual perspective as a CISO and in-house attorney for global SaaS and technology firms. He specializes in translating complex regulations—including CCPA, GDPR, NIS2, DORA, and AI Governance—into actionable, business-driven strategies. He has built enterprise security programs from the ground up, integrating security-by-design into product lifecycles, and providing hands-on legal counsel during incident response. As a partner to boards and C-suites, he has helped Fortune 500 corporations navigate complex frameworks such as CMMC and NYDFS. By blending technical rigor with pragmatic legal guidance, he helps organizations mitigate emerging risks and harness Responsible AI for sustainable growth.

bio: A self-professed “massive geek” and renowned cyber security expert, James Lyne is an information security speaker committed to helping organisations and leaders understand real-world cyber threats and best practice. As Chief Strategy & Innovation Officer in the Office of the CEO at SANS Institute, James helps shape the future of cyber security education, research, and industry engagement. His passion for making cyber security accessible and engaging ensures his keynotes continually evolve alongside the threat landscape. James has delivered multiple TED talks, including at the main TED event, and regularly appears on international media such as CNN, NBC, BBC News, and Real Time with Bill Maher.

bio: Ian Glazer is the Head of Continuous Identity Product Strategy at CrowdStrike. His extensive career in identity includes serving as Chief Customer and Strategy Officer at SGNL, serving as SVP for Identity Product Management at Salesforce where he led product strategy, and acting as a Research Vice President at Gartner, overseeing identity and privacy research. A prominent figure in the industry, Ian is the Co-founder and Board Emeritus of IDPro. He also Co-founded and is a Board Member of the Digital Identity Advancement Foundation, which works to remove financial barriers to participation in the digital identity space. Throughout his career, he has co-authored a patent, contributed to user provisioning specifications, and is a noted blogger, speaker, and photographer of his socks.

bio: Sabrina Tharani is Mastercard's Senior Vice President of Fintech and Venture Partnerships, and the Global Head of Start Path. Prior to leading Start Path, Sabrina served as a Product Manager on Mastercard’s core payments team. Currently, Sabrina sits on The Leadership Committee of The Resolution Project and the Board of Directors of the FinSec Innovation Lab, supporting student-led ventures and early-stage cybersecurity startups. Sabrina has been recognized by American Banker, Venture Capital Journal, and Fintech Magazine for her leadership in fintech. She holds a BA in Economics and Sociology from the University of Michigan and an MBA. from Cornell University.

bio: Amir Zilberstein is a Managing Partner at Team8 and a successful serial entrepreneur. Amir has over 25 years of experience in the cybersecurity space. He has co-founded and served as CEO, Chairman, and board member of multiple companies, including Claroty (>$1B valuation; >$100M ARR), the leader in industrial control systems (ICS) and operational technology (OT) security; Waterfall Security Solutions, a developer of high-end security gateways for critical infrastructure; and Gita Technologies, a cybersecurity company in the government space (acquired by Verint Systems). Amir is the inventor and author of over ten patents, primarily in the field of cybersecurity. Amir holds a BS in Computer Science and Mathematics and an MS in Computer Science from Bar Ilan University in Israel.

bio: Etay Maor is the VP, Threat Intelligence at Cato Networks, a Founding Member of Cato CTRL, and an industry-recognized cybersecurity researcher. Prior to joining Cato in 2021, Etay was the Chief Security Officer for IntSights (acquired by Rapid7), where he led strategic cybersecurity research and security services. Etay has also held senior security positions at Trusteer (acquired by IBM) and RSA Security’s Cyber Threats Research Labs. Etay is an adjunct professor at Boston College and a guest lecturer at MIT. Etay holds a Master’s degree in Counterterrorism and Cyber-Terrorism and a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from IDC Herzliya.

Etay holds a Master’s degree in Counterterrorism and Cyber-Terrorism and a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from IDC Herzliya.

bio: Brad Medairy is a strategic technology leader driving Booz Allen’s national cyber business. At the forefront of AI, machine learning, cloud innovation, and intelligence tradecraft, Brad builds next-generation, defensive and offensive cyber solutions and products to tackle America’s toughest cyber challenges. A recognized voice in cybersecurity, AI, and national security, Brad was named a 2025 Tech100 Executive and a Top 50 Cybersecurity Leader by the Northern Virginia Technology Council. He is also a senior fellow at Auburn University’s McCrary Institute for Cyber and Critical Infrastructure Security, serves on the Billington Cybersecurity Advisory Board, and the University of Maryland, Baltimore County’s (UMBC) College of Engineering and Information Technology advisory board.

bio: GEN (Ret) Keith Alexander is a four-star general with a 40-year military career, culminating in the role of the Director of the National Security Agency and Chief of the Central Security Service from 2005-2014. He holds the distinction of serving in this role longer than any other director. While serving as the NSA Director, he was appointed by the President and confirmed by Congress to be the first Commander to establish and lead the US Cyber Command. He held this role from 2010-2014, establishing and defining how our nation is protected against cyber-attacks. In 2019, he received the 35th Oliver Baker Award from the Intelligence and National Security Affairs organization who recognizes extraordinary contributions to the Intelligence and national security affairs of the United States.
globalBio: GEN (Ret) Keith Alexander is a four-star general with a 40-year military career, culminating in the role of the Director of the National Security Agency and Chief of the Central Security Service from 2005-2014. He held this role from 2010-2014, establishing and defining how our nation is protected against cyber-attacks. In 2019, he received the 35th Oliver Baker Award from the Intelligence and National Security Affairs organization who recognizes extraordinary contributions to the Intelligence and national security affairs of the United States.

bio: George Kurtz is Founder and CEO of CrowdStrike, a leading provider of next-generation endpoint protection, threat intelligence, and services. George has more than 30 years of experience in the security space, including extensive experience driving revenue growth and scaling organizations across the globe. His entrepreneurial background and ability to commercialize nascent technologies have enabled him to drive innovation to market throughout his career. His prior roles at McAfee, a $2.5 billion security company, include Worldwide Chief Technology Officer and GM as well as EVP of Enterprise. Prior to joining McAfee, he started Foundstone, a worldwide security products and services company with one of the leading incident response practices. Foundstone was acquired by McAfee in October 2004.

bio: Philippe Lin is a Senior Threat Researcher with TrendAI Forward-looking Threat Research. He has dedicated more than a decade on threat intelligence, cybercrime study, data analysis, and big data processing. He is also a licensed amateur radio operator. His hobby is embedded system, firmware, and open source software. He actively participates in cybersecurity initiatives for NGO and NPO.

bio: As Head of Threat Research and Intelligence, Daniel Blackford leads Proofpoint’s program responsible for attribution and tracking of threat actor groups. Whether the focus is large scale botnets, credential phishing, business email compromise, or nation-state supported espionage, researchers on Dan’s teams are digging through seas of data every day to identify malicious activity and combat it in real-time. Prior to his time at Proofpoint, Daniel worked as a Malware Analyst at the NCFTA and got his start tracking adversaries with the US Army.

Prior to his time at Proofpoint, Daniel worked as a Malware Analyst at the NCFTA and got his start tracking adversaries with the US Army.

bio: Roland serves as Staff Director for the Subcommittee on Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection on the U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security, where he leads an oversight portfolio spanning cybersecurity, critical infrastructure resilience, artificial intelligence, and federal cyber regulatory harmonization. Prior to his current role, he served as a Senior Professional Staff Member on the Subcommittees on Counterterrorism and Intelligence and Transportation and Maritime Security. Before joining the House, he spent five years on the U.S. Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs and the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations. Roland also serves as Co-Founder and Director of Industry Engagement for the Congressional Staff Association on Artificial Intelligence.
globalBio: Roland serves as Staff Director for the Subcommittee on Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection on the U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security, where he leads an oversight portfolio spanning cybersecurity, critical infrastructure resilience, artificial intelligence, and federal cyber regulatory harmonization. Prior to his current role, he served as a Senior Professional Staff Member on the Subcommittees on Counterterrorism and Intelligence and Transportation and Maritime Security. Before joining the House, he spent five years on the U.S. Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs and the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations. Roland also serves as Co-Founder and Director of Industry Engagement for the Congressional Staff Association on Artificial Intelligence.

bio: Jacob Canter’s practice focuses on privacy, cybersecurity, intellectual property, and the burgeoning field of artificial intelligence (AI). Leveraging his experience across these areas of law, Jacob helps companies succeed through strategic counseling on how to comply with the laws, negotiations, and licensing to support business transactions and litigation when disputes arise.

bio: Will Pearce is CEO and co-founder of Dreadnode, the company providing infrastructure to build, evaluate, and deploy security agents. Previously he was AI Red Team Lead at NVIDIA and Microsoft, where he led efforts to attack AI systems and develop machine learning-enabled red team capabilities.

bio: Chenxi Wang is the Founder and General Partner of Rain Capital, a cybersecurity focused venture. A well-known operator, technologist, and thought leader in the cybersecurity industry, Chenxi also serves on the Board of Directors for MDU Resources, a Fortune 500 company. Chenxi recently Founded the Forte Group, a women-in-tech advocacy group. Previously, Chenxi served on the Board for OWASP. She was CSO at Twistlock, VP for Intel Security, and VP of Research for Forrester. She was recognized as a Women-of-Influence by "SC Magazine." Chenxi’s career began as a Faculty Member at Carnegie Mellon University. Chenxi holds a PhD in Computer Science from the University of Virginia.

bio: Jasmine Jaksic is a Senior Engineering Director at NVIDIA, where she leads IT product development and management. Previously, Jasmine worked at Google, Stripe, and SambaNova where she was instrumental in building and launching several pioneering products and technologies. She is a Founding Member of Istio, the leading open source service mesh that helps organizations run distributed, microservices-based applications anywhere. She also Co-Founded Posture Monitor, an application for posture correction that won Intel’s innovation award. Beyond her engineering work, she’s a prolific writer, with essays featured in The New York Times, Wired, NPR, Huffington Post, Newsweek, and InfoQ. She is the Author of “Life of a Silicon Valley Hipster” — a parody of all things Silicon Valley.

bio: Diksha leads the Global Payments & Fintech coverage for Bloomberg Intelligence (BI), based in Palo Alto. She has held various positions within BI including Sector head for Global financials, facilitating collaborative research across the US, Europe, and Asia. She has over 17 years of experience in both equity and credit. She was previously a Director at Standard Chartered Singapore covering banks and has worked with Nomura and Lehman Brothers in Hong Kong. Diksha frequently speaks at industry events as a keynote speaker, panelist, or moderator, sharing her views on financial industry developments, especially on its intersection with technology. Diksha received her MBA from the Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore. She is a gold medalist in Electronics Engineering from JMI, New Delhi.

bio: Patricia Titus, Field Chief Information Security Officer at Abnormal AI, is a global security leader with more than 25 years of experience shaping enterprise cybersecurity programs. She has held executive roles at Booking Holdings, Markel Corporation, Freddie Mac, Symantec, Unisys, and the TSA, where she drove strategies that safeguarded critical systems and aligned with international regulations. Renowned for her expertise in risk management, artificial intelligence, crisis response, and building resilient security operations, Patricia is also an active Board Member with Black Kite, the Girl Scouts of the Commonwealth of Virginia, and Glasswing Ventures, where she advances innovation and leadership in cybersecurity.

bio: Dan Wendlandt has been a leader in open source networking and security since helping start the Open vSwitch (OVS) project while at Nicira.  OVS became the most popular software-defined networking platform for Linux and as part of that work, Dan created and was the technical lead for the OpenStack Networking project (now called OpenStack Neutron).  Dan now focuses his energy on Cilium (http://www.cilium.io). Cilium using a powerful new Linux kernel technology called eBPF to bring service and API-aware network security (e.g., HTTP, gRPC, Kafka) to Linux-based container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, and Mesos.
